loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Savorn is a farmer from the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 63 years old and a widowed mother of five children. To cover the daily cost of living for her entire household, she raises pigs as the main source of income and works as a paid worker for another fee. She has been involved with this business for 40 years and it earns her about 35,700 KHR per day.

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two loans which she has repaid. This loan has enabled her to improve her living conditions. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group loan is 2,600,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy pig’s feed and more pigs to raise. She believes that her business will improve gradually so that she is able to increase her income and keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pig’s feed and more pigs to raise

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Meshack is married and has three children. He runs a boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) business while his wife runs a grain-grinding mill. Both Meshack and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, bananas, eucalyptus, wood rock, and they are rearing cattle on their farm. Meshack is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey and earn him some income and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Meshack’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Meshack’s hope for the future is to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ogla

texts.en:
Ogla lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Ogla is married and has four children. She runs a hotel business. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing vegetables and maize, and they also rear cattle on their farm. Ogla is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey and earn her some income.

This is Ogla’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Ogla’s hope for the future is to have an improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Memelyn

texts.en: Memelyn lives in Ubay, Bohol with her family. She is a mother of two children. Memelyn has been in the farming business with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. Memelyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Memelyn hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Pak

texts.en: Pak is a 63 year-old a resident of Kandal Stoeng province. She is married and blessed with two kids, one of whom is in school. To feed the family, she does rice farming as her main source of income. The lack of financial aid to support her child in school is the main challenge for her. To overcome this problem she is seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the third cycle loan for Pak and she will spend her entire loan on covering school fees for her son who wants to pursue a master's degree majoring in Philosophy. She has strong hopes that her son will get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To cover school fees

loans.name: Dianning

texts.en:
Dianing lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Dianing is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Dianing began working with Ruma one year ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has around $300 - 301 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa works hard to support her family. Nicolasa is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nicolasa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Nicolasa has been in this business for 6 years now.

Nicolasa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bananas, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Cheav's Group

texts.en:
Cheav is 40 years old and a local villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a married mother of three dependent children who are in school. To earn a living, the family's main source of income is rice cropping and paid work is the secondary source of income. This is the third loan for Cheav and the first loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, Cheav's living conditions are better than before, the result of the positive impact of her past loan. 

For this cycle, Cheav and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide and to pay for labor. She strongly believes that she can gain a higher income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Lonn's Group

texts.en:
From Banteay Mean Chey province where her crop is grown, Lonn is 62 years old and the mother of one daughter. She tackles her daily cost of living via rice farming and maize planting.  She has been involved in this business for several years and it generates about 21,000 KHR per day. This is the sixth loan for her and the seventh loan for her joint borrower in this group of two. The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have enabled her to lift up her lifestyle more than before. 

For this cycle, Lonn is the leader of her group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop, to pay plowing fees, and to cover labor costs. She hopes that she can gain a higher yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop, to pay plowing fees, and to cover labor costs

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is a 43-year-old married man with five children aged 20, 16, 10, 7 and 4 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a clinical officer and that is where he earns a living, although he also owns a drug shop to earn extra income. He started this business to earn income for the betterment of his family. He faces a challenge of low pay but has hopes of becoming self-employed.

Gad is requesting a loan to complete construction of his house.

loans.use: to complete construction of his house.

loans.name: Yanto

texts.en:
Yanto lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Yanto is married and lives with five persons in the family home.

Yanto began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $197 - 198 in sales per month on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Isaiah is married and has five children. He runs a transport business and he also provides tractors for ploughing. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty five years now and they are currently growing maize, vegetables and beans as well as rearing cattle in their farm. Isaiah is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey.

This is Isaiah’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Isaiah’s hope for the future is to have his children educated and to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: Ella se llama claudia  carolina, tiene 31 años, vive en la ciudad de bogota, es madre soltera manicurista  a domicilio  pero no titulada, decidió iniciar estudios en campo alto  en la carrera técnica administración en salud para así tener un mejor futuro para ella y para los hijos, como ya se hizo saber  anteriormente por ser madre soltera tiene que cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar y no le alcanza para cubrir la mensualidad que campo alto requiere, ella quiere solicitar la ayuda de kiva porque piensa que es indispensable  el estudio para el progreso, aparte de esto la vocación es de prestar servicio al cliente y ayuda a la comunidad por esto escogió esta carrera que va acorde con la personalidad y vocación.
texts.en: Her name is Claudia Carolina, she is 31 years old, and lives in Bogota. She is a single mother who works from home as a manicurist but is not licensed. She decided to begin studies in CampoAlto in the technical career of Health Administration so she can have a better future for herself and her children. As she already mentioned, as a single mother she has to cover all of the household expenses and she is unable to cover the monthly fee that CampoAlto requires. She wants to request help from Kiva because she thinks that studying to better oneself is invaluable, and apart from that, this job is to provide service to the client and help the community, which is why she chose it in accordance with her personality and her work.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of enrollment.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

William is married and has six children. He is a cattle auctioneer. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty two years now and they are currently growing maize and trees as well as rearing cattle. William is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey, it will earn him some income, and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is William’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. William’s hope for the future is have a more fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Joshua is married and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize and rearing dairy cattle on their farm. Joshua is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Joshua’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Joshua’s hope for the future is to enjoy his retirement.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has three children. She is a nurse while her husband is a lecturer. They are both farmers. They have been farming for thirteen years now and they are currently growing maize, beans and fruits as well as rearing livestock. Lilian is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey, earn her some income, and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Lilian’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to improve her family’s lifestyle. Lilian’s hope for the future is to increase her income.

Lilian lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and has five children. He is a businessman. Both he and his wife have been farming for thirty three years now and they are currently growing maize and rearing cattle in their farm. David is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey, earn him some income, and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is David’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. David’s hope for the future is to have a more fulfilling life.

David lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael es un hombre felizmente casado. Ismael tiene tres hijos, vive con ellos en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que no es de su propiedad, tiene un acuerdo de renta conocido como anticretico. Aunque la casa cuenta con todos los servicios (luz, agua y alcantarillado) Ismael se dedica al negocio del transporte, tiene condiciones duras de trabajo ya que debe trabajar de siete a una de la mañana, por lo que corre riesgos de accidente. Ismael es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, necesita credito para renovar su anticretico, pues a Ismael le gusta donde vive pero el dueño ha fijado un nuevo monto de arriendo para el anticretico.
texts.en: Ismael is a happily married man. Ismael has three children, and he lives with them in a house of brick and cement which is not his own property. He has a rental contract known as an anticretico. Although the house includes all of the services (electricity, water and sewage system), Ismael makes a living in the transportation business. He has tough working conditions since has has to work from 7 until 1 in the morning, which means he runs the risk of accidents. Ismael is the sole source of income in his household, and needs a loan to renew his anticretico since Ismael likes where he lives but his landlord has set a new rental amount for the home.

loans.use: to renew the rental contract for his family's home

loans.name: Kahoru

texts.en:
Kahoru is 28 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is married to Leah. They have two children who are aged four years and seven months.

Kahoru has a farming business that he has been running for the past three years. He has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy farm inputs like seedlings and also to pay for labor charges. He will use the profits to expand his business.

He hopes to upgrade his dairy cows in the near future to help boost his income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seedlings.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wilma is 55 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Wilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Wilma has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 50 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business,raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 49-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce where he sells maize and coffee as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses, like agriculture, where he earns an extra income. Julius started this business to sustain his family and have better standards of living. He faces a challenge of competition and weather changes that affect his profit margin. He has a vision of owning a big modern produce store so as to increase his income.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Ken is married and has four children. He is an employee with the County government. Both he and his wife have been farming for fifteen years now and they are currently growing maize, bananas, vegetables and beans in their farm. Ken is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Ken’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Ken’s hope for the future is to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Diosdada works hard to support her family.

She has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Diosdada is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional amount of mobile load to sell for her electronic mobile load retailing business.

Diosdada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional amount of mobile load to sell

loans.name: Diadiza

texts.en:
Diadiza is 59 years old and married with seven children. Diadiza works very hard to provide for them.

Diadiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Diadiza has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft-drinks and other items. 

In the future Diadiza would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, who is a 57-year-old married woman, lives in Gori city. She has a husband, a son, a daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Tamar's husband is a commandant at the theatre and generates 250 GEL monthly. Tamar works hard in a private bakery as a baker and gets approximately 350 GEL.

In order to increase her family's income and do her bit for her grandsons' welfare, Tamar wants to start her own business and has requested a loan. Her request was approved through the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. She will use the loan to start a business trading fruits and vegetables. Tamar will sell a wide assortment of products at the local market. Her customers will be locals and passersby. Her son will also help Tamar to improve their family's living conditions. They rely on the good will of lenders and greatly appreciate your support.

loans.use: To start a business trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a hardworking 43-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income, alongside practicing agriculture. He started this business to earn more money and look after his family. He has personal goals of educating his children and owning a wholesale shop. His main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet increasing demands. He hopes to have a wholesale shop in the future.

Amos intends to use the loan to buy more soap, crates of soda, and bags of sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, crates of soda and bags of sugar to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Salome is married and has three children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for six years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, sunflowers and indigenous trees, and they also rear cattle on their farm. Salome is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey and the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Salome’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Salome’s hope for the future is to start a retail business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Stephen is married and has four children. He is a teacher as well as a counselor. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for sixteen years now and they are currently growing maize and coffee as well as rearing livestock in their farm. Stephen is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Stephen’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Stephen’s hope for the future is to educate his children and enjoy his retirement.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Faapaia is a 41 year old single woman with no children.She runs a small plantation to earn a living and she has been doing this for many years. Faapaia requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, rake, knife, backpack sprayer, taro roots, and banana tube to assist her running the business.She became a member of SPBD in 2014. Faapaia will use her profits to help her family everyday needs and improved her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, rake, knife, backpack sprayer, taro roots, and banana tube.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 48-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in a retail shop business where he earns a living alongside contractors. He started this business to look after his family. He has hardships of competition and inadequate capital to meet the high demand, while his dream is to diversify his business.

He intends to use the loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beer, and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beer, and soda to sell.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Ederlina has been in this business for 11 years. Ederlina earns more income from pig fattening.

Ederlina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, que quiere iniciar su negocio de venta de  mercancía (ropa de dama y caballero), que pretende comprar en las ciudades, para vender en su municipio, entre familiares, vecinos y amigos. Su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de diversas prendas como jeans, camisetas, blusas, chaquetas y otros, con lo que pretende generar su propio ingreso y sustento. El sueña con montar una distribuidora de ropa en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising young man who is 22 years of age. He wants to start a business of selling merchandise (men’s and women’s clothing). Juan intends to buy his products in the cities and then sell them in his town to relatives, neighbors, and friends.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of various garments such as jeans, T-shirts, blouses, jackets, and other items. Juan intends to generate his own income so that he can support himself. He dreams of establishing a clothing distribution center in the city.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts, blouses, jackets, and other types of garments to sell.

loans.name: Elena Celina

texts.es: Elena es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a la fabricación de artesanías en un local que tiene en su casa. La actividad la aprendió como legado familiar y desde hace 15 años tiene su negocio, donde ella misma fabrica y pinta la cerámica y la vende en distintos locales del oriente Antioqueño, por lo que ya tiene bastantes y buenos clientes. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de material para su negocio (moldes en cerámica, pinturas) y poder incrementar sus ingresos, porque su sueño a corto plazo es comprar un vehículo en el que pueda transportar su mercancía hasta el cliente final.
texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking woman who is devoted to making crafts in a shop that is located in her home. She learned this trade because it is a family tradition and at the age of 15, she already had her own business. Elena produces and paints ceramics and then sells her products to different shops in the eastern part of the Department of Antioquia. She already has several good customers.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for her business (ceramic molds and paints) so that she can increase her earnings. Her dream in the short term is to buy a vehicle so that she can transport her products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy paints and ceramic molds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Lappa for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and to pay the cost of maintaining them.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Rina is married and lives with five persons in the family home.

Rina began working with Ruma two years ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has around $79 - 80 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Nurhasanah

texts.en:
Nurhasanah lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Nurhasanah is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Nurhasanah began working with Ruma one year ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has earned around $76 - 77 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Rakhsana

texts.en: Rakhsana is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in business selling animals with the support of her husband. They have been working together for the past six years and make a sufficient amount of income to bear their household expenses. She has seven children; she is very motivated to meet their basic necessities. For the improvement of her business she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. With this loan amount she will be able to purchase more animals for resale. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a  married woman and a mother of three children. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business, selling various items to the people in her place. She has also been engaged in a rice-farming business for several years now. 

Grace is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Grace has hopes of making her business a successful one. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. Julita is married and has a funeral parlor business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Julita has been in this business for 1 year now.

Julita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Sunita is a 24-year-old lady living in Sindibahali village in the Kalahandi District with her three children and her husband. In the picture, the lady seated in the yellow sari with her hand raised is Sunita. Her husband is a farmer. She got married at a very young age and she did not get much opportunity to study. So she only did her primary studies. Her husband’s income is not high enough to fulfill all the dreams of her children. So she decided to do vegetable cultivation to earn money.She cultivate and sells vegetables in the market and in her village. She is happy with what she is doing and is planning to expand her business of vegetable cultivation. She formed a Self Help Group named Maa Samaleswari SHG with some other women from her neighborhood and now she is the president of her group. 

Sunita, along with her group members, requested a loan to invest in her business activity. She will use her portion to purchase seeds and fertilizers for vegetable farming. She sells the vegetables in the market and in her village. She is happy with what she is doing and planning to expand her business of vegetable cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for vegetable farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, sweets, sodas and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 48-year-old married lady, and runs a small general store in her community with her husband (also shown in the photo).  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Kousar has eight years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Kousar makes enough to provide for her family. In order to fully stock the store, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Kousar wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Gogosina

texts.en: Gogosina is a 27 year old married  woman with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store(food stall) and selling them in her community to earn a living and she has been doing this since 2005.Gogosina requested a loan to buy a box of canned fish, sack of sugar, sack of flour, sack of salt,and a box of chicken to help her running the business.Gogosina became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain more help for her business.She will use her earning to buy more items of her business and help provide for her family everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy a box of canned fish, sack of sugar, sack of flour, sack of salt, and a box of chicken.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nancy has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, canned goods, milk, juice, etc. 

In the future, Nancy would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 36-year-old married woman. She has five children. Rose describes herself as vibrant. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. 

Rose describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open a cereal store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM; her previous loan was repaid successfully. Rose will use the anticipated profits to buy stock of cereal to sell.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Elzebeth

texts.en:
Elzebeth is a 27-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, is involved in a business of selling animals in their locality. She has five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices and brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices.  

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more animals.  She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old, married and has seven children. Four of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 17 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 47, is a married woman. She has been doing a business of selling animals for many years to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and education.  She makes enough through her business to bear their household expenditures. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her sixth loan cycle and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This will help her to purchase two more calves. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 41 years old and married with one kid.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mildred is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mildred has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 52-year-old vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. Perveen stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Perveen requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.  This will create a means of increasing revenues so Perveen can generate a healthier source of income. Perveen is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Doña Paula de 54 Años de edad gracias a su primer financiamiento pudo asistir sus cultivos de café logrando comprar formula cafetalera, fórmula para crecimiento, urea entre otros que ayudaron a dar protección a la plantación para posteriormente recolectar un buen grano para su venta el cual trajo muy buenas ganancias. Gracias a ello, ella pudo vender el grano a los diferentes compradores de la zona e intermediarios y cancelar su compromiso en su totalidad por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL. Nuevamente Doña Paula solicita su segundo financiamiento el cual será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes y el pago de mano de obra para limpieza de la propiedad y la planta la cual es necesaria ya que después del corte la planta y la propiedad quedan deterioradas por lo que es necesario asistir nuevamente para poder sacar una excelente cosecha para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Doña Paula is 54 years old. Thanks to her first loan, she was able to maintain her coffee crops by purchasing coffee plant formula, growth formula, urea, and other supplies to help protect them. Later on, she was able to harvest good quality coffee beans and generate a very nice profit from her sales. Paula was able to sell her coffee beans to different buyers and brokers in the area. She was able to repay her financial commitment in full thanks to the support provided by the different lenders on the Kiva platform and their partnership with the COMIXMUL cooperative.

Doña Paula is requesting her second loan, which will be used to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor so that her property can be cleared. This step is necessary for the plants. After the plants are pruned the property looks decimated, but this is required maintenance that will bring forth an excellent harvest for this season.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in the village Azatamut in Tavush region. She now works at the bread factory as a baker. At the same time, she is engaged in agriculture and farming with her husband. She has not a small farm where she takes care of two cows, eight piglets, 20 chickens, ten geese and three beehives. She also cultivates wheat on her plot of land and raises apple trees. The main income for this family is from farming and the sale of its products (milk, meat, eggs, honey, wheat and apples). 

Anush has three children: a son and two daughters. Her son is already a student at the paid division of Ijevan State Institute at the Faculty of Natural Sciences. Anush says that her family income allows her to solve only the most urgent and everyday needs of the family, and her son’s tuition fee has become a great problem for her family.

She asks a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams for paying her son’s second semester tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her son’s second semester tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Television screen, movies and improve the premises

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 56 years old and is a dedicated mother of three children. She is efficiently doing business selling animals with the support of her husband. Rani purchases small calves and goats,and after bringing them up for a year or two, she sells them near the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan). 

At present, Rani has three buffaloes and two cows. She earns a good profit from this business. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. For the improvement of her business, Rani contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. Rani is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Ichelegbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ICHELEGBE 1 est composé de dix personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, nommée Tchossè Joséphine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 59 ans a très peu fréquenté l'école. Tchossè Joséphine est une veuve Tchossè Joséphine vit seule. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par Tchossè Joséphine. C’est pour cette raison Tchossè Joséphine vend divers articles et du pétrole dans sa région depuis une trentaine d’années pour pouvoir subvenir à ces besoins. Tchossè Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de diversifier son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Tchossè Joséphine ensemble avec les membres du groupement ICHELEGBE 1 sollicitent pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ichelegbe 1 group is comprised of 10 people who live in the same area. The group representative, Tchossè Joséphine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 59 and spent very little time in school. Tchossè Joséphine is a widow who lives by herself. 

Tchossè Joséphine assumes the various household expenses. To meet her needs, Tchossè Joséphine has been selling miscellaneous items and gasoline in her region for 30 years. Tchossè Joséphine gets her supplies in a market in Benin. 

With the goal of diversifying her business and better meeting her clients' needs, Tchossè Joséphine and the other members of the Ichelegbe 1 group are asking for a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: buy miscellaneous items and gasoline.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Aside from raising pigs, Remedios helps her husband working in their own farm to make a living. With her income from selling pigs, her previous loan used for buying piglets was successfully repaid. Farming is their main source of income and she wants to have a greener farm and more produce to sell. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Improving her piggery and the general livings condition of the entire family is her dreams that soon come true with her patience and determination.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Farmeeda

texts.en:
Farmeeda is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfil their family demands including for food, health, clothing and education. She has been doing work in agriculture along with her husband for many years. She crops different vegetables and sells them in the local market. Her daughter also assists in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Farmeeda has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She sells frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish. Rosita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods and dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods and dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He is 31 years old, married and he has two children. Tigran has a higher education; he graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Painting and Drawing. As Tigran says, if given a chance to choose a specialty once more, he will again choose painting.

He is an unbelievably romantic person with a great sense of love towards nature and its colors, its sounds and silences. He has sound knowledge of this field which allows him to teach. Now he is a Deputy Director of Education at the school, and at the same time he is a lecturer in drawing and painting at the college. As he says, he teaches his pupils and students to see colors and to interpret things naturally without any changes. He says that for example, looking at the picture one must see not only the color of the sun, but also feel its warmth. Tigran also has a small workshop in his house and he takes orders for different pictures and paints them here. 

He asks for a loan since he wants to buy canvases for painting, and he also wants to buy a color printer since it will help him to prepare the themes for his students nicely and in colored versions.

loans.use: to buy canvases for painting and to buy a color printer, which will help him to prepare the themes for his students nicely and in colored versions.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family. 

Robinah has a business in tailoring and has been in this business for 15 years. She works in a shop seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and defaulters. She has applied for a loan of 2,800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material and threads. She is aspiring to own a tailoring school and also to own an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing material and threads.

loans.name: Esmael

texts.en: Esmael, 38 with two children, has been operating his transportation services to make a living. For more than three years, he was able to provide the family and had successfully repay his previous loan used for repairing the vehicle. With his generated revenue, he was able to support his children's education. To replace old used tires, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new tires. Int he future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Delfa

texts.en: Delfa has been selling sea foods for more than five years to make a living. With her generated revenue, she was able to provide clothing needs of her four children and other household expenses. She had also successfully repay her previous loan used in buying more sea foods for sale. She find ways to improve sales. Aside from this, she also had a farm where she earns income for it is their main source of income. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to boost the farm.  Delfa hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Naghma

texts.en: Naghma is 45 years old and a married woman. She is in the business of sewing clothes. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will create a means of increasing revenue so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her forth loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 34 years old and an energetic, married woman. She is officially involved in the business of cattle sales and purchases with her husband. She has two buffaloes and three cows. She has been running this business for many years. She buys small animals at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. Nusrat is in her third loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Ninikuru Group

texts.fr:
Joseph fait partie du groupe  Ninkuru  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 43 ans et est marié  à  Sylvie, une cultivatrice .Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés   de 7 à  19  ans tous étudient.


Il fait le commerce de bière  depuis 14 ans. 

Il est  à son treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de casiers de bière à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Joseph is a member of the Ninkuru group and lives in Gitega. He is 43 years old and married to Sylive, a farmer. Together, they have four children between 7 and 19 years old. All of them go to school. 

He has been selling beer for 14 years. 

This is his 13th loan with Turame. With his Kiva credit, he will increase his capital and buy a number of cases of beer that he will resell to earn more money. 

In the next few years, he would like to see his children stay in school.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a number of cases of beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en: Elfa is married and she helps her husband working in their own farm for a living. She earns well from this, their main source of income. With her generated income, she was able to purchase motorcycle used for transportation services and also to carry their farm produce. She also had successfully repay her previous loan used fertilization. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit for motorcycle maintenance costs. She wants to have a better living with her family in the future.

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Lusila

texts.en: Lusila is a 29 year old  woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Lusila has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, rake, knife, water tank, taro roots and banana tube to help her running the business.She has been a member of SPBD in 2010. With her profits she will support her family and improved her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, rake, knife, water tank, taro roots and banana tube.

loans.name: Kajiramugari's Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kambale est une commerçante depuis 16 ans, âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Esther ». Elle est vendeuse de maïs. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché du quartier commercial. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 4 sacs de maïs. Son conjoint est un chauffeur dans une entreprise de la place. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de la tontine. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Kambale, has been a merchant for 16 years. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children who all go to school. The client is a member of the "Esther" business association. 

She sells corn in a local market. She is asking for a loan from Hekima in order to grow her business. She will buy four bags of corn. Her spouse is a driver for a local business. She will start her business with funds from her savings group. 

In the future, she would like to grow her capital, and educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system, and for granting them loans during this post-conflict time in the east of the country.

loans.use: buy four bags of corn.

loans.name: Deciba

texts.en: Deciba, 54, married with six children operates their own farm for a living.She does planting, weeding and harvesting crops with her husband. For many years in farming, Deciba sustained their living and had support her children's needs. In order to increase farm produce, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new seedlings and fertilizer. with this, she is hopeful for a greener and more produce to deliver it in the market. In the near future, she wants to save some revenue and able to improve the farm to gain more for a better future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en: Vineta is a 35 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business of selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. Vineta has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, yeast, fry pan, gas stove and plastic bags to help her running the business.She joined SPBD in 2013. Vineta will use her profits support her family everyday needs and hope to expand her business for the near future.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, yeast, fry pan, gas stove and plastic bags.

loans.name: Renei Fe

texts.en: Renei Fe has been earning from her transportation services business for more than five years earning well for the family.With her generate income, she was able to repay her previous loan used for maintenance successfully. To improve the services, she took a new loan to buy new tires in order to replace the old used one. In the future, Renei Fe wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new set of tires

loans.name: Irafasha Group

texts.fr:
Médiatrice fait partie du groupe  Irashitsa  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 33 ans et est mariée  à Ezéchiel, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce des habits   depuis 8 ans 

Elle est  à son quinzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait voir ses enfants  étudier et leur acheter des parcelles.
texts.en:
Médiatrice is a member of the Irashitsa group who lives in Gitega. She is 33 years old and is married to Ezéchiel, a driver. Together they have two children. 

She has been selling clothing for eight years. 

This is her 15th loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing that she will resell to earn more money. 

In the next few years, she would like to see her children go to school, and she would like to buy them parcels of land.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing that she can resell to earn more money.

loans.name: María Isabelina

texts.es:
María, a sus 54 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con empeño y dedicación.
Actualmente trabaja como auxiliar de cocina en un restaurante y alterna su empleo trabajando de manera independiente en un taller de confecciones que inició en su vivienda, allí elabora todo tipo de lencería para el hogar como cortinas, sábanas, cojines, manteles, y otros artículos decorativos, que ofrece entre sus familiares y amigos, así complementa los ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, cintas, resortes) esto le permitirá tener una mayor variedad de telas con texturas y colores diferentes que satisfagan los gustos de su clientela y así mejorar los ingresos que percibe por la labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un taller de confecciones bien acreditado y estructurado, que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y le garantice una rentabilidad y estabilidad económica para independizarse totalmente, así podrá continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia, mientras genera recursos para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, married, and has five children who she got ahead with effort and dedication.

She works as a kitchen helper in a restaurant and also works on her own in a tailor shop in her home.  She makes all types of linen for the home, such as curtains, sheets, pillows, table cloths, and other decorative articles that she offers to her family and friends.  This way she complements her income to help her husband with the household finances.

She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies in quantity (fabrics, threads, laces, and springs).  This will allow her to have a variety of fabrics of different colors and textures to satisfy her customer needs and increase her income.

Maria says that her greatest desire is to have a well accredited and structured sewing workshop that will allow her to create jobs and guarantee financial stability so she can become completely independent.  This way she can continue working toward her family’s wellbeing while she generates income to provide her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel, a mother of two has been in her transportation services business for more than four years. She earns well from this and was able to repay successfully her previous loan used for repairs and tires. He always find ways to improve their income. For the long time of using the said vehicle, it needs maintenance. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. In the future, Liezel wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is a 35-year-old married woman from the Akhaltsikhe district. She lives with her 2 school-aged daughters and husband, who works at the furniture workshop and is paid well. Despite this, his salary is the only source of income for the family and isn't enough to pay all the family costs, especially when they have children, who need a lot for education and other everyday expenses. 

Dali has decided to set up her own activity and has requested money. She will use this money to purchase bees and start beekeeping. After that Dali will be able to start trading with honey. She will generate some income and will improve her family's living conditions in some ways. 

Dali will be really grateful for lenders giving her the chance to do her bit for her family's welfare. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To start beekeeping

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn   is 36 years old and a mother of two, married and lives with her family. She had a transportation services  business and her husband works as an Overseas Filipino Worker. She earns better income from this activities aside from his husband's salary. 
Merlyn  requested this  loan to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to continue providing her family . She wants to have a merchandise business in the near future.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Meet Margaret a farmer living in Muranga area of Central Kenya with her husband and 3 children.She is a well established farmer who loves her work because it has been bringing her very good returns and has been doing it for 20 years.Her primary source of income is tea,vegetables,she also has a retail business.Her biggest challenge is labor and transport.
Margaret chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they assist small holder farmers in enhancing their agri-businesses at a low interest rate.This loan will enable her purchase a dairy cow for more milk production and hence get more income and also for the consumption by her family.

loans.use: For purchasing of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 42-year-old married woman who has been doing business selling milk for the past 6 years. She has 2 calves and 1 milk cow. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life, and she is very motivated to provide her family with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is her 6th year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business through its support. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Rayimsom Group

texts.fr:
Mr TEBDEBWAOGA CLAUDE est responsable du groupe RAYIMSON .Il est Célibataire sans enfant.  Il n'a pas de charge.
Mr fait de la menuiserie depuis 16ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les quincailleries en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter 03cartons de serrures, des paquets de points et des tôles.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son atelier. Il ambitionne travailler à ce que l’atelier devienne une entreprise et s’occuper de sa famille (ses parents).
texts.en:
Tebdebwaoga Claude is the representative of the Rayimson Group.  He is single, has no children and is not responsible for anyone other than himself.  He has worked as a carpenter for sixteen years.  He buys his supplies at hardware stores in town.  Most of his customers are women.

Tebdebwaoga Claude will use his loan to buy three boxes of locks, sheeting and other carpentry supplies.  He will use his earnings to expand his workshop.  He would like his workshop to grow and become a company in the future.  This would allow him to take care of his family (his parents).

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of locks, sheeting and other carpentry supplies for use in his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar sends her greetings to Kiva lenders and describes her new plans for the loan that she has decided to take once more! 

Her first Kiva loan was used for the purchase of a new computer and printer for her work as a coach of high-level athletes. Gohar works at the Vanadzor Athletics and Winter Sports Center as the administrator-coach-pedagogue of the center. She has over 38 years of sporting experience. Gohar graduated from the State Institute of Physical Culture of Armenia and she was awarded the title of Honored Coach of Armenia. In 2012, the European Association of Athletics awarded her the Best Women's Coach of the Year. Gohar is married and has a son who has also become a sportsman.
 
Gohar is asking for her second Kiva loan of 300,000 Armenian drams (AMD) since she must take part in a teaching and coaching assembly abroad, so the loan will help her to pay for the traveling costs.

loans.use: to pay for traveling costs to take part in a teaching and coaching assembly abroad

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house, and she has 4 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market as he has built many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to expand her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad, aged 41, is a married woman. 

She deals in business selling animals. She buys small animals at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will help her to purchase more calves and heifers, and she will definitely be able to increase her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more calves and heifers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives with her husband and daughter in Zuygaghbyur village. Her husband used to be an army officer and currently he doesn't work and is required with retirement pension. Mariam herself has been running a farm. She keeps a livestock of 2 cows and 18 sheep and also cultivates some grass as forage for the livestock.
Mariam also owns a plot of arable land where she would like to organize cultivation of some vegetables and increase agricultural income. Therefore, Mariam has applied for this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation. The loan will be a big support for Mariam and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza  is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a poultry farming business which she has been in for over 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,0000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of poultry feed, vaccines and chicks. She generates additional income from rental houses. She works seven days out of the week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to own a big poultry farm and also to educate her children up to a university-level.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the timely loans. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed, vaccine and chicks.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda, a mother od three has been farming for more than five years. He earns well from this and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used this loan for buying farm inputs. To improve the farm, she  took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit buy organic fertilizer and seedlings for this cropping season.   In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her family a better future. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loan.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala is a 35-year-old married woman. She decided to work to support her family for a better future. Five years ago she began sewing work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her 4th loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 45,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers. It will help her to meet the increasing demands of her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz, aged 44, is a married woman.  She is in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is married, 44 years old and a mother of three who runs an general store  in their village. For more than five years, she earns well and was able to provide her children needs. She had her workers that helped her in her business. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell .She wants to have a comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood is a 25-year-old lady and enjoys hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory.  She makes a good amount of income to contribute to her family's income. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. Through these items, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is married operates a farm with her husband  to earn a living. For many  years in this growing crops, the couple decided to build a store in their village, it helps a lot to support her husband’s income . She had sustained her business and was able to cover household expenses while waiting for the harvest time. Recently, she borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Sonia wants t to expand her business to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jeshinda

texts.en: Jeshinda is a 57-year-old married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. She also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be limited land for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a dairy cow . Her business goal is to be a major supplier of milk within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to be made up into clothing for sale.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is an agronomist from Isahakyan village. She lives there with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 5 years old). 
Nelli runs a small farm which includes livestock (chickens, cows and calves) and also cultivates wheat and grass. 
Nelli's husband helps her with farming activities and sells the gathered milk and meat in local markets. 
By applying for this loan Nelli asks USD 1000 to be able to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel for enlarging her land cultivation process. She will be very grateful if lenders support her with the loan and give her an opportunity to enrich her business.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, ferilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza, who is 59 years old married woman, lives in village Zeda Vani. She lives with her husband and both are involved in agricultural activity. They cultivate a plot of family owned agricultural land, harvest nuts and laurel and sell the products locally. Nargiza gets small insignificant monthly income from this activity. She has great desire to start other business and requested a loan. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program that enables people to start or re-start businesses. Nargiza will start trading business with the requested money, particularly she will purchase stock of clothing and will sell locally in her community in increased price. She will be able to generate more income and increase the living condition somehow. Nargiza awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To start trading business with clothing
