loans.name: Midred

texts.en:
Midred is a twenty-seven-year old single woman with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is in the business of selling first and second hand clothes which is her main source of income alongside agriculture. She started this business to earn a living and look after her child. She faces the challenges of competition, seasonal customers and weather changes that stop customers from turning up.  She has hopes that she will own a wholesale boutique one day.

She is requesting a loan to buy more first and second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more first and second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn, has been in her own farm for a living. Her husband helps her growing and harvesting farm produce and they both sell it in the market in town. She earns better income from this. With her revenue, she was able to repay successfully her previous loan used for farm inputs. To improve produce,she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and additional seedlings. This way, she will be able to expand her farm and happy to wait for harvest. In the future, she wants to have a bountiful harvest and to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and additional seedlings

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 57 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Esmeralda is a pedagogue with 35 years of experience. She graduated from the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. Now she works at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature and a child psychologist. Pupils like and respect her very much, since she is a very kind, clever and patient pedagogue. 

Esmeralda is married and she has a son and a daughter, both are grown-up and already married.

Esmeralda asks for a loan of 500, 000 Armenian drams since needs to buy a computer and literature of methodical teaching and also some literature connected with children psychology.

loans.use: to buy a computer, some literature of methodological teaching and literature connected with child psychology.

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
Merian grows and harvest banana, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband is a farmer  since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she had to oversee her tenants as well as her crops. 

Merian is requesting this loan to buy organic fertilizer and replanting banana expenses, since she needs farm improvement.  In the future,she wants to have a better source of income and wants to improve the general living of her family. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these GDMPC.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and replanting banana expenses

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Gyumri town where she lives with her 20-years-old daughter. Her husband is a migrant worker who tries to finad a well paid job to support his family financially.
For supporting her family's living, Karine trades with clothing and underwear from a rented shop in one of the city’s markets. Karine used to travel to the neighboring countries to purchase inventory. Now, she puts her orders through other traders so she can spend more time managing the shop. Currently Karine requires new stock for the shop. With a good credit history behind her, to help her finance the inventory order, Karine has applied to SEF International for a loan of USD  3000.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for her store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer living in Kisii(a primary banana and sugarcane growing area).She is married and has 3 children all of school going age.She loves farming because of selling her produce and she has been at it for 15 years with her primary income source being milk,eggs,bananas,sugarcane.Her biggest challenge is diseases affecting crops and livestock,and lack of market.
Alice chose Juhudi Kilimo because they give dairy loans to small scale farmers.During the training,she learnt how to develop a savings culture.This loan will provide more milk for her family's consumption and also for selling so she can get more income.

loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Duterintambwe I Group

texts.fr:
Christophe  fait partie du groupe  Duterintambwe I et  habite à Gitega. Il a 30 ans et est marié  à Annociate, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants,l’un a 14 ans  et l’autre 22 ans.

Il fait le commerce d'eucalyptus  depuis 8 ans 

Il est  à son treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande plantation d’eucalyptus,pour la revente de beaucoup d’eucalyptus, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait voir ses enfants  étudier et leur acheter des lopins de terre.
texts.en:
Christophe, age 30, is part of Duterintambwe I Group and lives in Gitega. He is married to Annociate, a cultivator. They have two children together, age 14 and 22.

Christophe has been selling eucalyptus for eight years. He is seeking his thirteenth loan from Turame. With this Kiva's loan, he will bolster his working capital and buy a large eucalyptus plantation, in order to sell a lot of eucalyptus and increase his income. 

In the forthcoming years, he would like to see his children study and buy some land lots.

loans.use: to buy a eucalyptus plantation

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is from Khashtarak village. She lives there with her husband, mother-in-law and two daughters. 
Anush's husband provides renovation service of windows and doors and their elder daughter is a seller at village store. Anush herself runs a farm. She keeps 10 chickens and cultivates land. The gathered harvest (corn, potato, plum, nut, apple and pear) are sold locally. Agriculture helped the family to have some stable income during the year, so Anush works really hard to run her farm sustainably. 
She has now applied for this loan of USD 500 to be able to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and forage for the livestock. The loan will greatly help Anush to improve her farm and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie  lives in Misamis Occidental with her two children. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living and had this business for four years. She provides her family from her earnings in addition to her husband's income from farming.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit   to buy additional grocery goods. She planned to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 29 Mai 2008 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent vivent dans le même  village et partagent des liens de solidarité très solide et cela depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce 

Madame  Fatou  (debout à l’extrême  gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle marié, âgée de 44 ans et mère de 09 enfants. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois ainsi que dans son activité de vente de légumes qu’elle achète auprès de maraichers pour la plus part des femmes destiné à la revente au marché central communal.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des cassiers de choux, de carotte et divers condiments pour la revente.

 Les  bénéfices que génèrent l’activité sont utilisés à soutenir son mari pour la dépense quotidienne d’une part d’autre part à renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was established on May 29, 2008, the day it was inaugurated. The women who are part of it live in the same village and have been sharing very strong bonds of solidarity for several years. Their main business is retail. 

Mrs. Fatou is the woman raising her hand on the left in the photograph. She's the featured borrower of the group. She's 44 years old, married, and the mother of nine children.

She has a good experience with the Banc Villageois system, as well as with her business of selling vegetables. She gets her supplies from farmers, most of them women, and resells at the central market in her village.

With this new loan, she intends to buy crates of cabbages, carrots, and various condiments to resell. The profits generated by her business are used on the one hand to support her husband in covering daily expenses, and to strengthen her savings on the other.

loans.use: to buy crates of cabbages, carrots, and various condiments

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is a farmer living in Sarigyugh village. She lives there with her husband, her aunt and three children (ages 9,8 and 6 years old). Siranush's husband is a constructor. Siranush and her aunt run a farm. They keep 25 chickens and cultivate fruits and vegetables (corn, potato, cherry, plum, nut, apple and pear). The gathered harvest they sell in Ijevan's open market and gather income for family's living. 
Siranush has applied for this loan of USD 1000 to be able to purchase piglets, oven and forage for the livestock and enlarge her farm. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farm is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Siranush has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for piglets, oven and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en: Katiba is 56 years old woman, from Marneuli district. She lives with her daughter and son, who works as a waiter and monthly generates 450 GEL. Katiba's daughter is a sales lady at private company and has small income according to her sold products. Their salaries, however, are not enough to meet the basic needs of their families. In order to do her bit to the welfare of the family, Katiba decided to open a grocery store. She has had place for starting her own business and now requested a money for purchasing stock of needed products for grocery store. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that gives chance people to start or re-start businesses. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Regards with the Start Up program, Katiba will be able to be involved in her business and increase the financial condition. She will be very glad for giving chance make better live for her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock of needed products and open grocery store

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Sarigyugh village, where she lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two school-age children. Ruzanna's husband is an electrician and time by time receives orders from local villagers. Ruzanna's father is a migrant worker in neighboring country where he provides construction service and works hard to support his family financially.
Ruzanna herself runs a farm. She keeps 40 chickens and cultivates corn, potato and grows plum trees. Ruzanna's mother-in-law takes care of children and also supports Ruzanna with farming activities. 
By applying for this loan the family asks a loan of USD 1500 to purchase 80 chickens, 2 piglets, forage for the livestock and corn seeds. This loan will be a big support for their farm and they hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 80 chickens, 2 piglets, forage for the livestock and corn seeds

loans.name: Unidas En Cristo Group

texts.es: Coordinada por socia Mary con 27 años de edad, acompañada posee un hijo de 8 años, comercializa ropa nueva al crédito, con este crédito piensa invertir en más mercancía para incrementar las ventas como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, shores, faldas, etc. también está integrado por tres socias más, señora Ana de 61 años quien vende derivados del maíz entre ello semilla de jícaro, pinol, pinolillo, cereales.  Señora Yubenia con 19 años de edad comercializa ropa nueva y ropa usada y la  socia Yerling de 33 años de edad vende prendas de oro y plata.
texts.en:
This group is coordinated by Mary, a member who is 27 years old, and has a partner and an 8-year-old child. She sells new clothes on credit, and is planning to invest this loan in more merchandise to increase sales. This merchandise includes men's trousers, women's trousers, men's shirts, women's blouses, shorts, skirts, etc.

The group is made up of three other members, comprising Señora Ana, who is 61 and sells corn-based products such as jícaro seeds, pinol, pinolillo, and cereals, Señora Yubenia, who is 19 and sells new and used clothing, and Yerling, who is 33 and sells gold and silver jewellery.

loans.use: to invest in men's trousers, women's trousers, men's shirts, women's blouses, shorts, skirts, etc.

loans.name: El Mamon Group

texts.es: Dirigido por la  señora Filena con 46 años de edad, casada, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de zapatos colegiales sintéticos, su principal ayuda el esposo además posee 6 trabajadores que les paga su salario,  su objetivo es aumentar su negocio y para esto requiere de la inversión en materiales cuero sintético, cajuelas, hebillas, hilo; también tenemos la socia Modesta con 45 años de edad dedicándose a la comercialización de cobertores al crédito y contado y la  socia María de 70 años quien posee una pulpería en el domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is directed by Señora Filena, who is 46 years old, married, and works making and selling synthetic school shoes. Her main support is her husband, and she also has six employees, whose salaries she pays. Her aim is to grow her business, and as a result, she needs to invest in materials such as synthetic leather, trunks, buckles and thread.

Another member of the group is Modesta, who is 45 years old and makes a living selling covers on credit and in cash. Lastlty, there is María, who is 70 years old and has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to invest in materials such as synthetic leather, glue, trunks, buckles and thread.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man.  He has 3 children.  He describes himself to be respectful.  He operates a retail business where he sells motor vehicle spare parts.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are mechanics. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of spare parts.  He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of motor vehicle spare parts.  His business goal is to be a wholesale supplier within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life, education and health. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex used the previous loan to buy powdered soap, millet flour and sugar for sale and has progressed amidst high competition.  He has diversified his business to include running a boutique.  He is hopeful of owning a well established boutique dealing in both kids and adult wear.  Alex has asked for a loan to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 37 year old married woman.  She has 4 children.  She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale.  She also grows vegetables on her farm.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in  a fertile place and her primary customers are local residents.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a dairy cow.  Her business goal is to expand within 5 years.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a 40 year old married woman.  She has 7 children ranging in age from 1 year to 17 years old.  She describes herself to be passionate.  She operates a tailoring business where she makes dresses.  She has been involved in this business for 2 years.  Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are mostly ladies. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances.  She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy tailoring materials and to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.  This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials and buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 39 year old married man with 8 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is a dairy farmer, alongside selling fire wood, to supplement his income.  He is facing challenges of diseases and drought that turn out to reduce his productivity, inspite of his vision of owning high breed cows.  Robert needs a loan to buy two Fresian cows.

loans.use: To buy two Fresian bulls.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 41-year-old married man. He has 10 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years. 

Peter describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a motor vehicle repair business and has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of equipment for making work easier. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy modern motor vehicle repair equipment. 

His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy modern motor vehicle repair equipment

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives with her husband, two children (8 and 6 years old) and retired parents in law. Mariam's husband is a taxi driver and Mariam herself runs a farm. The family lives in Ijevan town but the farm that they own is in nearby village. Mariam and her husband go to the village on weekends and take care of the farm. By applying for this loan of USD 1500 Mariam asks lenders to help her with developing the farm. She plans to purchase 3 pigs and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be a great opportunity to enlarge their agricultural income and the whole family hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 3 pigs and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, flavor and rolls.

loans.name: Las Flores De Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FLORES DEL PROGRESO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Inés es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de prendas de vestir, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, bordado de trajes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Inés es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tela; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez años, ya que la técnica la conocía porque su madre le enseño de niña.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella está soltera y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los beneficios que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen falta una socia, la razon es que se fue a su negocio con urgencia.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Las Flores del Progreso' [The Flowers of Progress] will start their 4th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana Regional Centre. 
It is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors where Ines is the president. The members of the communal bank are engaged in various types of businesses including: sewing garments, selling vegetables, selling clothing, transport services, suit embroidery. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesspeople where Ines is a member. She says it is the fourth year she has been in Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of her friend, who is a member of the institution. At present she has a fabric handicraft business. She started this business ten years ago, she already knew the skills because her mother taught her when she was a girl.
 
The loan they will take out now is to raise working capital (to buy fabric wholesale) that she will acquire in the distribution stores in El Alto. After production, she will market her handicrafts in her sales space. This kind of work allows her to generate income to support her family as she is single and has seven children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the benefits the institution offers her.

In the image, one member is missing. The reason is she urgently had to go to her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old woman. She has three children. 

Mary describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sofa sets. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more sofa sets for resale. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good a life.

loans.use: buy more sofa sets for resale

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 44-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with eight children. The oldest is 25 while the youngest is three years old. 

Together with her husband Angelita runs a fishing business, which they started more than 10 years ago. Angelita is the one selling her husbands catch. She sells fish, crab and other shellfish.  

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and to pay for maintenance of their pump boat. This will help increase their catch and at the same time create additional income.

In the future, Angelita hopes to expand her business and to increase the business's profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and pay for pump boat maintenance

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 51 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, activa y pujante, que se ha ganado la vida a pulso, siempre motivada por el amor a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como comerciante independiente, actualmente posee una tienda de abarrotes y cafetería que heredó de su padre luego del fallecimiento, cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida en el sector, gracias a la amplia trayectoria que tiene el negocio. Hoy en día, con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos familiares, desea aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta de adquirir un negocio de café internet, que le están vendiendo a buen precio y ya con todos los equipos y los activos instalados; es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo del crédito para ajustar el capital y pagar el nuevo negocio, el cual desea acreditar para cederlo a sus dos hijos y que sean ellos quienes lo trabajen y lo pongan a producir y, en la misma medida pueden generar ingresos para terminar de pagar sus estudios universitarios.
Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales prósperos y exitosos y que logren posicionar el nuevo negocio para así disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 51, is a hardworking and energetic woman. She has got ahead with effort, always motivated by the love she has for her family. She has been working as an independent saleswoman for a few years. She owns a grocery store/cafeteria, which she inherited from her father. She has a good reputation in the area because she has been working there for a long time. 

She is thinking today of improving her family’s income, so she wants to make the most of the opportunity to acquire an internet café that is being sold at a good price with all the equipment she needs. This is why she is requesting support through a loan to complement the money she has to buy the business. She wants to position the business and hand it over to her children for them to administer it once it is running. This will help them to pay for their university studies.

Luz says that her biggest dream is to see her children become successful and prosperous professionals. She also hopes that they can thrive with this new business and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to complement the money she has to buy an internet café.

loans.name: Luz Yaneth

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 38 años de edad, es una mujer creativa, pujante y trabajadora, que se gana la vida trabajando como estilista independiente. El oficio lo aprendió hace varios años en diversos cursos de capacitación que tomó en academias de belleza, luego de culminar los estudios secundarios; pues desde muy pequeña le cogió un gusto muy especial a la labor y con ayuda de sus familiares pudo explotar todo su potencial al colocar su propia sala de belleza.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos y herramientas de trabajo (tinturas, tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, tijeras, plancha para el cabello), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente de inventario para prestar un mejor y más ágil servicio a su clientela, mejorando las ventas e ingresos.
Luz, como toda mujer soñadora, manifiesta que sigue trabajando arduamente para lograr sus metas, especialmente aquella de iniciar una tienda del peluquero, donde pueda distribuir todos los elementos y productos de belleza, así podrá mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is 38 years old. She is a creative, driven, and hardworking woman. She earns her living working as an independent stylist. She learned the trade several years ago in different training courses that she took after finishing secondary school. Since she was very young, she took a liking to the work, and with her family's help, she was able to use all of her potential to open her own beauty salon.

In order to fortify her business, she is asking for the support of a loan to buy materials and work tools (dyes, hair treatments, shampoo, hair dyes, scissors, and a hair iron). This will allow her to have enough inventory available to offer a better and more agile service to her clientele, improving her income. 

Luz, like any dreamer, says that she will keep working hard to achieve her goals, especially that of opening her own hair products store. She will be able to distribute all kinds of beauty elements and products. This way, she will be able to improve her business' profitability and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a hair iron for her beauty salon

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 51-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. 

Her husband works as a farmer to support their family. Luisa engages in a food vending business. She sells pancit (noodle dishes) to help augment the income of their household. She also operates a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells various items ranging from groceries to pig feed. Luisa started both businesses years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients and stock for the store like rice, hog feed and vegetables, to increase her daily income. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and stock for the store like rice, hog feed and vegetables.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Gandzaqar village of Tavush region. She lives there with her husband and 21-years-old son. Her husband drives taxi using his own car and Armine with her son runs a farm. She keeps chickens and turkeys as well as cultivates corn, potato and grass for the livestock. 
Armine is hard working woman who works hard to have a sustainable and profitable farm. She has now applied for this loan to be able to enlarge the farm and gather more income for the family. 
The requested loan of USD 1500 will enable Armine to purchase two pigs and forage for the livestock.

loans.use: to pay for two pigs and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: Munawar is 42 years old married lady. She is very talent and excels in work of stitching. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community as she is doing it for past 17 years. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers. This will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers.

loans.name: Ana Eva

texts.es: Ana es una mujer emprendedora de 69 años, a la que siempre le ha gustado trabajar como independiente. Siempre trabajó con su familia en negocios de alimentos y actualmente tiene una fábrica de arepas de maíz, pero también hace buñuelos y tamales, producción que vende a sus vecinos del barrio. Quiere invertir su crédito en la compra de un molino y más insumos para su negocio. El molino le facilitará mucho su trabajo, ya que actualmente muele todo el maíz con uno manual. Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas y tener la posibilidad de incluir otros alimentos que le generen mayores ingresos y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Ana is an enterprising 69 year old woman. She has always liked working independently. She always worked with her family in the food business and now she has a corn arepas factory, but she also makes buñuelos and tamales. She sells her products to the residents of her neighborhood. She wants to invest her loan in buying a mill and more ingredients for her business. The mill will make her work much easier for her, since now she is grinding all of the corn with a manual one. Her dream is to fortify her business by increasing her sales and having the possibility of including other foods to generate more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a mill and more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en: Sabiha is 39 years old lady and enjoys doing a work of hand embroidery. She is been in work of hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 10th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: At the age 38, Azra helps her son (also shown in the photo) in running a general store located outside their home. When they started their relation with Kashf two years ago, their store was very small. They wanted to increase the range of products but lack of funds made this almost impossible. Azra borrowed loan from Kashf for business improvement. Over the passage of time, they have been injecting the store with new items and now it has become popular in the community. They want to increase their inventory as the population in their neighborhood has increased in the recent years.  For this reason, Azra has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more packs of biscuits, sweets and juices and to add new racks to the store to increase storage capacity.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of biscuits, sweets and juices and to add new racks to the store

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Cayetano está en el 3er ciclo del programa de comités, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que van creciendo de apoco, así son todas las señoras muy emprendedoras y quieren avanzar más motivo por el cual decidieron formarse en este grupo.
Gladys es una de ellas, es una mujer que se está esforzando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, se dedica a ser cocinera y también es vendedora de ropa. Comenta que se está esforzando para poder mejorar sus ingresos y así ayudar a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo ya que necesita comprar más prendas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, a la vez que cumple con los pedidos de sus clientes y ayuda a su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de mejorar en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is in its third cycle of the committee program. It is a very entrepreneurial group that is growing gradually. They are all enterprising women who want to advance which is the reason why they decided to form this group.

Gladys is one of them and she is a woman who is working to improve her living conditions and that of her family. She is dedicated to being a cook and also sells clothing. She comments that she is working to be able to improve her income and thus help her loved ones. She has requested this loan since she needs to buy more clothing to sell and, this way, can keep up with sales and at the same time fulfill the orders of her customers and help her family. She is thankful for this opportunity. They are getting better with their endeavors.

loans.use: to buy varied clothing to sell.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is 51 years old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Suriya’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She is a mother of two children.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia es una mujer de 43 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos los cuales le apoyan a ella y su padre en las diferentes actividades que son llevadas a cabo en el campo para el desarrollo y cuidado de su cultivo de hortalizas (papa). Gracias al emprendimiento, confianza y compromiso que ella tiene, la cooperativa COMIXMUL la ha apoyado en todas y cada una de las veces que ella ha solicitado financiamiento para poder invertir en sus cultivos de papa creyendo en el pequeño productor y depositando confianza en esta clase de sector necesitado. Gracias a este rubro Florencia genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar y su familia con lo cual ayuda a la compra de calzado, medicinas con muchas restricciones, ropa, etc. que son necesarias para el desarrollo y el cuidado de la salud. Fue gracias a sus padres que ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que ellos por generaciones han sido agricultores y siempre han trabajado la tierra. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y amigos.
Sus planes y metas seguir incrementando la producción mediante la compra de más tierra que le permita generar mayores ingresos y poder con el tiempo diversificar su producto. Como madre seguir apoyando a sus hijos con todas sus fuerzas para que ellos puedan graduarse a nivel superior y puedan ser personas de bien en la vida. Por lo que hoy día ella solicita una vez más apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que podrán asistir sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Florencia is a 43 year old woman. She is the mother of 3 children who help her and their father in the different activities they carry out in the development and care of her vegetable crops (potatoes). Thanks to the enterprise, confidence and commitment that she has, the COMIXMUL cooperative has helped every single time she has asked for a loan to be able to invest in her potato crops, believing in the small producer and putting confidence in this necessary sector. Thanks to this, Florencia generates income to support her home and her family so that she can buy shoes, medicine with restrictions, clothing, etc. These are necessary for the development and care of health. It was thanks to her parents that she learned to work the land at a very young age, since they have been farmers for generations and have always worked the land. Her customers are different intermediaries who come to the area, and neighbors and friends.

Her plans and goals are to keep increasing her production by buying more land that will allow her to generate more income and be able over time to diversify her product. As a mother, she wants to keep supporting her children with all of her strength so that they can graduate from college and be people who do well in life. That is why today she is once more asking for help with a loan to buy agricultural materials that will help her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products to help her potato crops.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 45 years old and a married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Fatima’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Fatima has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle along with some tools. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este comité son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron unirse para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo, y a través de las capacitaciones que van recibiendo.
La Sra. Nelly es la tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas variadas, y comenta que poco a poco se ha ido formando una buena clientela que siempre le llevan trabajos para que ella haga y que queda muy conforme. Es una persona muy trabajadora y con ánimos de salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo ya que necesita comprar insumos para seguir con sus confecciones, como ser telas, hilos, cierres y demás, y de esa forma seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this village bank are women heads of the family. They decided to unite to be able to help their families by working in a team and through the training they are receiving.

Nelly is the treasurer of the group. She makes her living sewing various clothing, and notes that little by little, she has gone forming a good clientele that always brings her jobs for her to do and is very happy. She is a very hardworking person with the desire to get ahead.

She is applying for this loan since she needs to buy supplies to continue with her sewing, like fabric, thread, zippers and more. In this manner, she will continue fulfilling the orders of her customers. She is thankful for this opportunity that she and her teammates are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas 2 Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres integran este grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder seguir ayudando a su familia como lo vienen haciendo y también ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Mirtha es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una vendedora, y por medio de la venta de joyas que hace tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia, y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una persona muy dedicada a su familia que está luchando por salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas para la venta, como ser cadenas, pulseras, anillos, etc., para poder seguir creciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
18 women belong to this group in the city of Caacupe. Each one puts forth her best effort to be able to keep helping her family as they've done and also improving their living conditions.

Mirtha is one of the members of this group. She is a vendor and, by selling jewelry, she has the income to be able to help her family and give them all that she could not have. She is a person very dedicated to her family who is fighting to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of jewelry to sell, such as chains, bracelets, rings, etc. to be able to keep growing. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has been in business of animals’ sales. She buys animals (baby goats & buffalo) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income.  She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more animals. It’s her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood is 48 years old married woman and running business selling milk selling with her husband for the past 10 years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. She has three daughters and two sons, all is school going. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested for a loan of Rs 40,000/- to buy one more buffalo to carter to more. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood is a 44 year old married woman doing business selling milk for many years. She has 5 calves and 2 cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SOLIDARIAS” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Emma es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa interior, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de CD’s, ferretería, carnicería, costura de prendas de vestir.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Emma es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lencería; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital que tenía y empezó a vender en las ferias de forma ambulante.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lencería por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el área de salud y el ahorro le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Las Solidarias" village bank will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the field office of Villa Exaltación. It is made up of ten members and is directed by a board, where Emma is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, among them are: sale of underwear, sewing of clothes, sale of CDs, hardware, butcher, sewing of clothing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where Emma is a member. She says that three years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of an aunt who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling lingerie. It's worth mentioning that she started this business with a little capital she had and started selling in the markets as a street vendor.

The loan that she will take out now is for increasing capital (to buy lingerie in bulk) that she will acquire in the stores in the city of El Alto. Later, she will sell it in the markets. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family since she lives in a free union and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training, the health area and the savings that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy lingerie.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco viene de una familia muy humilde, es hijo de madre soltera. Ha formado su propio hogar hace poco, con un hijo a punto de nacer, y por quien está luchando.
Francisco se dedica al  macate (venta ambulante) hace más de 5 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y pequeños trabajos para sobrevivir. Tiene formados  150 clientes  en la zona a quienes vende sus productos de forma estable. Él se está esforzando mucho para darle una casa  a su hijo cuando nazca, quiere seguir creciendo, aumentar clientes y así poder llegar a su objetivo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de colchas, hamacas y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma poder estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Francisco comes from a very humble family. He is the son of a single mother. He has made his own home recently, with a son on the way and for whom he is working hard.

Francisco has been dedicated to macate (selling on foot) for more than five years. Previously, he was dedicated to farming and small jobs to survive. He has 150 customers in the area to whom he sells his products. He is working hard in order to give his son a house when he is born. He wishes to keep growing, expanding his customer base and thus be able to achieve his goal.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of quilts, hammocks and other items to be able to keep up with sales and thus be able to be close to his goal.

loans.use: to buy quilts and hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Pukas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUKAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vajillas, venta de frescos, tienda de barrio, minibús, venta de artículos por temporada, venta de productos lácteos, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando al formar un grupo con sus amigas de su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace veinte años, ya que la técnica la conocía porque lo aprendió en un centro de formación.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cortes de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las consultas en salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Pukas" village bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamerican field office. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board, where Lidia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, among them are: sale of dishes, sale of soft drinks, neighborhood store, minibus, sale of seasonal merchandise, sale of dairy products, grocery store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where Lidia is a member. She says that this is the fourth year that she is a part of Pro Mujer, entering to form a group with her friends in the area. Currently, she has a craft business sewing blankets. She says that she learned this business twenty years ago, since she discovered the technique because she learned it in a training center.

The loan that she will take out now is for increasing capital (to buy cuts of blankets in bulk) that she will acquire in the distribution stores in the city of El Alto. Later, she will sell it in her sales area. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health consultations that the institution offers her.

loans.use: to buy blanket cuts in bulk.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 43 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Amelita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Amelita has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Amelitais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is 51 years old married woman. She has a small business of goat selling. She has been doing this business for the last many years. She buys baby goats at lower prices and then works hard to raise the goats for one to two years. Then she sells the goats at a higher price. She wants to increase her income. For this purpose, she contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase more animals (baby goats). She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. It’s her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals (baby goats).

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en: Mukhtiar is 41 year old lady and enjoys doing a work of hand embroidery. She is been in work of hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Eliseta

texts.en:
Elisita is 53 years old and married with six children, three of whom in school, Elisita works very hard to provide for them.

Elisita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elisita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her food vending business.

Elisita has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan despite what happened last November 8, 2013 and now request a new loan to rebuild her business and in future would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy addiitonal ingredients for her business

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush lives in Aygut village of Gegharquniq region with her husband and three children. Sirush's husband drives taxi using his own car. Sirush and her husband are also involved in agriculture. They are mainly involved in beekeeping and currently own 35 colonies of bees. Sirush keeps 2 cows, 6 sheep and also cultivates corn, haricot and potato. She  gets high quality honey and sells it locally. As agribusiness is very important source of income for this family, they would like to enlarge it. By applying for this loan of USD 1500 Sirush plans to purchase 15 colonies of bees and enlarge honey production. As this is Sirush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 
Sirush and her whole family wait for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 15 colonies of bees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband bu6y repair parts for his store

loans.name: Abelina

texts.en:
Abelina is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school, Abelina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap,groceries,etc. to sell .

Abelina has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Abelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap,groceries,etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for lawnmower for organizing cultivation process

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a 59-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children. She engages in selling rtw (ready to wear), like t-shirts, pants, blouses and whole dresses. She started her business almost five years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock and for additional capital to pay for transportation so she can meet the family's daily needs.  

In the future, Aquilina would like expand her business and increase her business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock and additional capital to pay for transportation

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerie is 43 years old and has four children. Nerie is married and has four children who are in school.

Nerie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nerie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nerie has been in pig fattening for 9 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nerie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Daniel is married and has four children. He is a teacher. Both he and his wife farm their land. They have been farming for 20 years now, and they are currently growing maize and rearing livestock on their farm. Daniel is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Daniel's first loan with Honey Care, and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in beekeeping. 

Daniel's hope for the future is to have a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives with her family in Zorak village of Ararat region. Together with her husband and two sons Irina runs a farm. They keep a livestock (cows, chickens and turkeys) as well as cultivate potato. The family also owns an greenhouse where they cultivate greens and sell it in the market. 
The barn that they own is old and needs to be renovated. So Irina needs some financial means to organize her farming process. She wants to renovate the barn, purchase an ox and tomato seeds for the farm. Implementation of these goals is important for Irina to have sufficient income from the sales of the harvest to sustain her family during the year.
As this is Irina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, tomato seeds and renovation of the barn

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Joel is married and has eight children. He is a businessman. Both he and his wife undertake farming. They have been farming for 20 years now, and they are currently growing maize and rearing livestock on their farm. Joel is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey, earn him some income and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Joel's first loan with Honey Care, and he intends to use the proceeds from his hives to start a business and increase the number of his livestock. 

Joel's hope for the future is to have a good life in old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has 10 children. She lives in Kitale in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Esther operates a small business trading maize. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 30 years currently growing maize, beans, oranges, and bananas and rearing cattle on their farm. Esther is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey, earn her additional income, and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

Esther is requesting her first loan from Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to save for her old age. Esther's hope to live a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 29 Mai 2008 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent vivent dans le même  village et partagent des liens de solidarité très solide et cela depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce 

Madame Awa  (debout à l’extrême  gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est marié, âgée de 56 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente d’articles vestimentaires en majorité pour enfant et femme. Elle se procure sa marchandise à la capitale ppour la revente en détail dans sa localité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter par douzaine des robes et divers articles vestimentaires pour enfant destiné à la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle obtient de son activité, elle pense mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was established on May 29, 2008, the day it was inaugurated. The women who make it up live in the same village and have been sharing very strong solidarity bonds for several years. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Awa is the woman standing on the left and raising her hand in the photograph. She's the group featured borrower. She's 56 years old and married. Her business consists in selling clothes, mostly women's and children's.

She gets her supplies in the capital and retails her products in her village. With this new loan, she will buy dresses by the dozen and various children's clothing articles to resell.

With the profits she gets from her business, she intends to better help her husband cover the daily expenses and the children's education.

loans.use: to buy dresses and children's clothing

loans.name: Dieneba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 05 femmes très engagées dans le développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Diénéba (debout à  gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une dame très dynamique, elle est veuve et prend à sa charge ses 06 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de poisson frais dans sa commune et détient une large clientèle.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter en quantité du poisson par cassier de 20 kg pour la revente par kg selon les besoins du client.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et assure une meilleure prise en charge scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five women who are very implicated in developing their money-earning businesses. For several years, they've all been living in the same village and they maintain relationships of solidarity and mutual help. Their main business is retail and rainy season farming.  

Mrs. Diénéba is the featured borrower of the group. She's the woman raising her hand on the left in the photograph. She's very energetic, and a widow who  has her six children in her care. She sells fresh fish in her village, and has a large clientele.

With her new loan, she intends to buy a large quantity of fish (by 20 kg crates), to resell by the kilo, according to customers' needs.

She intends to use her profits to improve the standard of living of her family, and ensure that her children get a better education.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fresh fish

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Apolonia is 61 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Apolonia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Apolonia requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

Apolonia has been in this business for 4 years. Apolonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina works hard to support her family. Carolina is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Carolina requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Carolina has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells green bananas on a retail and wholesale basis at the market. She works for seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She gets additional income from poultry farming. 

She has requested a loan of 1,400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, poultry vaccines and animal feeds. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler of green bananas and to build rental houses. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas and poultry vaccines.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Joseph is married and has seven children. He runs a small business where he hawks products. Both he and his wife undertake farming where they grow maize and vegetables, and they also rear cattle. They have been farming for 30 years now. Joseph is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income through the sale of honey, and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Joseph's first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his hives to buy more cattle and improve his life generally. Joshua's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ebby

texts.en:
Ebby is a 33-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 1 year to 18 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is a married man from Getafe, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari store business (a variety store) selling various goods and items to the people in his place. Pedro is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, he will be able to improve his stock, and thus, augment his sales and income. In the future, Pedro has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella se llama maría del carmen, es madre de dos niños de 11 y 3 años, después de buscar muchas oportunidades de estudiar una carrera, ya que por el nivel de estudio solo puede trabajar en aseo y ahora ya esta trabajando en una empresa por un salario mínimo  y  tiene que responder por los hijos sola, para ella es muy difícil  acceder  a un nivel de estudio  superior  y después  de buscar tanto encontro esta  corporación universitaria  nuestra señora las mercedes, ya que se a justa a el presupuesto y comienza a estudiar, pero hay veces que le es muy difícil pagar las mensualidades por los gastos en el hogar con los hijos, pero con grandes dificultades económicas  ya logro el primer semestre   de contabilidad financiera y va  por el segundo y ha aprendido mucho, le a servido para mejorar la situación laboral  por que antes trabajaba en un restaurante y ya esta trabajando en una empresa, todavía  se gana el salario mínimo  y con el debe pagar los gastos en el hogar, el transporte diario y lo de la universidad y le es muy difícil, por este motivo ella esta buscando el subsidio de kiiva  para seguir superándose, pues  le a tocado muy difícil, pues desde  niña no contó con los padres y le toco trabajar en casas de familia interna y así comenzó la primaria  y el bachillerato  todo a sido difícil, pero dios a sido tan grande y hay va  superándose  para mejorar la calidad de vida  
Ella quiere que le colaboren para los estudios superiores  en la corporación universitaria las mercedes  ya que allí ha aprendido mucho y los profesores son de alta calificación profesional   y el pennsul que ofrecen  es el adecuado para el trabajo técnico profesional, ella le agradecería a kiva sí es posible la colaboración.
texts.en:
Her name is Maria Del Carmen, she is the mother of two children of 11 and 3 years old. She has been searching various opportunities to study for a degree, as due to her level of study she can only work in cleaning, and now she is working in a company for the minimum wage and she has to take care of her children alone. 

For her it is very difficult to be admitted to a level of higher education and after so much searching, she found Nuestra Señora Las Mercedes University, and she has arranged the fees and started studying, but there are difficult times paying monthly family expenses for the children. Despite these great economic difficulties, she made it through the first semester of accounting and finance, and she is going for the second. She has learnt a lot, and it has helped to improve her work situation because before she worked in a restaurant and now she is working in a company, although she still earns a minimal salary and that's all she has to cover the family expenses and the daily commute to the university, which is very difficult for her. 

For this reason, she is asking for a Kiva loan to continue overcoming these obstacles, as it has been very difficult for her. But since she was young, she didn't rely on her parents and she had to work inside the houses of families and this is how she started primary and secondary school. Everything has been difficult, but God has been so great and she continues overcoming problems to improve her quality of life.

She wants assistance for her higher education at Las Mercedes University, as she has already learnt so much and the professors are of high professional standing, and the courses they offer are adequate for the work as a technical professional. She is grateful for Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to pay one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Hovtashat village together with her two sons and their families. She has been involved in agriculture for already 15 years. Laura's first son Aram is a taxi driver and the other son Arman is a furniture maker. The whole family works hard to sustain their living and have appropriate living conditions.
Laura owns greenhouse where she cultivates some vegetables. She is very hard working woman who works hard to gather good income from her farm and help her sons with sustaining the family. Laura has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase fertilizer and also to renovate her greenhouse (purchase polyethylene cover). This is very important for her farming business and Laura will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and renovation of the greenhouse (polyethylene cover)

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Sammy is married and has six children. He runs a grain-grinding mill. Both he and his wife undertake farming. They have been farming for twenty five years now and they are currently growing maize, bananas, and vegetables and they raise livestock. Sammy is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey and earn him some income, and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Sammy's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children, develop real estate plots, and improve his life generally. Sammy's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is 44 years old. She is from Nyandarua and is married. They have four children who are aged between 9 years and 23 years old. 

Bilha has a farming business that she has been running for many years, and she has applied for her third loan from Vision Fund Kenya. Bilha will use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizers to use in her farm. She will use the profits made from this business to buy a cow. 

She hopes to get a bigger loan in the near future and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Borimaligu-Pishigu #2 Group

texts.en:
Kubura is 25 years old and has three children. She is a member of a shea nut processing women association from Pishigu #2 in the northern region of Ghana. Kubura is wearing the green veil, and placing her hand on the shea nuts in this group picture. Their group is called ‘Borimaligu-Pushigu #2’ Women's Association.

Kubura has been in this business with 18 others in the group for the past three years. A new loan of GHS 3,800 will support her and the colleagues to buy 58 bags of shea nuts for the processing of premium shea butter. There are available to the off-taker organizations and individuals who buy the shea butter Kubura processes.

She hopes to expand the business venture and thereby increase her income and sustainability. 

With increased income, she would be able to repay the loan, stay in business and also support her children to have a better education and better food to eat.

loans.use: To buy 58 bags of shea nuts for the processing of premium shea butter

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is a young agronomist from Marmarashen village. She lives together with her husband, parents-in-law and two little kids. 
Ruzanna owns a greenhouse where she cultivates greens. Her husband sells the gathered harvest in local markets and supports his family by the income from agriculture. Now Ruzanna has applied for a loan of USD 2000 to develop her farming business. With this loan she plans to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse, purchase polyethylene cover for it and green seeds. This will allow Ruzanna to get more income and expand her farm further.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and green seeds

loans.name: Wumpini-Pishigu #2 Group

texts.en:
Fuseina is an active 45-year-old woman from Pishugu #2 in the Northern part of Ghana. She is married and has five children. She is the one placing her hand on the shea nuts in their group picture.

Fuseina is a member of a shea nut pickers and shea butter processing group which has been doing business over the last three years. Their group is called ‘Wumpini-Pishugu #2' Women Association. She makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality premium shea butter for both international and local markets.
