Fuseina and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 4,800 to enable them pay the cost of labour to pick 73 bags of shea nuts for processing. By so doing, Fuseina would increase production and hence profit more, repay the loan and support her children’s educational and food needs.

loans.use: To pay the cost of labour to pick 73 bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Tungteeya-Pishigu #2 Group

texts.en:
Amatu is a 34-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children in Pishugu #2, a community in Northern Ghana. Amatu is the person sitting and holding the shea nuts roster in the group picture. Their group is called Tungteeya-Pishigu #2 Women Association.

All the members are involved in the business of processing shea nuts into shea butter. They have been doing this business for the past three years. They process high premium shea butter, some of which is sold to aggregators and exported to the European and USA markets. Amatu sells the butter to many other customers in Ghana. The group is therefore requesting a loan of GHS 3,600 to help the group increase the processing from 30 bags of shea nuts to 55 bags of shea nuts yearly. Amatu hopes to increase her income to support her family and repay the loan.

loans.use: To help the group increase the processing from 30 bags of shea nuts to 55 bags of shea nuts yearly

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is an agronomist from Darakert village of Ararat region. She lives there with her husband and 24-years-old son. Mariam and her family are occupied in land cultivation. Particularly they own a greenhouse where cucumber and greens are cultivated. 

Mariam is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. This requested loan of USD 2500 will help her to renovate the greenhouse, and purchase potato seeds and fertilizer to fight against the land diseases. Mariam will be very grateful if lenders support her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: 3 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “3 DE FEBRERO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de gorras, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, elaboración de manualidades, venta de artículos varios, venta de gorras, venta de frazadas, venta de arena.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que hace un años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frazadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital que tenía y con la recomendación de sus amigos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frazadas por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “3 de febrero” communal bank is going to begin its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors, of which Nicolasa is the Secretary.  The communal bank members carry out a number of businesses, among them: hat sales, fried potatoes with hot dog sales, clothing sales, making crafts, sales of various items, blanket sales, and sand sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small micro-enterpreneurs, one of whom is Nicolasa.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling blankets.  She shares that she began this business with a little capital she had, at the recommendation of her friends.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (to buy blankets in bulk).  She will get these from stores in El Alto and later will sell them in the markets.  This type of work allows her to generate earnings to take care of her family, because she is single and has a child.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy blankets in bulk

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grandfather). She sells charcoal on a retail and wholesale basis at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation, to sell  wholesale only and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of  charcoal.

loans.name: Joisé Felix

texts.es: Señor José, actualmente casado, es propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio, además comercializa frutas  de la temporada, por lo cual desea invertir tanto en su pulpería en arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, sal, galletas, caramelos, entre otros, y en las cosechas de las temporadas como es el tamarindo, aguacate, mango, jocote, entre otros. Este señor por medio de los préstamos otorgados ha visto las mejoras, desde el momento que le dan las capacitaciones
texts.en:
Señor José is currently married.  He is the owner of a small grocery store in his home.  He also sells seasonal fruit.  And so he wants to invest in his store with rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, cookies, and candy, among other items.  He also wants seasonal produce such as tamarind, avocado, mango, and jocote fruit, among others.  

He has seen improvements, due to previous loans, from the moment they gave him his training.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of staples such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, cookies, candies, etc., and also to buy produce such as tamarind, avocados, mango, and jocote fruit

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en: Ramonita is a married woman and a mother of eight children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. Ramonita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the school fees of her children. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Ramonita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children and 3 of her children go to school. She takes care of 4 additional family members (4 sisters). She operates a beauty salon at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy hair treatments, relaxers, oils, rollers, weaves and braids. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of hair relaxers and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a stand alone dryer and chairs for her salon. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more hair treatments, relaxers, oils, roller, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Alice is married and has three children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing tea, coffee, bananas, maize and trees in their farm. Alice is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey, earn her some income and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Alice's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in their farm. Alice's hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Saturnina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. Through this, they will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Saturnina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Getafe, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Susana is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among others. With a loan, Susana will be able to improve the variety of her stocks thus augmenting her sales and income. Susana hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among others.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a 24-year-old married man. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. He will use the KES 45,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a continuous cash flow and a good lifestyle. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en: Ranilo is a married man and a father of four children from Bohol, Philippines. He has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 4 years now. This is the source of his income. Ranilo is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. With this, he will be able to improve his catch which he can sell to the market. Ranilo hopes to make his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a married man and a father of seven grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. He earns a living through his sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. Rolando is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and detergents, coffee, sugar and cooking ingredients. With this, he will be able to attract more buyers to his store thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and detergents, coffee, sugar and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is an agronomist from the Tavush region. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and little child.
 
Marine and her family run a  farm. The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it locally. They keep a cow and 3 calves and cultivate wheat. They also have an orchard where different fruit trees are grown (plum, apricot, apple, pear, nut).
 
Now, they have some financial difficulties and are not able to pay for farming costs. Marine asks for this loan of USD 1,000 to be able to purchase 3 oxen. The whole family will wait for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for 3 oxen.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Arevabuyr village of Ararat region with her husband, parents-in-law and sister-in-law.
The whole family is involved in agriculture. Near the house where they live they own greenhouse where they cultivate greens and also barn where they keep pigs. The family also owns an arable land where potato is cultivated and sold in local open markets. The family also grows apricot trees and during summer season produces dried apricots. 
Now, the requested loan of USD 1500 will help this hard working family to improve their agribusiness. Anahit and her family will be able to purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer and forage for pigs. They all wait for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer and forage for pigs

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good marketable area for business and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough resources. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of  sugar, bread, salt and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt and other items.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Joshua is married and has six children. He runs a business selling cereals and livestock. He also has a farm where he grows maize, beans, livestock, trees and an orchard. He has been farming for twenty-five years now. Joshua is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for medicinal use and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Joshua's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy a car and improve his life generally. Joshua's hope for the future is to live a better and fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 7 children, 2 of whom go to school. She takes care of an additional family member (Mother). 

She sells secondhand clothes on a retail basis at the market. She works for six days a week. She has been in business for the last 2 years. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspirations are to sell wholesale only and to educate her children and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a retail sales business for more than a year now. She sells goods such as natural food supplements. This is the source of her income.

Susana is asking for a loan to buy more food supplement products to sell to her customers. In the future, Susana has hopes of improving her business and making it a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more food supplement products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 29 year old single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined and sincere. She operates a retail business where she sells juices, washing soap, biscuits and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Ruth describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds available in order to increase stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of juices, soap, water and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of juices, soap, water and other items.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Khashtarak village with her husband and son. Emma and her husband are farmers and their son works at a local bakery. 

Emma and her husband have been farmers for the past seven years and have developed their farm with hard work and favorable conditions. Emma is requesting a loan to purchase 5 calves and forage for the livestock. The loan will increase Emma's income, which is important to help this hardworking family meet their needs. She hopes to ensure a stable future for the family.

loans.use: to pay for 5 calves and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with 4 children, 3 are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She has requested 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACC0 to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include customers who default on their payments and changing weather.  

Her goal and aspiration is to increase her capital base to serve more customers. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not running water. Her major expense include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, 3 are in school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal at the market seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She gets additional income from selling running water. 

She requests 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACC0 to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and changing weather conditions.  

Her goals and aspirations are to increase her capital base to serve more customers and to sell wholesale and own a delivery van. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her major expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a 27-year-old woman with 4 children ranging in age from 3 to 12 years. 

She describes herself as ambitious and enthusiastic. She operates a retail business to sell bananas, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of storage  for perishable products. 

She will use the 50,000 KES to buy bananas, onions and other vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 41-year-old married man with 2 children. 

He describes himself as patient. He operates a retail business to sell milk and cooking oil. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use 70,000 KES to restock milk for resale. 

His business goal is to own a wholesale shop of household items within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy re-stock milk for resale.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a 50-year-old, single woman. She has one child who is 23 years old. She describes herself as being dedicated and patient. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are milk-processing companies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

Annastacia will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a dairy cow, to enable her to increase milk production. Her business goal is to have five more cows to enable her to increase milk production within five years. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business and create employment opportunities. This is her third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, to enable her to increase milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of pineapples and mangoes.

loans.name: Durgeswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Jema is a 44-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children in a small village of Bolangir district named Sasikela. In the picture, the lady standing with her raised hand is Jema. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She formed a SHG named Durgeswari Self Help Group; it consists of 13 members. She is the president of her group because she is a very humble, hardworking and responsible person with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve her life.  

She runs a betel shop to help her husband financially. She sells pan, chocolates, biscuits, snacks, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks and other small household consumables.

loans.use: to buy toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks and other small household consumables.

loans.name: Margaret Nyambura

texts.en:
Margaret is one of the members of Kambaja women group (Secretary). She is a mother of four, and lives in the same compound with her mother in law and her co-wife with her two children. Margaret is a business lady operating a retail shop in Meru. Her family and village friends have been using the traditional kerosene for lighting and firewood for cooking for many years. On average, every household uses approximately 12 liters of kerosene per month and 100kgs of firewood. After a visit by a VEP officer with a display of different solar lamps and cook stoves, Margaret was very impressed and decided to approach VEP for credit to stock her retail shop. 

Using her leadership skills, Margaret creates awareness on solar and energy saving products. She also trains and campaigns on how the products are beneficial, both economically and health-wise. Being among the first of shops with Renewable Energy Technology in the area, she has the advantage of monopoly in the region thus her stock will be first moving. She has marked up a profit of 30% on the stock and this will help to repay her debt.
Margaret is hardworking and objective and, in future, she hopes to transform her village from carbon emissions to clean energy.

loans.use: to stock solar products.

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Don Silvio es originario de la comunidad de la flor, es una pequeña comunidad  bien poblada, nos dice que el estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria  ya que en  su infancia la escuela más cercana que tenía le quedaba como a 5 kilómetros  y el camino era bien malo , además que ayudaba a trabajar a su papa  sembrando granos básicos y a cuidar un ganado que tenía con él aprendió a trabajar es algo que dice con mucho orgullo ya que siempre le dijo que en la vida todo se ganaba con esfuerzo y sacrificio. Hoy en día él tiene su propia familia la cual le ha enseñado también a trabajar  , en la comunidad viven a oscuras aun ya que la energía convencional no ha llegado ahora que el mira la oportunidad de poder aplicar a este préstamo se siente muy feliz pues podrá comprar un sistema solar e instalarlo en su casa es algo que ayudara a mejorar la condición de vida de sus seres queridos
texts.en:
Silvio is a native of the La Flor community.  It is a small but well-populated community.  He tells us that he attended school until third grade because when he was younger, the closest school to him was 5 kilometers away and the road was very bad.  In addition, he helped his dad with his work growing basic grains and taking care of their cattle.  His dad taught him to work, which is something that he is very proud of as he always told him that in life everything can be achieved through effort and sacrifice.

Today, he has his own family who he has also taught to work.  Their community lives in the dark as they do not have electricity.  However, now that he has the opportunity to apply for this loan, he feels very happy because he will be able to purchase a solar power system and install it in his home.  This will help him to improve the living conditions of his loved ones.

loans.use: purchase a solar power system.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Madhuri is a 42-year-old lady who has two children. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Madhuri. She lives in the Chirchala village of Kalahandi district with her husband and children. 

A few years back, she started a business of making and selling flour, such as wheat flour, maize flour, gram flour, lentil flour, rice flour, etc. She makes these flours with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of flours, depending on the demand for flour in the market. 

Madhuri is planning to increase her business by buying more supplies, such as wheat, maize, grains, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. 

She is requesting within a group of eleven members, where all are women and all live in the same community. They named their group “Maa Tarini Self Help Group”. Madhuri is the president of her group.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, such as wheat, maize, grains, etc.

loans.name: Dorcas Kaheti Gakore

texts.en:
Dorcas Kaheti is a mother of 3 girls: one in high school and the others in primary school. She is a farmer selling milk and vegetables to sustain her family and uses firewood as a source of energy. She has two dairy cows with a capacity of 15 liters per day each.

Being a member of one of our groups, Dorcas has been on the forefront to promote Bio gas through educating other women and referring them to a Visionary Empowerment Programme for constructions. To empower her, we have advance her KES 50,000 to add to her savings to construct a 6m3 bio gas plant.

From the milk sales, Dorcas makes a profit margin of between KES 225 on a bad day to KES 800 on a good day. This will enable her repay the loan as well as invest some money towards expanding and improving her production on the farm.

Dorcas is objective and hard working. Her wish is to create more Bio gas awareness to her peers and with her plant, it will make it more practical.

loans.use: to construct a Bio gas plant.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza está en el 1er ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus seres queridos.
Una de las señoras es Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora. Espera un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que redobla esfuerzos en pos de su ideal, ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar prendas variadas, como ser jeans, camisas, pantalones y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" group is in its first cycle in the "Comité de Mujeres" program.  It is a new group that has hopes to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.  One of the women is Maria who is devoted to selling a variety of clothing items.  She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman.  She hopes for a better future for her children, which is why she is redoubling her efforts towards her dream because she wants to give them everything that she was not able to have.

She is asking for this loan to invest it in the purchase of a variety of clothing such as: jeans, shirts, pants and other items.  Through this, she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: purchase jeans, shirts, pants and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase variety of rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and tubes to sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a charcoal vendor. She works seven days a week selling charcoal on a retail basis at the local market. She has been engaged in her business for the past four years. She reports that her primary business challenges are thieves and seasonality.

Prossy and her husband live in Kampala with their two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives in a rented house where they have access to electricity but not to piped water. Prossy's major expenses include food and school fees.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy more bags of charcoal to offer for sale. 
 
Her goals and aspirations are to expand her charcoal business and to ensure the education of her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and three of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last four years. She gets additional income from two rental houses. She has requested for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT – SACC0 to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, carton of salt. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to increase her capital base so as to serve more customers. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Arif is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Arif began working with Ruma two years ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has had around $401 - $402 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to tend to her coffee plants.

loans.name: Maa Brundabati Shg Group

texts.en:
Labani is a 40-year-old lady living in Tundala village of Kalahandi district with her husband and her two children. In the picture, the lady standing with her raised hand is Labani. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. 

Labani got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her, and formed a Self Help Group named “Maa Brundabati SHG”. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. 

Initially, she started with growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, lady finger (okra) and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. 

Now, she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale, for which she has requested a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 36-year-old married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as efficient. 

She operates a tailoring business to make and sell clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with a good market and she has regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of resources. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to re-stock fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to  re-stock fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 22-year-old married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as efficient. She operates a clothing store and sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and she has regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of resources. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to re-stock her clothing inventory. 

Her business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to re-stock clothes to sell.

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el tres ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sabina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, venta de leche, venta de comida, venta de computadoras y accesorios, costura de pantalones, venta de papa, costura de sombreros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sabina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar la escases de negocios y la necesidad de las personas que requerían el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrescos y abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le guata la capacitación y el crédito que ofrece la institución.

Una de las señoras no se encuentra en la imagen ya que se tuvo que ir a resolver asuntos familiares
texts.en:
The "Flor Kantuta" communal bank is entering its third cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of their Copacabana regional center.  The group is comprised of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Sabina is the president.  The members of the communal bank are involved in many different businesses such as neighborhood stores, weaving sweaters, selling milk, selling food, selling computers and accessories, sewing pants, selling potatoes, and making hats.

The loan that they are seeking will help small businesses where Sabina is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after being invited by a sponsor of the institute who visited her at her home.  Currently, she has a neighborhood store.  She started this business after noticing the lack of businesses and people's need for them.

The loan that they are seeking will be used to increase her capital by purchasing drinks and groceries in bulk that she will purchase from wholesalers in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell them in her retail space.  This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family as she is a widow and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the loans that the institution offers.  

One of the women is not pictured in the photograph as she had to leave to take care of a family issue.

loans.use: purchase beverages and groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as humble and trustworthy. She operates a retail business to sell soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are institutions and individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock due to insufficient funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to re-stock soft drinks. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to re-stock soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of beans, native rice and pepper for resale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business to sell flour, soap, cooking oil, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy flour, soap, cooking oil, and other items. His business goal is to open 2 additional shops within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful businessman. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy flour, soap, cooking oil, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beans to cook and offer for sale

loans.name: Ma. Colimor

texts.en:
Ma. Colimor is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has one daughter who is 16 years old. She owns a store and sells various items including biscuits, chocolates, chips, noodles, sugar, soap, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce. 

She asks for a loan to buy plywood, paints and nails that will help renovate her store and home. She hopes to save the profits to support her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy plywood, paints and nails.

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es: María tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 18 años y su hijo de 8 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. María se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de verduras y ropa usada en las principales zonas de su localidad. Su deseo es dar a su hija e hijo mejores condiciones de vida para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y considera que de esta forma logrará aumentar las ventas como sus ingresos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar verduras y ropa (papas, zanahorias, cebollas, tomates, blusas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, etc.). Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así lograr ampliar su negocio tal como se lo propone.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and lives in a home that she owns with her 18 year old daughter and 8 year old son who attend their local public school.  María is known for being an enterprising woman who for the past 25 years has worked selling vegetables and used clothing in the main areas of their city.  Her dream is to give her daughter and son the best living conditions, which is why she has made the decision to invest in her business as it is her primary source of income and she believes that by doing so she will be able to increase her sales and income.

She is seeking this loan from FUSAI to purchase vegetables and clothing (potatoes, carrots, onions, tomatoes, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, etc.).  She hopes to be able to receive this funding and be able to expand her business as she plans.

loans.use: purchase potatoes, carrots, onions, tomatoes, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and food container s to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish, and others items to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Maria Isabel tiene un grado de educación de primaria incompleta cursando únicamente solo su primer año no pudiendo terminar por la falta de recursos económicos en su familia ya que sus padres son personas humildemente económica. Ella es madre soltera de un solo hijo quien es su único apoyo en las diferentes actividades de campo y el administrador de sus cultivos quien tiene un grado de estudio de primaria completa. Ella es agricultora por vocación siendo sus padres quienes le instruyeran en esta actividad como lo es el cultivo de hortalizas (zanahoria). Por más de 20 años se ha dedicado a esta actividad la cual ha sido medio de ingreso para cubrir las diferentes necesidades que diariamente surgen. También a muy temprana edad aprendió la alfarería gracias a sus padres teniendo su mercado para dichos productos a 20 kilómetros de su casa de habitación para la venta de su producto el cual es transportado en el autobús de ruta de la zona.
Sus metas mejorar su calidad de vida, aumentar sus áreas cultivos para poder sembrar diversificación de producto el cual pueda atraer más clientes y generar mayores ingresos. Fortalecer el patrimonio para el futuro de su hijo quien es su único apoyo en el campo. Doña Maria Isabel solicita apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que podrá asistir sus cultivos de zanahoria para poder al final de la cosecha obtener un producto sano y con buen tamaño
texts.en:
Maria Isabel has a first-grade education and wasn't able to finish school because her family couldn't afford it.  In addition, her parents come from humble backgrounds.  She has a son who is her only support in helping her do the many jobs that come with farming and taking care of her crops.  He has finished one grade of primary school.  Maria is a farmer and was taught to farm carrots by her parents.  She has been farming for more than 20  years and it has been her means of paying for her daily expenses.  In addition, at a very young age, she learned how to work pottery from her parents.  They sold the pottery that they made at a market 20 kilometers from their house and got it there by bus.

Maria's goals include improving her quality of life and increasing the scope of her farming so she can grow different crops, attract more customers, and thus earn more income.  She also wants to increase her son's inheritance as her only partner in her farming.  Maria Isabel is asking for financial help so she can buy farming supplies and grow carrots.  In this way, she will be able to obtain a healthy, large harvest.

loans.use: buy farming supplies so she can grow carrots.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Usha is a 32-year-old lady who lives with her three children and husband in Medinpur, a small village of Kalahandi district. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Usha. Her husband, Alekh, is a farmer, and he has his paddy field where he cultivates rice. 

Usha was also supporting her husband in the field, but they did not have much money to buy quality seeds and fertilizers for their field. Then she got to know about Self Help Groups, and she formed a Self Help Group named “Mahalxmi SHG”. After the SHG formation, she took charge as president of her group. 

She took the initiative and brought quality and good seeds and fertilizers for her paddy field and started cultivation by adopting new technology. Now she is cultivating more rice that before. She is proud of herself. 

Now she is requesting this loan, and she will use her portion to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises is a Peruvian artisan who crafts Andean-style furniture and decor items in carved wood and tooled leather. He hopes to stock up on materials for production, such as wood and leather.

Moises has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"At the age of 15, I moved to Lima to study leather and woodcraft with my uncle. After six years' apprenticeship, I started a workshop with my brother who, sadly, passed away in 1980. I proudly honor his memory with my work. 

"Now it's my turn to train others in the family – my nephews and other relatives. Some of my sisters work with me, as well. My art is a medium to express my country's culture and transmit the essence of Peru.

"I'm grateful to all of you who are helping to fund this loan. It's wonderful to feel your support and this makes me want to work even harder for a better future."

Use the link below to view Moises's leather and wood furniture on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5041

loans.use: to stock up on materials for production of his art, such as wood and leather.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase magi, palm oil, and seasonings to resell.

loans.name: María Madeleine

texts.es:
María Madeleine de 37 años, se crió en un pueblo de Risaralda, es madre cabeza de hogar, tiene una  niña de 11 años, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
Quedo huérfana a los 13 años, la vida no ha sido  fácil, hasta el momento tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y avanzar para darle una mejor vida social a la hija. 
Hace 2 meses que no está trabajando y le ha quedado complicado seguir pagando el estudio, ya que la cuota es un poco alta al momento de estar  desempleada.

Hace 11 años que vive en la ciudad de Bogotá, desde entonces ha luchado por hacer los proyectos de vida al nivel educativo. Vive  con la hija en la casa del hermano, Ahora las  falencias económicas no son las mejores, pero ahora tiene una oportunidad que le ha brindado la institución de un buen nivel educativo como lo es campo alto, dicha institución le a brindado la oportunidad de retomar de nuevo los proyectos para poder  salir adelante y capacitarse como una persona que ama entrañablemente el área de la salud al igual que una mejor calidad de vida para ella  y la familia, con deseos de ayudar a las demás personas con los conocimientos adquiridos en dicha institución
La preocupación ahora es como  seguir estudiando, si en el momento no tiene para pagar dichas cuotas, ella se dirige a kiva para que le puedan colaborar para así seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
María Madeleine is 37 years old and was raised in the town of Risaralda.  She is a mother and the head of the household.  She has an 11 year old daughter.  She is an enterprising woman with many dreams of getting ahead.  She was left an orphan at the age of 13, and life was never easy.  Not until now has she had the opportunity to study and move forward to give her daughter a better life.  As of two months ago, she has not been working and it has become difficult to continue paying for school as the tuition is fairly high now that she is unemployed.  She has lived in Bogota for the past 11 years, and since then she has fought to complete her education.  She lives with her daughter in her brother's home.  

Currently, the economic situation is not the best, but this institution has given her an opportunity to achieve a higher education at Campo Alto.  Said institution has given her the opportunity to resume her efforts to get ahead and train in the healthcare field, as well as work for a better quality of life for her and her family.  With the hope of helping others with the knowledge she will gain in school, her current worry is how to continue studying if at the moment she does not have the resources to pay her tuition.  She was led to Kiva for help to continue studying.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, onions, pepper and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water and drinks to resell.

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
Yecenia de 20 años, se crió en una vereda, en estos momentos está a cargo de la abuela, una señora de 75 años que requiere de los cuidados, ya que los hijos no se encuentran en la ciudad de Bogotá, es una mujer  con muchos deseos de salir adelante
Actualmente estaba pagando los estudios con beca trabajo, pero por lo mencionado anteriormente no pudo seguir con ese gran apoyo que  brinda la institución campo alto, la vida no ha sido  fácil hasta el momento, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y avanzar para  obtener una mejor calidad de vida,  ahora los padres no tienen los recursos para cubrir las cuotas del semestre.
La entristece la idea de no poder continuar estudiando, ya que desea sacar adelante a los padres, porque no poseen una situación económica estable.


Hace 3  años que vive en la ciudad de Bogotá  y desde entonces ha luchado por hacer el proyecto de vida al nivel educativo. Vive con la abuela, pero ahora las  falencias económicas no son las mejores, pero tiene una oportunidad que le ha brindado la institución de un buen nivel educativo como lo es campo alto, dicha institución  le a brindado la oportunidad de tomar los estudios  para poder  salir adelante y capacitarse como una persona que desea continuar estudiando en  el área de la salud.
texts.en:
Yecenia is 20 years old. She grew up along a rural path. At present, she is in charge of her grandmother, who is 75 years old and requires care, since her children don't live in the city of Bogota. Yecenia is a woman with a strong desire to get ahead.

Currently, she is paying for her studies through a work scholarship, but due to caring for her grandmother, she can't continue receiving this great aid offered by the institution at Campo Alto. Her life has not been easy so far. Yecenia had the opportunity to study and advance to obtain a better quality of life, but now her parents lack the financial resources to cover this semester's costs.

It would sadden her not to be able to continue studying, since she wants to advance her parents, since the family lacks a stable economic situation.

Yecenia has lived in Bogota for 3 years now and since arriving, she has struggled to advance her level of education. She lives with her grandmother, but now economic shortages are a problem. She has the opportunity, offered by the school, of a good level of education such as Campo Alto provides. The school still offers her an opportunity to study and get ahead, becoming trained, and Yecenia wishes to continue her studies in the health area.

loans.use: to pay a semester's matriculation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more medicine and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Maria Joy

texts.en:
Maria Joy, age 39, is a corn farmer. For the past eight years, she has grown, harvested, and sold corn to earn her living. She lives in Maribojoc, Tudela, with her husband and their three children.
  
Maria Joy has been a member of PMPC for four months. She has requested a loan in order to buy sacks of fertilizer for her corn field.
  
In the future, Maria Joy hopes to expand her business and export her produce to more locations.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for her corn field

loans.name: Hilda's Group

texts.en:
Hilda's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Hilda is the leader of the group. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is unmarried and has no children. She sells produce at the market to earn her living. For the past two years, Hilda has been working hard to manage her business.  

To help expand her business, Hilda has requested a loan in the amount of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to pay laborers for gardening work, and will help Hilda to generate greater profits and earn more capital. 

Hilda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a grain miller. 

Hilda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to pay laborers for gardening work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and generator.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 51 años, está casado, y tiene hijos, él proviene de una Familia  muy trabajadora con años de trayectoria en la producción de panificados de buena calidad y es conocido dentro de la ciudad.
Se animó y con la ayuda de su familia se independizo en el  año 2000, habilitó  su propia panadería con la ayuda de su esposa Gladys y comenta que le va muy bien en su local y que ya gano muy buena clientela, con lo cual ayuda a su familia.
Cesar es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante. El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harinas, levaduras, anís, etc., con lo que podrá seguir trabajando  y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cesar is 51 years old, married and has children. He comes from a very hard-working family, and has spent years making good quality bread products. Cesar is now well-known in the city.

In 2000, Cesar, with the help of his family, decided to start his own business. He opened a bakery with the help of his wife, Gladys. Cesar tells us that the business is going well at his premises and that he has very good customers. With this work, Cesar helps his family.

Cesar is very hard-working and, with a lot of sacrifice, he is getting ahead. Cesar is applying for this loan in order to invest in flour, yeast, aniseed and more. With these items, he can continue working and meeting his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, aniseed and more.

loans.name: Ma.verly

texts.en:
Margaret Verly, age 45, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. She and her husband have four children and live in Maribojoc, Tudela.
 
Margaret Verly has been a member of PMPC for five years. She has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed for her pigs.
 
Her goal for the future is to build savings.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Rajaa is a 35-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and 6 children, 4 sons and 2 daughters, in a small, simple house. Rajaa and her husband are employees in the public sector where they earn a low income. They also have an agricultural land where they plant seasonal fruits and vegetables. They would like to improve their projects and expand it.

Rajaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy fertilizer for their land. By taking this loan, Rajaa and her husband will be able to improve their farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Jenivi

texts.en:
Jenivi is 30 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single, with two children. 

Jenivi has owned a parcel of cocoa land for eight years already and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She is also receiving a monthly allotment from the father of her children, who is a seaman. 

Jenivi has requested a loan to be used to make full payment of their installed motorcycle, for services used.  Jenivi became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) this year. 

In the future, Jenivi hopes to engage in operating a motorcycle spare parts and accessories-dealing business.

loans.use: to be used to make full payment of their installed motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy produce and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 38 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no dependent children. Divina has been engaged in hog fattening for 14 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 3 sacks of booster feed and vitamins for her hog-fattening activity. Divina has been a member of PMPC for one year already. In the future, Divina hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of booster feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is widowed, has no children, is 71 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, the Philippines. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by selling a variety of products. Each month, she earns about PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She is requesting a loan for PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years and her goal for the future is to improve her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia, age 62, earns a living by operating a sari-sari (general store) business. She earns about PhP 30,0000 each month. She and her husband have five children and live in Gango, Ozamiz City.

Emilia has been a member of PMPC-Ozamiz branch for six years. She has requested a loan in order to buy such items as bread, sacks of rice, soft drinks, and cartons of mosquito repellent.
 
In the future, Emilia hopes to build savings and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy such items as bread, sacks of rice, soft drinks, and cartons of mosquito repellent to offer for sale

loans.name: Linda Flor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Frida es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, artesanía en miniaturas, venta de dulces, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, confección de deportivos, juegos recreativos, venta de electrodomésticos

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Frida es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital que tenía y por recomendación de su hermana quien tiene el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen falta un integrante del grupo, mismo que por razones personales no deseo salir en la imagen, sin embargo su madre lo represneto ella esta de pie.
texts.en:
The "6 de agosto" communal bank is starting its tenth loan cycle with "Pro Mujer" through the Villa Exaltación regional office. The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Frida as its secretary. The members of the communal bank have different businesses, including: selling clothes, miniature handicraft products, selling sweets, make-up, bread, making sports goods, making games, and selling electrical appliances.

This loan will benefit the small businesses in Frida's group. Frida herself tells us that she joined "Pro Mujer" five years ago, following an invitation from a friend who was already a member. Frida currently has a business selling sausages and chips. She tells us that she started this business with the little capital that she had, and following a recommendation from her sister who does the same work.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying potatoes in bulk. Frida will buy the potatoes in the markets of El Alto city, to later sell at her stall. This work allows Frida to earn a living to support her family. Frida is single and has one son.

When asked what it is that she likes about "Pro Mujer", Frida says that she likes the health education and the savings offered by the organisation.

One member of the group is missing from the photo. For personal reasons she did not want to appear in the image but is represented by her mother (who is seen standing).

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is 40 years old and lives in Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Irenia has a business selling dry goods and camote barbecue. She earns about 10,000 PHP a month doing this type of work. Irenia has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP only.

Irenia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future Irenia hopes to have her own stall in the market.

loans.use: To buy dry goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en: Elpedia is 55 years of age and lives in Cabunga-an Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is widowed. To earn a living, she gives manicures and pedicures. Elpedia requested a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use her loan to buy corn fertilizer for her corn production. She joined Paglaum November 16, 2009. In the future she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for corn production

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 37-year-old married woman, and a mother of five young children ages 11, 10, 8, 5 and 1. They live in Talibon, Bohol.  

She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now.This is the source of their income. She is also engaged in a food vending business. 

Susana is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Susana dreams of expanding their business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 31-year-old married woman, and a mother of seven children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of her income.  

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other things.  With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  

In the future, Teresita hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a 44-year-old married woman, and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol.  

She has been engaged in a copra business for more than four years now. Copra is a dried coconut meat which is valued as a source of oil. This is the source of income.

Trinidad is asking for a loan to buy materials for drying the copra, like bamboo sticks and nails. With this, she will be able to dry more coconut which she can then sell to the market.  

Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for drying the copra, like bamboo sticks and nails

loans.name: Cerapio

texts.en: Cerapio is a master weaver from Peru who creates hand-loomed wool rugs and tapestries. He wants to purchase cotton and wool to continue production. Cerapio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: "I was forced to leave my home in Ayacucho during the 1980s. Terrorists were bleeding my people to death and there seemed little hope. I inherited my passion for weaving from my parents and grandparents. But the quality of my work is the result of my long experience, and the product of my careful observation over the years. I draw inspiration from our ancient Peruvian cultures, Andean village life, and from our snow-capped mountains." "I'm grateful to Novica and our shoppers — thanks to you I've been able to grow as an artisan and have been able to teach my art to other artisans who assist me. During the past 12 years with Novica, I've expanded from a few tapestries to a wide variety of designs for everyone's taste. With this microcredit, I'll be able to develop new designs for today's decor trends. Thank you so much!" Use the link below to view Cerapio's handwoven wool rugs and tapestries on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/194

loans.use: to purchase cotton and wool to continue production

loans.name: Chhorng's Group

texts.en:
Chhorng, age 46 and widowed, is a farmer. Her main source of income is from growing, harvesting, and selling rice, beans, and pineapples. She is the sole breadwinner for her six children, two of whom attend school. She earns an additional income via her paid-working job, where she has worked for the past 10 years. The family lives in a village in Battambang province.

Chhorng has requested and successfully repaid five previous loans with Kiva partner VisionFund. Her family's living conditions are now much improved. To continue to support her agribusiness, she has teamed up with an additional borrower to form a group of two. Chhorng is the leader of this group. She will spend her loan portion of 1,400,000 KHR to pay for plowing fees. 

She is hopeful that she will collect a good yield, thereby improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Haja from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. For the past 5 years, Haja has established her local snacks business. She began her business because she wants to create income to educate her children. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes purchasing power is very slow.

Haja requires a loan in order to purchase more fruit and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Haja plans to expand her business more than ever. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Carolina Arely

texts.es: Carolina tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Carolina se gana la vida mediante la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Carolina desea construir el corredor de la vivienda dado que cuando es tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento, hierro y arena. Espera poder contar con este apoyo dado que no posee la disponibilidad para hacer el desembolso.
texts.en: Carolina is 23 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and four-year-old daughter. Carolina has been making a living selling fruits and vegetables for a very long time. With this work, she is able to support her household. Carolina wants to build a hallway in her home as, during the rainy season, water leaks into the house. To do this work, Carolina is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy galvanised metal sheets, cement, iron and sand. Carolina hopes to be able to count on this loan as she does not have enough money to buy these goods.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheets, cement, iron and sand in order to build a hall in her house.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 44-year-old married woman, and a mother of five children from Bohol, Philippines.  She has been engaged in hog raising business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of income. 

Warlita is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. 

With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her income. 

Warlita hopes of making her business a success so that it will generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman and a mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She earns a living through her retail store business. Julieta sells various goods and items to the people in her place.

Julieta is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, toiletries, and cooking ingredients, among others. 

Through this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Julieta hopes of making her business a success. In addition, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, toiletries, and cooking ingredients, among others

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy es la propietaria de una tienda en un barrio ubicado en el suroccidente de la ciudad, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 y 9 años. . Cada vez que hace sus compras las realiza en depósitos mayoristas de la ciudad  de contado;  aunque su volumen no es de gran tamaño obtiene algunos descuentos, por eso aspira a  ampliar su capacidad de tener muchos mas productos a   precios competitivos Ella vende a crédito y  de contado todos los días y su rotación es muy rápida, ya que sus vecinos son su clientes principales y están satisfechos con la mercancía que ofrece. En l actualidad Deisy planea incrementar sus ventas,  pero requiere un capital de trabajo adicional,  para aumentar sus posibilidades de hacer compras en un mayor volumen. Esta es la razón por la cual ha acudido  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ranchos, víveres, frutas, carnes, arroz etc.  Deisy inició su negocio vendiendo verduras, pero poco a poco, ha logrado crecer y adicionar productos de la canasta familiar, ofreciendo unidades de medida y peso adaptadas a las necesidades de su clientela. Su meta mas adelante es remodelar su vivienda, pero antes tiene el desafío de competir con calidad y buenos precios y un servicio excelente.
texts.en:
Deisy is the owner of a store in a neighborhood in the south east of the city where she lives with her husband and two children, aged 8 and 9. She buys her goods at wholesalers in the city in cash. Although her volume is not large she does get some discount. So she wants to increase her capacity to have many more products at competitive prices. She sells in cash and on credit every day and her turnover is rapid. Her neighbors are her main clients and they are satisfied with the merchandise she offers. 

Currently Deisy is planning to increase her sales  to increases the possibility of buying in greater volume but that requires additional capital. This is the reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva, the first loan that she had taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy food products, fruits, meats, rice, etc. Deisy started her business selling vegetables but has grown little by little and added basic food items and bulk items adapting to the needs of her clientele. Her goal is to remodel her home in the future but before she does that she has the challenge of competing with quality. good prices and excellent service.

loans.use: to buy food products, fruits, meats, rice, etc.

loans.name: Deanette

texts.en:
Deanette is 27 years old, married, and has one infant-age child. She lives in Pangalalan, Zamboanga del Norte, Mindanao: Phlippines. Her husband is a wage earner but had no permanent work, until she decided to start a new business. Deanette and her husband engage in the "amakan" weaving business, since they both have the skills for making it. Amakan is made of bamboo and is used as a house wall, commonly used by people who are at the poverty threshold level and whose houses are made of light materials. With a starting capital of PHP 2,000, Deanette is earning an income.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 2,800 to buy additional raw materials for her amakan business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her "amakan" weaving business

loans.name: Pedro Cristian

texts.es:
Pedro vive en l distrito de los Aquijes, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja como mozo en una pollería de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede obtener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Pedro está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cama y un colchon, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida ya que actualmente duerme en una cama en mal estad, ais seguira trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener su propia empresa”.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in the Los Aquijes district. He is a young man with a great desire to get ahead. Pedro works a waiter in one of the city's chicken restaurants. He works around eight hours per day and, with his earnings, he is able to prosper.

Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, he will be able to buy a bed and a mattress. He can improve his quality of life as he currently sleeps on a bed which is in bad condition. Pedro will continue to work and fight in order to make his dream - of having his own business - a reality.

loans.use: to buy a bed.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Battambang province, Mom is a widowed mother and is 61 years old. She has six children. 

To feed her family, Mom grows rice and soybeans as the main source of income. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee.  She has engaged in her current business for 20 years, earning about KHR 25,000 per day. 

Mom has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for ages and she has improved her family's standard of living, resulting from the positive impact of the past loans which she has repaid. 

Now, Mom is a leader of two to get a new loan, by forming a group of two for a total loan amount of KHR 1,700,000, of which KHR 700,000 is her loan portion. 

As a leader, Mom will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She strongly hopes that her crop will produce for her a good crop yield.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

loans.name: Ki's Group

texts.en: Ki is a farmer who lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is 49 years old and the breadwinner for her family, which consists of four children. Cabbage is her main product and allows her to earn a decent income to pay her daily expenses. She has been in this business for five years and has taken out five previous loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). These past five loans, which Ki has completely repaid, have improved her family's living conditions. Now, she leads a group made up of three members, two of whom are requesting a new loan for 1,000,000 KHR each while the third borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, Ki will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a greater yield than she has in prior years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Cosuelo

texts.es:
