Doña María Consuelo de 52 años de edad es una mujer luchadora, fuerte y con un deseo inmenso de superarse ya que a pesar de la edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ama de casa y agricultora que desde niña sus padres le enseñaron las diferentes técnicas y métodos para poder cosechar y cultivar café siendo este su principal fuente de ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y hogar la cual está compuesta por 7 hijos ella y su esposo. En familia se dan el apoyo que necesitan para poder asistir la producción y mantenimiento del café así como también la aplicación de abono, foliares, limpieza, etc. Doña Maria Consuelo tiene un grado de estudio de primaria el cual es incompleto ya que sus padres únicamente la apoyaron en sus primeros 3 años de estudio y por la falta de recursos no pudieron seguir haciéndolo.
Sus metas y sueños poder cultivar más café mediante la compra de tierra con un tipo de café diferente para ofrecer en el mercado otra producto ya que de esa forma sus ingresos mejoran, tendrá mayores ganancias y ayudara a que los estudios de sus hijos puedan completarse asegurando su futuro y el de sus próximas generaciones. Por lo que Doña María Consuelo  solicita apoyo económico para la compra de fertilizante, abono, entre otros que ayudaran a asistir la cosecha de este año haciendo de esta más segura y más productiva de esta manera se podrá controlar las plagas y enfermedades que afectan la cosecha de café de no tratarse a tiempo.
texts.en:
Maria Consuelo is 52 years old and is a strong, hard-working woman who has a great desire to get ahead. Despite her age, she doesn't stop dreaming big. She is a housewife and has been a farmer since she was a girl. Her parents taught her the various techniques and methods to harvest and cultivate coffee. This is her primary source of income to support her family and household's well-being. The home is made up of seven chidlren, Maria and her husband. Among the family members, they support each other to attend to the production and maintenance of the coffee crops including the application of fertilizer, foliation, and the cleaning of the crops, etc. 

Maria Consuelo has an incomplete primary school education because her parents could only support her in the first three grades. Due to lack of resources, they could not continue supporting her. Her goals and dreams are to cultivate more coffee through the purchase of land with a different type of coffee to offer a new product in the market. In this way her income will increase and she will help her children with their schooling so that they can graduate and have a better future for themselves and future generations. For this reason Maria Consuelo is requesting the support to buy fertilizer, manure, and other products that will help her attend to the harvest this year. This will allow her to control the pests and diseases that affect the coffee harvest when left untreated, making her more secure and productive.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to attend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Elvio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 26 años, es soltero, el se dedica a ser vendedor ambulante artículos de mercerías, artículos de primera necesidad, verduras y frutas.
Elvio es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante, a pesar de ser una persona joven se está abriendo camino muy rápido y gracias a su sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Elvio is from the city of Santaní. He is 26 years old and single. He is a street vendor of small goods, basic needs items, vegetables and fruits. Elvio is a hard-working person who with much sacrifice is getting ahead. Even though he is young he is advancing rapidly thanks to his sacrifice. He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of sweets, t-shirts, shirts, pants, etc. and in this way continue with his sales. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy sweets, t-shirts, shirts pants and other products to sell.

loans.name: Pape

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Pape, c’est un transporteur avéré qui a commencé à s’activer depuis 1998. Il a d’abord été menuisier métallique ou il a appris le métier pendant 3 ans. Quand il s’est intéressé au transport, il avait mis un peu d’argent de coté pour pouvoir acheter un véhicule, son tout premier. Depuis lors jusqu’à maintenant, il possède trois véhicules dont les recettes lui font vivre et lui permettent de s’occuper de sa femme et sa fille de 3 ans qui se trouve être dans une autre région. Il leur envoie cinquante mille francs à la fin de chaque mois pour leurs besoins quotidiens. Mis à part cela, il a comme autre charge la location de la chambre qu’il occupe.
Il faut dire qu’avec des revenus journaliers de 6000f par véhicule, ce qui lui fait une recette totale de 18 000f par jour, il peut épargner pour acheter un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
This borrower is called Pape. He is a proven transportation provider who became active in 1998. First he was maker of metal furniture while learning the trade over three years. When he became interested in transportation, he put aside some money to be able to purchase his very first vehicle. Since then he has owned three vehicles, which bring in the revenues for making his living and for enabling him to take care of his wife and 3-year-old daughter, who [are] in another region. Pape sends them 50,000 francs at the end of every month for their day-to-day needs. Aside from this, his other expenses include rent for the room he occupies. 

It should be said that, with his daily income of 6,000 francs per vehicle, amounting to a total daily income of 18,000 francs, he can save money to purchase another vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase a motor and doors for refurbishing his vehicle

loans.name: Jijuka Cb Group

texts.en:
Mariam is blessed with five children aged between one and five. She is 42 years old and married to a business person. 

The group is called JIJUKA, which means "Be wise" in English. The group comprises several group members who run different businesses, but they have joined the group to have a common goal of achieving better lives as well as easier access to financial services. Mariam owns a boutique from which many items are sold, such as retail and many more. 

She has requested the loan to buy more beans, bananas, and rice for resale. And she expects to renovate the house using the profits that will be obtained from the business. Mariam and her group members believe the future holds a lot for them as they are very dedicated to transform their lives in the future. 

In this photo, Mariam is in the front row raising up her hand, to be identifiable easily among the other group members.

loans.use: to buy more retail items for resale.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en:
Serapio is a married man residing in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is engaged in retail sales of rice and other goods like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, and beverages.

Serapio is asking for a loan to buy more rice and other goods like noodles, soda, and canned goods to sell. With this, he will be able to improve his stock, thus allowing him to cater to more buyers in his store. 

In the future, Serapio hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice and other goods like noodles, soda, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es actualmente soltera pero tiene tres hijos. Norma vive con sus padres en La Paz. La casa de ladrillo y cemento es de propiedad de sus padres y tiene todos los servicios básicos. Norma trabaja como sirvienta. Afortunadamente, Norma no corre riesgos ni tiene un horario exigente. Necesita crédito para refacción de cocina de su casa, esto incluye compra de cemento, cerámica y otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Norma is currently single, but she has three children. She lives with her parents in La Paz. The house in which she lives belongs to her parents and is made of bricks and cement. It receives all of the basic services.

Norma works as a maid. Unfortunately, she is not able to take risks because of her exhausting schedule. She needs a loan in order to repair the kitchen in her house. The cost includes buying cement, ceramic tiles, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, ceramic tiles, and other construction materials for repairing a kitchen.

loans.name: Khadidiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place ce 09 Mai 2008 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes très engagées dans le développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Khadidiatou, âgée de 42 ans (debout à l’extrême gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est célibataire et mère de deux enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est vendeuse de poisson frais qu’elle achète dans la côte sud pour la revente au marché de poisson de la commune. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son  nouveau prêt, elle va acheter de façon renouvelée 05 caisses de poissons frais pour la revente.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’assurer une meilleure éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was set up on May 9, 2008, the day of its inauguration. It is composed of women very dedicated to their revenue-generating businesses. They all have been living in the same village for several years and maintain good solidarity and mutual support. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and rainy-season farming.

Ms. Khadidiatou, 42 years old (standing at the far left with a hand raised), is the featured borrower of the group. She is unmarried and the mother of two children, which she supports. She is a vendor of fresh fish, which she purchases on the south coast to resell at her commune's fish market. She enjoys good experience in this domain. 

With her new loan, she is going to purchase anew 5 cases of fresh fish to resell. 

The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase anew 5 cases of fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children.

Celestina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Celestina hopes of making her business successful and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 43 года, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей. После смерти супруга, Гулнара очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Гулнара решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. В этом ей также помогли ее дети, старший сын находится на заработках в России  высылает денежные средства по мере необходимости, средний сын проживает и работает в столице Кыргызстана, тоже помогает материально. Разведением скота Гулнара занимается с 1995 года, начав этот бизнес с 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом KGS. В хозяйстве у Гулнары имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, 11 овец, 2 козы. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом- на покупку коров для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также накопить денежные средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Gulnara is 43 years old, a widow, and is raising three children. After the death of her husband, Gulnara was not able to get over the loss of her significant other for a long time. She needed to raise and support her children, so Gulnara decided take her home and her financial responsibilities into her own hands. Her children helped her with this as well. Her eldest son is working abroad in Russia and sends back money home when the need arises. Her middle son lives and works in the capital of Kyrgyzstan and also helps her financially. Gulnara has been raising cattle since 1995. She started this business with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work and persistence, she currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). Gulnara has 2 milk cows, 1 bull calf, 11 sheep and 2 goats on her farm. She has all of the conditions necessary for housing cattle. For the purpose of increasing the size of her herd, Gulnara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows for future breeding. Gulnara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to throw a wedding reception for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: Don Rubén es originario de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a brindar el servicio de Molino. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado incrementar la maquinaria que utiliza y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Un Esmeril y una máquina de afilar. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ahorrar los gastos de afilar los discos y obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Rubén is originally from Estelí. He is a merchant by trade, providing a milling service. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because his loans have improved the machinery he uses and he can provide better service to customers. He has requested this loan to buy an emery and sharpening machine. He estimates that the loan will be very helpful because he can save the expense of getting his discs ground and earn more profits.

loans.use: to invest in a sharpener for his milling equipment.

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en:
Von is a farmer. His primary source of income comes from planting, harvesting, and selling rice, beans, and watermelons. He earns an additional income through a paid-working job. He has been engaged with both enterprises for the past 20 years and earns 28,900 KHR per day.

Von is in his early fifties. He and his wife live in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. They have nine children. 

Von has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for the past six cycles and has successfully repaid his previous loans. His loan funds helped him to raise his family's standard of living. Now he leads a new group of two borrowers. He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 KHR, and his co-borrower is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR. 

Von will use his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his watermelon field. He hopes that he will collect a better yield than ever before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his watermelon field

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Aged 48 years and residing in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang, Sokha is a widowed mother of two. To struggle for a living, she does rice farming and a paid working job for extra income. 

She has been involved for 10 years. This business returns her 27,300 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day. Sokha has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four past loans, which she has fully repaid, and it has supported her business on time. 

Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan with the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the group’s representative, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farming. She hopes this purchase will boost her cash-crop  with a good yield in returns.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farming

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, age 59 and widowed, is a rice farmer. She earns an additional income from a paid-working job and has been engaged in both enterprises for the past ten years, earning her about 32,700 KHR. Thy lives in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has three children.

Thy is now the leader of a group consisting of four members, each requesting a loan. Thy has been a member of Kiva partner VisionFund for seven cycles and has fully repaid her previous loans, which enabled her significantly to improve her living conditions. Thy will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to continue to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Wilfreda has been farming rice for more than 14 years now. This is the source of her income.

Wilfreda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. With these farm inputs, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farmland, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Wilfreda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Som is 34 years old, married and the mother of one son and one daughter. She lives in a village in Kampong Cham province where she earns most of her income by growing rice. She supplements her income by raising ducks. Som has been in this business for six years and is requesting her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking to borrow 2,000,000 KHR while the other member of her loan group is requesting 1,500,000 KHR. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing. She hopes her business will earn enough money to comfortably support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a 57-year-old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with two grown children. He engages in a hog-raising business to help augment the income of their household. He raises and sells pigs to earn for a living. His business started a few years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed to augment his income and also improve his livelihood activity.

In the future, he hopes to expand his hog-raising business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Cholponay

texts.ru: Чолпонай 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Чолпонай - среднее образование, вместе с мужем Чолпонай занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпонай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы,1 теленок, 1 нетель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 0,52 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -картофель и кукурузу. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чолпонай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Чолпонай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Cholponay is 45 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Cholponay has a secondary education. Cholponay and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 14 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Cholponay's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 1 calf, and 1 heifer on her farm. Her monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk. She also cultivates a 0.52 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows potatoes and corn. The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Cholponay turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the cattle, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Cholponay plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to make home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Krouch's Group

texts.en:
Krouch, 53, is a mother of six children. She lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Krouch has struggled to feed her children through bean farming and to supplement her income she works as a paid worker. She has been in this business for more than thirty years and she can earn 26,500 KHR.

Now, Krouch is seeking a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members and each of them is requesting a first-time loan of 800,000 KHR. As the group leader, Krouch is going to use her portion of the loan to buy pesticide, seeds, and fertilizer to support her business. She hopes to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy pesticide, seeds, and fertilizer to support her business

loans.name: Voeun's Group

texts.en:
Voeun is a farmer from Battambang province. She is a mother of eight children, four of whom still count on her as two are in school and two are too young for schooling. Rice farming, which she has done for ages, is the only one source of income to support her family. 

Voeun and one of her group members are in their sixth cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), while the third group member is a first-time borrower. Voeun has fully repaid her past loans and the loans have enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her fellow borrowers are seeking 500,000 KHR, each. As the group leader, Voeun is going to use her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Moun's Group

texts.en:
Moun is a resident of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a 34-year-old mother of three kids, including one schoolchild and one who is too young for schooling.  To make a living, Moun grows rice and she sells Khmer noodles to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for more than 10 years and currently she is able to earn up to 30,600 KHR per day. 

Moun is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully used her past two loans to better support her business and her family. Now, she is leading her group of three to get a new loan. Moun will use her loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to support her cash-crop farming. She hopes to increase her crop yield so that she can earn more income to support her kids' studies.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to support her cash-crop farming

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kimheng

texts.en: Kimheng is married and 23 years old. To support her family, she works in a local factory. She has been with in line of work for two years, but would like to pursue a Bachelor's degree in Finance and Banking. However, a shortage of financial aid is her main challenge. To overcome this hardship, she is requesting financial help from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan to pay tuition. She hopes that this financial support will help her to acquire an academic degree so as she can get a better job at a higher salary to support her family.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Presentation

texts.en:
Presentation is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Presentation is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.  With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus, augmenting her harvest and yield. 

In the future, Presentation hopes of expanding her farm and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Pasac 2 Group

texts.es:
Pascuala es una señora soltera de 33 años de edad, vive junto a su hija de tres años de edad y viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. Ella se encuentra en la parte izquierda de la fotografía.
Doña Pascuala es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por darle lo mejor a su hija. Ella actualmente se dedica a la siembra de maxan y lo realiza a unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que obto por esta actividad porque sus padres le enseñaron hace 30 años esta labor. A través de lo que realiza obtiene aceptables ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Ahora ella ha tomado la iniciativa de formar un grupo, con el objetivo de dar a conocer nuevos negocios para el beneficio de las familias de los integrantes del grupo. Esta idea surgió a raíz de la realidad en que viven estas personas, es por ello que el propósito, es mejorar su economía para que tengan una mejorar calidad de vida. El préstamo lo utilizaran para el mantenimiento de maxan.
Pascuala es una mujer muy soñadora, y uno de sus sueños es sembrar más maxan, para que sus ingresos sean mejores cada día y así lograr el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a single woman of 33 years of age. She lives with her 3-year-old in the department of Suchitepequez. She is on the left side of the photograph.

Pascuala is a working woman struggling to provide the best she can for her daughter. She currently earns her living planting maxán leaves which she grows a few meters from her home. She comments that she does this work because her parents taught her how to do it starting 30 years ago. Through this work, she earns an acceptable income and profits to help her cover her family's expenses.

Now she has taken the initiative to form a group of team members with the aim of learning new businesses for the sake of their families. This idea arose from the reality in which this group lives. They have the purpose to improve their economic standing and have a better quality of life. The loan will be used to maintain her crop of maxán leaves. Pascuala is woman who dreams to plant more maxán so that her income is better every day, along with the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to care for her crop of maxán leaves.

loans.name: Felicitacion

texts.en:
Felicitacion is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with seven children.  The oldest child is 23, while the youngest is 10. She engages in fishing and sells crabs. Her husband is also a fisherman. They help each other raise their children. Her business started quite some years ago. Due to the lack of capital to support her livelihood, she is asking for a loan to buy a crab net and other fishing materials to help improve their daily catch and  to provide their children with the best.  

In the future, she hopes to expand her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a crab net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Ma. Junosie

texts.en: Ma. Junosie is 49 years old from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 12 through 28. For 18 years now, she has been operating a sari sari store business. She sell basic household items like seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food, and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned sardines, cooking oil, coffee, toiletries, and soft drinks. She is hoping that with the loan she will not experience lacking the items needed by her customers. Her income will be for family daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, cooking oil, coffee, toiletries, and soft drinks

loans.name: Lat's Group

texts.en:
Lat, originally from Banteay Meanchry province, is a 60-year-old mother of five children. Currently, one of her children relies on her and is still in school. To feed her family, Lat does rice farming as her main source of income. She supplements her income with a dessert-selling business. Her current business earns her 28,300 KHR per day. 

This is Lat's third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely and they enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, Lat is leading this two-member group to get a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 2,400,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. Lat will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and gasoline and to pay for plowing of her farmland. She hopes that her business will keep earning her a good income so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and gasoline and to pay for plowing of her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ritcher

texts.en: Ritcher is 30 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with one dependent child. Ritcher has been employed as a security guard at PMPC for four years. He earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional construction materials for house repair. Ritcher has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ritcher hopes to engage in retail business to add his income.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Thaem's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Memoth district of the Kampong Cham province, Thaem is 38 years old and a widowed mother of two children. As the breadwinner in the family, she farms cassava and rice as her main business. Her first loan was the original loan for Thaem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loan wisely and it has enabled her to support her business on time. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. She is looking for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 3,000,000 KHR. Thaem, who is the leader, will spend her entire loan portion to pay labor and plowing fees, and to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes that she will get a good income so she can build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To pay labor and plowing fees, and to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza has been engaged in fishing for 15 years now. This is her means of supporting her six children, who are between the ages of 5 and 19.  She and her husband live in Talibon, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy a flashlight, diving mask and fish net.  With the availability of her tools, she can expect an increase in her productivity. Her income will be for school fees and food for her family. 

In the future, she hopes to be successful in both her business and giving her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy a flashlight, diving mask and fish net

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 39-year-old hardworking lady and a retailer since 2000 who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She started the business with a vision of earning a living. She faces challenges of low capital to invest into her business, but has a vision of having a well stocked shop that will attract more customers and more profits. Florence needs a loan to stock sweets, cakes, bread and quencher to sell.

loans.use: to stock sweets, cakes, bread and quencher to sell.

loans.name: Hengmengsren

texts.en:
Hengmengsren is 42 years old and a local villager from Kandal province. She is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school and one who is too young for schooling. To support the family, she plants ginger and edible arum (a type of calla lily) as her main source of income. She has been involved with this business for 24 years and it has returned her almost 5 USD per day. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her past six loans with successful repayments. The loans have helped her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to pay for seeding and to buy gasoline and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to gain an even better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for seeding and to buy gasoline and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy, age 35, is a paid-worker who works at construction site to earn a decent income so that he can secure three daily meals for his family. In order to earn additional income, he also farms maize and tobacco. He lives with his family in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. 

Chanthy is a new borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund. He leads a group of two borrowers. They are hoping to receive a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Chanthy will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide for planting tobacco and corn. 

He is hopeful that this investment will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide for planting tobacco and corn

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is 52-years-old from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in fishing, together with her husband, for 30 years now. She helps with preparing his fishing needs and selling his catch. She is asking for a loan to buy nylon, a fish net and paint.

Marlina hopes that with the loan, she can expand her business and make it even more productive. Her income is for food and savings. 

In the future, she hopes to have a better income and increased profits.

loans.use: to buy nylon, a fish net and paint

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a 56-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 9 children. Her youngest is 18 years old. She has a fishing business. She sells fish, crab and seashells. Her fishing business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy crab net, nylon and lead, to improve her daily catch.

In the future, Bonifacia hopes to expand and increase her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy crab net, nylon and lead.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a 37 year-old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with five children. The oldest child is ten while the youngest is one year old. He earns a living by fishing. He catches and sells fish. His business started more than five years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy an additional fishnet, to improve his daily catch.

In the future, Gregorio hopes to expand his business and increase profitability so that he can provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishnet

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is a 60-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 7 children. The youngest child is 17. She operates a passenger boat that provides transport from one island to another. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy an outrigger (machine for a pump boat) and fuel, in order to continue to serve her passengers, as well as to be able to meet the family's daily expenses.

In the future, Bienvinida hopes to expand her business and increase the business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy an outrigger (machine for a pump boat) and fuel.

loans.name: Mary.

texts.en: Mary used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell amidst increased competition and having mainly seasonal customers. She has continued with the same business of selling clothes and is aiming at generating more profits and a good retirement as she is running out of age. Mary has asked for a loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a 64-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five grown children. Her husband worked as a private driver to support their family. 

She is into a food vending business. She cooks meals for customers in the community. She sells fried fish, vegetables, and other native menus. She started her business started quite a few years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like plates, pans, and various kitchenware, to cater her customers needs and also augment her income.

In the future, Josie would like  to expand her business and increase her business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy materials like plates, pans and various kitchenware

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, age 32, raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years. Her husband works abroad to help support the family, and Linda lives with her 12-year-old child in the town of Talibon, Bohol. 

Linda needs to increase her income, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy an additional piglet and food supplements. This will allow her to increase her sales and her earnings.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase its profitability for the sake of her child's welfare.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and food supplements

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan, age 39, sells maize to earn an income. He is married and lives in Fort Portal. He reports that his primary business challenges are price fluctuations and competition, since many people in the area are involved in selling produce. 

He has a vision of increasing his stock so that he can expand his business into new areas. For this purpose, he has requested a loan. He will use his loan funds to buy maize in bulk to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 39-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows bananas and cabbages. He also does dairy production, the business he has been running since 2009. He faces challenges of weather changes and high transportation costs to deliver his products customers. 

He has a vision of having a steady monthly income and buying more land for farming.

Fred has asked for a loan to buy bean seeds for planting this season.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for planting this season.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 34-year-old woman and a mother of two children, a girl and a boy, aged ten and five. She currently stays on her own as her husband migrated to South Africa in search of employment. However, since he migrated a year ago, he has struggled to find permanent employment and has therefore been unable to send any money to support the children he left behind. Lydia has thus been engaged in cross-border trading to raise money to take care of her children. With proceeds from this loan, it is her hope that her income will increase and she will save money to purchase household assets and for her children’s education.

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources of additional loans and business investments. Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably. Through connections with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their products.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, blankets, and school shoes for resale

loans.name: Yofesi

texts.en: Yofesi is a hardworking, married Ugandan man who is 42-years-old.  He lives in Kagadi with his six children, who are between the ages of 2 and 12.  He has been operating a carpentry workshop to get money, alongside rentals and farming, and hopes to educate his children despite competition challenges and the high cost of timber, which is scarce.  Yofesi intends to use the loan to buy timber to make furniture for selling.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture for selling.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or retail business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, Arlen will be able to sell more and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Марине 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Марины - средне-специальное образование, вместе с мужем Марина занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Марины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также обрабатывает 1,44 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Марина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Марина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Marina is 38 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Marina has a secondary-specialized education. Marina and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 6 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Marina's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows on her farm, as well as a 1.44 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows beans. The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Marina turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the cattle, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Marina plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to make home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila is a married woman and a mother of five grownup children from San Miguel, Bohol. Cirila has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 5 years now. Her husband is farmer. Cirila is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 36-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 7-14. She and her husband are engaged in fishing; she sells fish as a source of income. Together with her husband, they work hand-in-hand to be able to meet the family's daily needs. 

Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, such as a fishing net, ropes and fuel. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business to support the education of her children and increase business profitability.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, such as a fishing net, ropes and fuel

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a 61-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 2 grown children. Her husband worked as a farmer to support their family. She is engaged in buying and selling nipa (palm leaves) which are used to roof typical Filipino houses. Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to purchase more nipa to sell to meet the family's daily needs.

In the future, Gregoria would like to expand her business to improve her livelihood status and to save for the coming of old age.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa (palm leaves).

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 39-year-old married man, with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling produce, maize and beans, along with farming for extra income. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and seasonal changes that reduce his productivity and income. However, he has a dream of growing his business into a big produce store in town. Ibrahim needs a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 22 years old and the first born in his family. He is a continuing student at Kenyatta University. He participated in the Junior Achievement Kenya entrepreneurship program in the year 2009, and that is when his entrepreneurial acumen was awakened. He is passionate about information technology, and he has invested his time in developing his skills and competencies in this area.

Kennedy has been offering software related products and electronic repair services to his fellow students at the university over the last two years. This business has given him enough profit to pay for part of his university tuition and also cater to his personal needs. 

The loan will help him expand the range of services he offers his clients to include design work and effective software management, leading to increase in his business revenues.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for increasing the range of services offered, such as design, animation and remote assistance; an external hard drive to store information and softwares; a portable dvd drive for the clients who's laptop lacks a built-in dvd drive; an electric blower for cleaning computers; and lastly a toolkit that will assist in opening up the devices.

loans.name: Florie Ann

texts.en: Florie Ann is a married woman and a mother of two young children. She lives in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in retail sales for her income. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like rice, noodles, snack foods, soap and toiletries, and to pay her children's school fees. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like rice, noodles, snack foods, soap and toiletries, and to pay  her children's school fees.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Madame Oumy revient pour la troisième fois solliciter un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter de la marchandise en vue de la commercialiser ici, au Sénégal, comme en Gambie. Son activité consiste à se faire confectionner des draps de lit, qu’elle exporte chez sa cousine qui vit en France et qui va lui vendre le produit là bas. Elle achète des tissus, des parfums, du savon venant du Mali, pour revendre. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de sept ans dans ce domaine et ses bénéfices sont reversés dans l’activité pour maximiser le profit. 
Âgée de 44 ans, Oumy est mariée et mère de 3enfants dont l’ainée, âgée de 22 ans, qui s’est mariée, et les deux autres, des garçons.
Les crédits reçus ont eu un impact positif dans son commerce car cela lui a permis de diversifier ses produits et services et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires  de son foyer.
Oumy veut devenir autonome dans son commerce, avoir sa propre maison, la mettre en location pour avoir d’autres revenus supplémentaires.
texts.en:
Oumy has requested a third loan to help her buy goods to sell in Senegal and Gambia. She runs a business producing bed sheets, which are sold for her in France by her cousin who lives there. She also buys cloth, perfumes and soap from Mali, which she resells. She has more than seven years’ experience in this area and the money she makes goes back into the business to maximise profits. 

Oumy is 44 years old and married. She has three children: a daughter aged 22, who is married, and two younger boys. The loans she has received have had a positive impact on her business, as they have enabled her to diversify her products and services and buy better food for her family.

Oumy would like to become independent in her business, and buy a house to let out for additional income.

loans.use: to buy cloth, soap and perfumes from Mali to resell.

loans.name: Jestoni

texts.en:
Jestoni is a 23-year-old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with one child. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells toiletries, condiments and various groceries. He also goes fishing, which provides an additional source of living. His variety store business started almost four years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy additional stock for the store such as rice, corn, soap and beverages.

In the future, Jestoni would like to expand his business and increase profitability so that he can improve the welfare of his child.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his store, such as rice, corn, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 55-year-old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His business is tailoring alongside selling bananas. These are the businesses he started with a vision of employing himself. He is facing challenges of low capital; however, he has a vision of expanding his business and educating his children to higher levels of learning. Robert has asked for a loan to buy uniform materials for selling to schools.

loans.use: to buy uniform materials for selling to schools.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ben est composé de quatre  femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fruits, légumes, charbon du bois et tamarins. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits et légumes (mangues, papayes et pommes de terre). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5sacs de pommes de terre, une charretée de mangue et 3 corbeilles de papayes en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Sabalibougou à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Korotoumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Ben group consists of four married women, who all live with their husbands and children in nuclear families. On average, they are 31 and have five children. They all live in Sabalibougou, a neighbourhood in the Bamako district, and know each other through being relatives, neighbours and friends.

The group members run small businesses selling fruit, vegetables, charcoal and tamarinds. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Korotoumou (pictured sitting on the left) has an excellent reputation in her business selling fruit and vegetables (mangoes, papaya and potatoes). She will use her loan to buy five sacks of potatoes, a cartload of mangoes and three baskets of papaya wholesale in Bamako. She will then resell the fruit to individuals in Sabalibougou, mainly women. 

Korotoumou hopes this loan will help her make an average of 40,000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to reinvest in the business and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy mangoes.

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Finèsse est composé de 4 femmes monogames et 4 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 34ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (aubergines, tomates, choux et poivrons), habits, produits cosmétiques et poissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assétou (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (aubergine, tomates, choux, poivrons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de tomates, 2 sacs de choux, 2 sacs de poivrons et 3 sacs d’aubergines en gros à Bamako.La revente se fait en détails à Sabalibougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Assétou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
There are eight women in the Finesse group, four of whom live in monogamous households and four of whom in polygamous households. On average, they are 34 and have three children. They all live in Sabalibougou, a neighbourhood in the Bamako district, and know each other through being neighbours. 

The group members run small businesses selling produce (aubergines, tomatoes, cabbages and peppers), clothing, cosmetic products and fish. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Assetou (pictured sitting second from the right) is known for her produce (aubergines, tomatoes, cabbages and peppers). She will use her loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes, two sacks of cabbages, two sacks of peppers and three sacks of aubergines wholesale in Bamako. She will then resell the produce to individuals in Sabalibougou, mainly women. 

With this loan, Assetou hopes to make 50,000 CFA francs a month, which she will reinvest in her business. Like the other members of the group, she hopes that this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso will help her make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Modou, âgé de 38 ans, s’active dans le commerce de ciment depuis 6 ans maintenant. Il est célibataire sans enfant et loge chez une tante. Allant avec ses propres moyens, le bénéfice n’était pas consistant, c’est pourquoi, il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le profit. Modou pourra acheter 5 tonnes de ciment à 54 000F la tonne et pourra obtenir un bénéfice de 4 000F par sac de ciment vendu dont une marge totale de 130 000F. Modou se procure la marchandise à partir de l’usine de ciment et va livrer vers Joal où il compte la plupart de sa clientèle. Les camions de chargement passent dès fois la nuit dans l’usine afin de charger tôt car il y a beaucoup d’acheteurs. Entre 8h et 17h, il a fini de livrer.
Dans ses projets futurs, Modou envisage de faire de l’élevage et souhaite ouvrir un grand magasin où il pourra stocker du ciment.
texts.en:
Modou is 38 years old and has been in the cement business for six years now. He is single, has no children and lives with an aunt. 

With his own money, he was unable to make a regular income, so he is requesting a loan to increase his profits. 

Modou will be able to buy five tonnes of cement at 54,000 CFA francs per tonne, for which he can take 4,000 CFA francs per sack, giving a total margin of 130,000 CFA francs. He buys the cement at the cement factory and delivers it in the Joal area, where most of his customers live. Sometimes the trucks used to transport the cement remain in the factor overnight, as there are many customers so they need to be loaded early. He completes his deliveries between 8am and 5pm.

In the future, Modou plans to raise livestock and would also like to open a large warehouse where he could store cement.

loans.use: to buy five tonnes of cement to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Bakbubu

texts.ru: Бакбубу 62 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Бакбубу - средне-специальное образование, окончила техникум, по специальности -расчетный бухгалтер. Трудовую деятельность начала заведующей детского садика. Затем много лет проработала расчетным бухгалтером. В настоящее время пенсионерка. По характеру Бакбубу очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Бакбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бакбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 40 овец, также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и картофель. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бакбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бакбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bakbubu is 62 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising six children. Bakbubu has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from a technical college and has a payroll accounting degree. Her professional career began as a kindergarten supervisor. Then she worked for many years as a payroll accountant. She is currently retired. Bakbubu is very responsible, gregarious and cheerful by nature. Bakbubu and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 16 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bakbubu's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 3 calves and 40 sheep on her farm, as well as a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows beans and potatoes. The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Bakbubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy horses to increase the size of her herd. Bakbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to make home repairs.

loans.use: to buy horses.

loans.name: Kanyshay

texts.ru: Канышай 52 года, вдова, воспитывает 4 детей. После смерти супруга, Канышай очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Канышай решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. Разведением скота занимается с 1990 года, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом KGS. В хозяйстве у Канышай имеется: 4 дойные коровы, также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,0 ГА на котором выращивает клевер. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Канышай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом-на покупку коров для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Канышай планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также построить новое помещение для содержания скота.
texts.en: Kanyshay is 52 years old, a widow, and is raising four children. After the death of her husband, Kanyshay was not able to get over the loss of her significant other for a long time. She needed to raise and support her children, so Kanyshay decided take her home and her financial responsibilities into her own hands. Kanyshay has been raising cattle since 1990. She started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work and persistence, she currently makes a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). Kanyshay has 4 milk cows on her farm, as well as a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows clover. For the purpose of increasing the size of her herd, Kanyshay turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows for future breeding. Kanyshay plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new barn for housing her cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Jacob is married and has five children. He is a businessman and he also undertakes farming with his wife. They have been farming for 30 years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and they also rear livestock. Jacob is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey and the bees will help in pollinating their crops.
 
This is Jacob's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the income from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and improve his life generally. Jacob's hope for the future is to develop his commercial plot and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has six children. He lives in Kitale in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Joseph operates a business cultivating farms using tractors for a fee. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 20 years and they are currently growing maize, beans, peas, vegetables, trees, and bananas. Joseph is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

Joseph is requesting his first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy high-grade cows. Joseph's hope for the future is to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla, age 49, earns an income from fishing. She and her husband started fishing for a living 12 years ago. They have five children, ages 14 to 29, and live in the town of Getafe, Bohol. 

Merla is requesting a loan in order to buy fish netting and fuel. She tells us that she only needs a little help so that she can continue her business. The increased income generated from this loan investment will provide food for the family and will allow Merla to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, she hopes that her children can be well-educated and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fish netting and fuel

loans.name: Joy Frances

texts.en:
Joy Frances is 44 years old, married, and has one child. She is from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store and sells basic commodities like noodles, sugar, soap, and dry goods, which she has been doing for four years. 

Joy Frances requested a loan, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell and attract more customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Элнуре 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Элнуры - средне-специальное образование, окончила училище, по специальности -контролер-кассир. Трудовую деятельность начала в Банке, затем работала кассиром на вокзале, в данное время работает посудомойщицей в частном кафе. По характеру Элнура очень ответственная, общительная, трудолюбивая. Вместе с мужем Элнура дополнительно занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Элнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 теленок, 1 лошадь, 1 дойная корова, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 0,90 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и картофель. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элнура обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение помещения для содержания скота.
texts.en: Elnura is 48 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Elnura has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from a vocational college and has a head cashier degree. Her professional career began in a bank, then she worked as a cashier at a train station. Now she works as a dish washer in a private cafe. Elnura is very responsible, gregarious and cheerful by nature. Elnura and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 15 years ago with 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Elnura's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 calf, 1 horse and 8 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). She also cultivates a 0.90 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows beans, and potatoes. The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Elnura turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd. Elnura plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to expand the barn where she houses her livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and to pay for labor so she can start building her house.

loans.name: Fatima Fabiao

texts.pt:
A Sra.Fatims de 33 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 1 filho que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ela è uma Tecnica Administrativa no Centro de Saude a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, barrotes, janelas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao de sua casa.
Tem como garnde desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e dar continuidade com os estudos no ensino superior.
texts.en:
Fatima is 33 years old and single. She has a son who attends elementary school. She has been an administrative assistant for a health center for over five years.
With the current loan she'll purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and pay for labor so that she can continue building her house.
The big challenge she faces is improving her living conditions and moving forward with her higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 3-14. Mylene is engaged in raising hogs and a transportation business. Her husband drives their tricycle for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, tires and wood for house renovation. Mylene is optimistic that with additional capital, she can further expand her business for a better profit. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger income and a chance to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, tires and wood for house renovation.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 29-year-old fisherman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with three children ages 1-7. For eight years now, he has relied on fishing to provide for his family. He is asking for a loan of 19,000 PHP to buy rice, fuel, plywood, crude oil, a flashlight and a diving mask.

Noel is determined to look after his livelihood and to continue expanding to better provide for his family. In the future, he hopes to be successful in sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, fuel, plywood, crude oil, a flashlight and a diving mask.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les sept  membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou  l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou.  Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fruits (ananas, oranges, pommes et papayes), boissons, produits cosmétiques, habits, charbon du bois,  poissons et pommes de terre.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Tata (2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est fortement sollicitée dans le marché de Sabalibougou pour sa vente des fruits de qualité et des jus de fruits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’ananas, 3 corbeilles de papaye, 5 cartons de pomme et 2 sacs d’orange en gros au marché de Médine Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché de Sabalibougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Tata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous families, the seven members of the Danaya group are on average 33 years old and have four children. They all live in Sabalibougou  in one of the neighborhoods in the Bamako district and met each other through neighbors and their businesses in the Sabalibougou market. The group members run businesses in selling fruit (pineapple, oranges, apples, and papayas), beverages, cosmetic products, clothing, charcoal, fish, and potatoes. In the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Mrs. Tata (second woman seated from the left) is heavily solicited in the Sabalibougou market for her quality fruit and fruit juices. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of pineapple, 3 baskets of papaya, 5 boxes of apples, and 2 sacks of oranges in bulk at the market in Médine Bamako. She sells these at retail at the Sabalibougou market to a clientele consisting mainly of women. Mrs. Tata plans to have an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business in order to increase business volume.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 2 to 13. Merlina is engaged in farming rice and raising hogs for income. Her business has been in existence for almost two years now. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, fertilizer and seedlings. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and increased profitability. She hopes to expand her business so that her children can finish their studies and have a good life.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a 42-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of a 13-year-old daughter. Her husband is a fisherman. He usually catches fish and crabs for a living. Myrna is engaged in fishing and selling her husband's catch. She sells fish to customers in her community. Myrna requested a loan to buy fish net in order to replace the old one. In the future, Myrna would like to expand her business to support her family and save for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy fish net.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 25-year-old married and hardworking man living in Kagadi-Uganda with no children. He has been selling films and radios since 2009 to sustain his needs and hopes to have higher sales with higher stock. He is challenged by electricity load sharing and competition from similar businessmen. Joseph is asking for a loan to buy a new computer.

loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Raiza

texts.es: Raiza es una joven de 21 años, cuya actividad específica es el servicio de cosmetología y estética corporal. Su principal oferta es la limpieza facial, los masajes terapéuticos y relajantes y adelgazantes. Hace 2 años, cuando terminó la carrera de cosmetología, decidió abrir un consultorio de estética corporal en su propia casa, para dar apertura a la oferta de actividades que había aprendido durante su estudio profesional. Ella ha crecido poco a poco en lo personal y en lo empresarial, trabajando con mucho esmero desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche sin cesar. Los insumos principales los compra a mayoristas donde adquiere precios competitivos  y su mejor clientela está ubicada en un área cercana a los alrededores de su negocio y son principalmente vecinos, amistades y referidos por estos. En la actualidad Raiza está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de limpieza, cremas relajantes, adelgazantes para impactar la oferta de masajes terapéuticos, que son parte de su menú de oferta principal y que día van incrementando sus ventas..
texts.en:
Raiza is a youthful 21 years old and her specific activity is cosmetology and body esthetics services.  Her principal offering is facial cleansing, therapeutic and relaxing massages, and slenderizing.

Two years ago, when Raiza completed her cosmetology training, she decided to open a body beauty consulting shop in her own home to begin offering activities that she had learned during her professional studies.

Raiza has grown little by little, personally and professionally, working diligently from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm without ceasing. She buys her principal inputs from wholesalers where she acquires competitive prices. Her best customers come from areas near her shop, mainly neighbors, friends, and people referred by them. 

Now, Raiza is applying for a Kiva loan, the 1st financing she has requested through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this funding, she will purchase cleansing products, relaxing creams, and slenderizing creams for use in therapeutic massage -- a part of her principal menu of options that increases sales daily.

loans.use: buy facial cleansing products, relaxing cream, and slenderizing cream.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis used the previous loan to buy tomato herbicides for spraying. He is still in the same business of agriculture and is facing the same challenges. He also has a vision of having a constant monthly income from all his sources of income. Dennis needs a loan to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with seven children. Her eldest is 35 and her youngest is 17 years old. For eight years now, she has been engaged in a sari-sari store business. She sells items like seasoning, canned goods, rice, toiletries and coffee. She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of canned sardines, cooking oil, rice and soft drinks. She hopes that the loan will pave way to shelves full of stocks and a better income.

In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business so she can save for old age.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, cooking oil, rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol is 43 years old and a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five school-aged children. Talibon is a place known for an abundance of seafoods like crabs.  She has engaged in selling crabs for ten years now. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fresh crabs to resell. In the future, Mirasol hopes that she will improve her business and provide her children with good food and quality education.

loans.use: to buy more fresh crabs.

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en: Mackline is a 37-year-old hardworking lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been a retailer and a farmer since 2010, and faces challenges of price fluctuations and high costs of products she deals in. Beside that, she has a vision of owning enough stock to increase her income and to enable her support her family. Mackline is acquiring a loan to buy groundnuts for selling.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts for selling.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a Ugandan married and hardworking man, aged 34 years with 13 children aged between 18 and 1 year but only 6 attend school. He lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a retail shop, rentals and farming to earn a living. He hopes to educate his children despite challenges of competition from people with similar businesses and the high costs of his products. Peter is requesting a loan to buy sodas, sugar, salt and beers for selling.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, salt and beers for selling.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in car transport (special hire) and farming as his sources of income. He is facing challenges of high costs of operation and high costs of fuel. However, he has a vision of having a steady income and educated children. Jackson needs a loan to plaster his house.

loans.use: to plaster his house.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунире 28 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Муниры - средне-специальное образование, окончила медицинское училище, по специальности -медсестра. Трудовую деятельность начала в частной аптеке, затем вышла замуж, но продолжила работать. По характеру Мунира очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Супруг работает электромонтером. Вместе с мужем Мунира дополнительно занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS.
