Благодаря упорному труду Муниры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 30 овец, 3 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS) также обрабатывает 3,22 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -картофель, ячмень и многолетние травы. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки бычков, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Мунира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Munira is 28 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Munira has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from a medical college and has a nursing degree. Her professional career began in a private pharmacy, then she got married but continued to work. Munira is very responsible, gregarious and cheerful by nature. Her husband works as an electrician. Additionally, Munira and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 8 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Munira's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 30 and 3 horses on her farm. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). She also cultivates a 3.22 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows potatoes, barley, and perennial grasses. The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Munira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy bull calves to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the cattle, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Munira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests. Maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Joseph is married and has four children. He works in the transport sector and he also undertakes farming with his wife. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize and they also keep dairy cattle. Joseph is excited about beekeeping as it will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Joseph's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his business and improve his life in general. Joseph's hope for the future is to be an established all-round farmer.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Alfayo

texts.en:
Alfayo lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Alfayo is married and has eight children. He is a retired teacher. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now and they are currently growing maize, trees and sugarcane on their farm. Alfayo is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Alfayo's first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Alfayo's hope for the future is to buy more land to accommodate his big family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Thomson

texts.en:
Thomson and his wife practice farming. They grow traditional medicinal plants, maize, sugarcane, and vegetables. They live in Kakamega county in western Kenya, an area famous for its rain forest. Maize is the primary crop grown here, and many farmers also grow sugarcane and bananas. 

Thomson is a retired storekeeper. He and his wife have nine children. He is interested in starting a beekeeping business. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the region, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. Thomson is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some much-needed additional income.

This is Thomson's first loan with Honey Care, and he will use his loan funds to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. 

Thomson's hope for the future is to see his children finish school, obtain good jobs, and be independent.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Jotham

texts.en:
Jotham lives in Kakamega. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage.

Jotham is married and has six children. He is a retired teacher. Both he and his wife practice farming where they grow maize and sugar cane and also keep dairy cattle. Jotham is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income as well as provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Jotham's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his dairy farm. Jotham's hope for the future is to live a healthy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Geoffrey is single. He has a farm where he grows maize, beans, vegetables and chilis. He has been farming for three years now. Geoffrey is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Geoffrey's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Geoffrey's hope for the future is to have a family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Hilda Guadalupe

texts.es: Hilda de 48 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas para el cuerpo, perfumes, desodorantes, cremas para el cabello, shampoo entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicta un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, lociones, cremas, etc. todo por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solictada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Hilda, 48, lives in the family house with her husband.  She earns her living selling all types of personal products like lotions, body creams, perfumes, deodorants, hair creams, shampoos, etc..  Her business is located in her house and she also travels to the various residential areas around her house.  With profits from her sales and help from her husband they manage to meet their household expenses.  Hilda wants to grow her business so she's seeking a loan that will allow her to buy everything she needs including: perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, lotions, creams, etc., all wholesales because she has a lot of clients to sell to at affordable prices.  With the help she's seeking she'll be able to make more profit so she and her husband can have a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale lotions, body creams, perfumes, deodorants, hair creams and shampoos.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita, age 46, sells firewood to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for many years. She also sells dried fish. She lives with her husband and their 16-year-old son in the community of Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City. 

She is currently requesting a loan to be used to cover the transportation expense of delivering firewood, as well as to buy more dried fish to offer for sale. 

Crestita is hoping that the loan investment will allow her to continue to expand her business and support her family's needs, particularly in the case of ensuring her son's education.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to offer for sale and to pay for firewood delivery

loans.name: Madeleine Diminga

texts.fr:
Mlle Madeleine Diminga, âgée de la quarantaine, est une mère célibataire de 3 enfants dont l’ainé à 22 ans. Elle travaille dans une auberge de la place entre 8h et 16h et passe son temps libre à faire du commerce de tissus, sacs et chaussures depuis six ans maintenant. 
Elle a besoin de 300 000F pour acheter une vingtaine de sacs et de chaussures et une variété de tissus qu’elle pourra commercialiser à son lieu de travail et dans son quartier.
Avec les revenus de son activité et de son salaire, elle s’occupe de ses enfants et participe à la gestion de la maison familiale puisqu’elle vit chez ses parents.
Madeleine Diminga, veut devenir un jour une grande commerçante, femme d’affaire, être autonome et acquérir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mis Madeleine Diminga, who is around 40, is a single mother of three children, the oldest of whom is 22 years old. She works at an inn between 8am-4pm and has spent her free time selling fabrics, purses, and shoes for six years.

She needs 300,000F to buy around twenty purses and shoes and a variety of fabrics that she will be able to sell from her workplace and her neighborhood.

With her profits and her salary, she takes care of her children and helps with household expenses, since she lives with her parents.
Madeleine Diminga wants to one day be a large seller, a business woman, to be autonomous and acquire her own home.

loans.use: to buy fabric, purses, and shoes to resell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 24-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He sells produce of maize and beans alongside growing bananas for additional income. He faces challenges of inadequate capital for further investment and business expansion. He has a vision of having a steady income from his business in order to increase his profits. Edward is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma, aged 22, is a resident of Fort Portal and a market vendor at Mpanga market dealing in electrical gadgets. He started this business so as to employ himself. The rainy season posses a great challenge since he operates an open market stall. This is his sole source of income since he has no other sources. He is requesting for a loan to buy more electronics like radios to sell and he hopes to buy a car out of it.

loans.use: to buy  more electronic gardgets like radios to sell

loans.name: Jeimmy Constanza

texts.es:
El nombre es Jeimmy Constanza, tiene 23 años, es estudiante de Administración en Salud de segundo semestre, anteriormente estaba en la universidad pero por motivos económicos no pudo seguir en ella, este año se animo de nuevo pero si no tiene los recursos económicos le tocaría empezar  en el proceso de cancelación ya que no tiene los recursos para costearla.
Escogío Administración en Salud porque es una oportunidad de conocer  mejor la salud, le gusta ayudar y aprender sobre ella; siente que esta carrera es parte fundamental en todas entidades de salud ya que sin un administrador no podrían hacerse cosas básicas y necesarias para mejorar cada día más la atención por todos los usuarios.
Quiere  el convenio para poder ayudar a costearse los estudios y ya que kiva le brinda esta oportunidad seria de mucha ayuda y así lograr culminar el programa técnico con la ayuda de kiva.
texts.en: Jeimmy Constanza is 23 and is studying for her second semester on a Health Administration course. Before that, she was at university, but she was not able to continue there as she couldn't afford it. This year she was encouraged again, but if she hasn't got enough money she will have to cancel through lack of funds. She chose Health Administration because it's an opportunity to get to know the area of health better. She likes to help out and learn about it, and she feels that this course is a fundamental part of all areas of health as, without an administrator, basic and necessary things cannot be carried out to focus all the users' attention on a daily basis. She wants the loan to pay for her studies and, since Kiva is offering her this opportunity, it would be a great help and she could thus finish the technical programme with Kiva's support.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria, age 58, crafts baskets and traditional hats to earn an income. She has been engaged in this enterprise for the past 16 years. She started her business in order to supplement the income of her husband, who is a carpenter, so as to better provide for their nine children, now grown. Hilaria and her husband live in Antequera, Bohol. 

She continues her business despite her age because she does not wish to be dependent on her children to meet her needs. She is particularly motivated to continue working hard because her home was damaged by the earthquake, and she needs to make essential repairs. She knows the value of good work and perseverance. 
 
She is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials such as buri and rattan, as well as to pay for the transport expenses of her finished products. 

In the future, she hopes that she can repair her house so that she can again live comfortably in her home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as buri and rattan, as well as to pay for the transport expenses of her finished products

loans.name: Cecilia Alberto

texts.pt:
A Sra. Cecilia de 31 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 4 filhos todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è operaria agricola  numa empresa de producao da banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, barrotes, janelas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a construcao de sua casa.
Tem como garande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e melhorar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 31 years old and single. She has four children, all of whom attend primary and secondary school. She's a farm worker for a banana company.
With the current loan she'll purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and pay for labor so that she can start building her house.
The big challenge she faces is improving her living conditions and her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and to pay for labor so she can start building her house.

loans.name: Vicente Vasco

texts.pt:
O Sr. Vicente de 27 anos de idade, casado pai de 2 filhos 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e outro sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è Mecanico de profissao na Administracao Regional de Aguas do sul a mais de 4 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, barrotes, janelas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao de sua casa.
Tem como garnde desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e dar continuidade com os estudos no ensino superior.
texts.en:
Vicente is 27 years old and married. He has two children, one of whom attends elementary school and the other one is below school age. He has been a professional mechanic for the Southern Regional Water Administration for over four years.
With the current loan he'll purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and pay for labor so that he can continue building his house.
The big challenge he faces is improving his living conditions and moving forward with his higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, beams and windows) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Ankabin Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabin est composé uniquement de femmes polygames.  Elles ont en moyenne 43ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako Coura l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Tous les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fruits et légumes (pommes de terre, oignons, échalotes, mangue, oranges, bananes plantain,…). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits alimentaires : tubercules, fruits et légumes et condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4sacs  de pommes de terre et 5 sacs d’oignons en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails au Dibida à une clientèle mixte. Madame Kadiatou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Ankabin group consists solely of polygamous wives. They are on average 43 years old and have four children. They all live in Bamako Coura, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. They met each other through neighbors. All of the group members run businesses selling fruits and vegetables (potatoes, onions, shallots, mangoes, oranges, plantains,…). In the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. Mrs. Kadiatou (2nd woman seated from the left) has a big reputation in selling food products: tubers, fruits and vegetables, and spices. She plans to use her loan to buy 4 sacks of potatoes and 5 sacks of onions in bulk in Médine. She sells them at retail in Dibida to a mixed clientele. From this loan, Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business. Her objective is to buy a lot to live on in this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and onions

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 46-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 28, 25 and 10 years old. 

Imelda is into tailoring services. She caters dress-making and any forms of dress adjustment. Together with her husband, they help each other to raise their family. Her business started more than 5 years ago. Due to lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to buy more cloth and other materials used in sewing, to provide her customers with the best and at the same time increase her income.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy  more cloth and other materials used in sewing

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet used the previous loan to buy food for the restaurant, and has successfully continued with the same business. The challenge of high license fees still effects her output. She is hoping to build a permanent house for her family. Annet has asked for a loan to buy food for her restaurant to sell.

loans.use: to buy food for her restaurant to sell.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes, age 47, buys and sells empty coconut shells to earn a living. For additional income, she raises pigs. She started both businesses many years ago. She is a hard-working woman and lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. 

Ediltrudes is requesting a loan in order to obtain additional capital for her coconut shell sales business as well as to buy pig feed. This loan investment will help her to better operate her livelihood activities. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase her business profitability for a more sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to obtain additional capital for her coconut shell sales business as well as to buy pig feed

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, age 26, runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He tells us that his primary business challenges are weather changes, accompanied by the bad roads that cause constant motorcycle breakdowns. He lives with his wife and their two children in Fort Portal.

Dickson needs a loan in order to buy motorcycle tires for his vehicle.

For the future, Dickson has a vision of buying land and building a house for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Ana Rosa Joaquim

texts.pt:
A Sra. Ana de 33 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 2 filhos, 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e autra sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è negociante informal no seu estabelicimento comercial  a mais de 7 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade ( oleo almentar, feijao manteiga, arroz, tomate, refregerantes, caldos, cebola e mais diversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old and single. She has two children, one of whom attends elementary school and the other daughter is below shool age. She has been an informal trader in her own store for over seven years.
With the current loan she'll purchase products that are household staples (cooking oil, beans, butter, rice, tomatoes, soft drinks, broths, onions and various other items) in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (cooking oil, beans, butter, rice, tomatoes, soft drinks, broths, onions and various other items) in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Phon, 53, is a citizen from Kampong Cham province and a mother of two children, one of whom is in school. 

To cover her family’s cost of living she does rice farming. Her family earns additional income from carpentry work, making tables and beds for resale. She has been occupied in this business for ages and it has returned her almost 34,000 KHR. 

Now, Phon teams up a group of three in her second cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each.  She has paid back her past loan fully and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to gain good crop yields, even better than before, so she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel runs a retail store to earn a living. He cites high competition as his primary business challenge. For additional income, he offers welding services. 

Emmanuel lives with his wife and child in Fort Portal. Emmanuel is requesting a loan in order to pay school fees for his child.

For the future, he has a vision of buying land for farming.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a 44-year-old, married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She relies on farming rice for an income. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fertilizer, so she can have healthy crops. Lush rice fields are usually attributed to fertilizer.

Marciana is hopeful that, with the loan, she can expect a better return on her investment in four month's time.

In the future, she hopes to expand her land to increase business profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a 36-year old-woman from the town of  Antequera, Bohol. She engages in making native products, made of buri (palm). She makes baskets and other native decorative products.  Her business started quite a number of years ago. 

Marciana is asking for a loan to buy materials for weaving, like wicker (which is woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture), to improve her income.

 In the future, Marciana hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability, for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving, like wicker.

loans.name: Yubu

texts.en:
Yubu, age 41, is a tea farmer. He also offers motorcycle transport. He is faced with the business challenges of weather changes and high fuel prices. He lives with his wife and their three children in Fort Portal. 

He dreams of having a large and well-established tea plantation so as to generate more income to support his family. For this purpose, Yubu has requested a loan in order to help him expand his tea plantation.

loans.use: to expand his tea plantation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like corrugated iron sheets, sand, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nieta est composé  majoritairement  de  femmes  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako Coura l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ignames, de la pomme de terre, de la banane, de la mangue et d’habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme  assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des tubercules. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4sacs  de pommes de terre, 5 sacs d’ignames  à Bamako.La revente se fait en détails au marché à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Aminata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Nieta is composed mostly of polygamous women, who average 45 years of age and three children each, all living in Bamako Coura, a neighborhood in the district of Bamako. The women know one another through community ties. The group members work in small-scale commerce involving yams, potatoes, bananas, mangoes, and clothing.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aminata (the woman sitting second from the left in the photo) has a great reputation selling tubers. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 sacks of potatoes and 5 sacks of yams in Bamako. Retail sales are made to a mixed customer base at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business, so as to increase her business volume in this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Luciana, age 53, and her husband engage in fishing to earn a living. For additional income, she raises cattle. The family lives in Ubay, Bohol. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000, which she will use to buy fish netting. This will allow her to replace the old, damaged netting she currently uses. She will also buy bamboo to use for boat repair. 

Luciana is confident that the loan investment will permit her and her husband to be more productive in their fishing business so that they can earn a better income.

In the future, she hopes to expand her businesses and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fish netting as well as to buy bamboo for boat repair

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 42-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer dealing in mainly maize and beans. He also gets additional income from preaching, a business he started in 2000. He is facing challenges of weather changes and low man power. Frank aims to own a well cultivated garden that will increase his harvest. Frank has asked for a loan to buy beans and maize for planting.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize for planting.

loans.name: Sokneat's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager of Kampong Cham province, Sokneat is 28 years old and married. 

For her family, rice and cassava farming are the main source of income, generating almost 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Sokneat's group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and they are requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her field. She hopes her cultivated plants will produce better crop yields for her than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Priyadarsini Shg Group

texts.en:
Lalita is 38 years old, married and has two children. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Lalita. She is a native of the city of Kalahandi, but she lives in the village of Medinpur in Odisha, India. Lalita is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. 

To support her family, she formed a Self Help Group named “Priyadarsini SHG”. It is a group consisting of fourteen members. She is the president of her group. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business of growing vegetables and paddy and selling them in the market of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She already has had this business for ten years, and it is going very well. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva for this help.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Laïdou est composé uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Badialan de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’encens et de vêtements. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (femme en mouchoir rouge)  est une grande réputation dans la vente d’encens de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 cartons d’eau de Cologne, 5kg de magnonkissèni, et 6 bouteilles de parfums de qualité au grand marché de Bamako. Pour faire de l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkissèni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant au moins 2 semaines puis on l’assaisonne avec des parfums. Ce produit ainsi obtenu avec des odeurs impeccables  est prête à la vente en détail et à crédits à Ouolofobougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fanta espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Laïdou is composed only of monogamous women, who average 41 years of age and three children each. They all live in the Badialan district of Bamako, and they know one another through community ties.  The group members work in small-scale commerce involving incense and clothing. 

With the goal of building up their inventory, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Fanta (the woman in the red scarf) has a great reputation selling the best quality incense. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 boxes of eau de cologne, 5 kg of magnonkissèni [a type of nut or seed], and 6 bottles of quality perfumes, at the big market of Bamako. 

To make incense, the magnonkissèni is immersed in eau de cologne for at least two weeks. Then it is seasoned with perfumes. This product is obtained in this way with impeccable scents. It is ready for retail sales by going door to door. The customer base is composed mostly of women paying with cash or credit in Ouolofobougou.

With this loan, Ms. Fanta hopes to make an average monthly profit 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land with this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making incense

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, age 40, crafts accessories to earn an income. Her products are trendy and attractive, such as the necklace made of traditional materials she is holding in the picture. She has big plans and wishes to continue innovating and improving her craft for a bigger market. She lives in Panglao, Bohol. 

Rosa is currently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 in order to buy raw materials like nylon, shells, and beads. She is hopeful that she will see a strong return on her loan investment in the coming days.

In the future, she hopes to produce a greater quantity and variety of accessories so that she can increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making accessories, such as nylon, shells, and beads

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 32 years old and married. She is from the town of Cabawan District, Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She sells various fresh fish to people in her community, which she has been doing for many years. 

Epifania requested a loan, which she will use to buy more varieties of fresh fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She works hard raising cattle, farming rice and coconut for copra production. She is asking for a loan of 7000 PHP to pay for labor of the hired workers. 

She is hopeful that with the loan, she can make business smoothly without delay. Her income provides food and pays for her household bills. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profits.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 33, sells DVDs and video cassettes to earn an income. He has been running this business for the past seven years. 

Joseph and his wife Evaline live in Nyahururu and are blessed with two children, ages two and five years old.

He has applied for his first loan in the amount of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. This will enable him buy more DVDs and video cassettes to sell to his customers.

His current monthly income is KES 10,000, but he expects this to increase as a result of this loan investment. He plans to use the profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children and to repay his loan.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and video cassettes to offer for sale

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Im is a 50-year-old mother of five children. 

To cover her daily cost of living, she does rice farming and cassava planting as the main source of income. She supplements her income via a coconut selling business. Having been with this business for ages, she is able to earn about 29,200 KHR per day.  

Including this loan, she and her co-borrower are in their second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment of her past loan. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. As a leader, Im will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She believes that she will gain better yields to support the family in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is selling produce and general merchandise items in his retail shop. He is facing challenges of high transport costs and unpredictable seasonal changes. However, he has a vision of expanding his shop and to have a healthy family. Moses needs a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gas at wholesale to sell at retail.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé uniquement de  femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 42ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (légers, pagnes wax, basins,…) de toutes les qualités et boissons. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariétou (femme assise derrière à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (bazins, pagnes wax, légers,...). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20m de bazins, 20pièces de pagne  wax et 25m de légers en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail au Badialan et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Mariétou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed only of polygamous women, who average 42 years of age and four children each. They all live in Badialan, a neighborhood in the district of Bamako, and they know one another through community ties.  The group members work in small-scale commerce involving fabrics, such as sheers, 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and damasks; and all types of beverages. 

With the goal of building up their cash again, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariétou (the woman sitting in back at the far right in the photo) has a great reputation for selling fabrics (damasks, Wax 'pagne' cloth, sheers, …) She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 meters of damasks, 20 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth, and 25 meters of sheers wholesale at the big market. Retail sales are hawked to a mixed customer base in Badialan.


With this loan, Ms. Mariétou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to purchase a plot of residential land with this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Nyantwire Farmers' Gp Group

texts.en:
William, age 42, is a maize farmer. For additional income, he brews waragi, a popular locally-brewed distilled beverage. He started these businesses in order to raise enough income to meet the needs of his family and particularly to ensure the education of his children. His greatest dream is to see them receive university educations. 

Currently, William faces the hardship of inadequate capital to maintain and expand his businesses, and he is unable to afford the school fees for his children. He is therefore requesting a loan. He will use the funds to pay his children's school fees. 

William is a member of a group where members guarantee one another to acquire a loan. He is shown raising his hand in the picture.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase gara lapper (locally dyed cloths) materials, such as ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy such items as hair extensions and cosmetics to boost her salon inventory

loans.name: Balemaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Balemaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques; Ellesont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako Coura l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Dibida. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (persils, tomates, oignon, ails,…), ignames, habits, bananes plantain et pommes de terre. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme  assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tubercules, de fruits et légumes de meilleures qualités dans le quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500kg d’igname au marché. La revente se fait en détail au Dibida à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Oumou espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 
45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Balemaya are for the most part married in polygamous households. The women average 39 years of age and five children each. They all live in Bamako Coura, a neighborhood in the district of Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Dibida market. The group members work in small-scale commerce involving condiments (parsley, tomatoes, onions, garlic…), yams, clothing, plantains, and potatoes. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Oumou (the woman sitting second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of tubers and of fruit & vegetables of the best qualities in her neighborhood. She intends to use her loan to purchase 500 kg of yams at the market. Retail sales are made to a customer base composed mostly of women in Dibida.


With this loan, Ms. Oumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business and to ensure her children's care.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Jose Asencion

texts.es: José tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 6 hijos. José se dedica  a la venta de pescado desde hace 17 años aproximadamente. José desea hacer ciertas mejoras en su vivienda como reparar el techo, repellar las paredes y construir una pila para almacenar el agua. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que no cuenta con los recursos disponibles necesarios para hacer el desembolso y desea dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 63 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their 6 children. José has been selling fish for about 17 years. José wants to make some improvements to his house such as repairing the roof, plastering the walls and building a sink to store water. 

For the above, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of zinc-coated steel sheet, cement, bricks, sand and iron. 

He hopes to have this financing as he doesn’t have other available resources necessary to make the payment and he wants to give his family better security.

loans.use: to purchase zinc-coated steel sheet, cement, bricks, sand and iron to repair the roof, plaster the walls and build a sink.

loans.name: Ankandieya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Ankandieya ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako Coura un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Dibida. Les membres du groupe font la restauration et le petit commerce de fruit et légumes (pommes de terre, oignons, mangue, banane Plantain, orange,…). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mamou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse de fruits et légumes de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs d’oignons à Médine. La revente se fait en détail au Dibida à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mamou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Married primarily in monogamous households, the five members of the group Ankandieya average 39 years of age and five children each. They all live in Bamako Coura, a neighborhood in the district of Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Dibida market. The group members work in food service and in small-scale commerce involving fruit & vegetables (potatoes, onions, mangoes, plantains, oranges, …)

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 


Ms. Mamou (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is a vendor of fruit & vegetables of all types. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 sacks of onions in Médine. Retail sales are made to a customer base composed mostly of women in Dibida.


With this loan, Ms. Mamou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business. Just like the other group members, she has a goal to increase her business volume with this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Ana Henriques

texts.pt:
A Sra Ana de 34 anos de idade, solteira a. Ela è negociante informal no seu estabelicimento comercial  a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar fardos de roupas usadas que contem camizetes, calcas, camiza, calcoes para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio aumentar o seu volume de negocio para garantir a sua reforma.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and single. She has been an informal trader in her own store for over five years.
With the current loan she'll purchase bundles of used clothing containing t-shirts, trousers, shirts, and shorts so that she can increase turnover in her business.
The big challenge she faces is increasing her turnover in order to make sure that the repair work will get done.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing containing t-shirts, trousers, shirts, and shorts so that she can increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario vive  actualmente en la comunidad de oro verde con su padre  porque antes  había vivido en otro lugar , su padre le ha enseñado a trabajar y defenderse en la vida ,  ambos se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos  además de cuidar unas cuantas cabezas de ganado que tienen con  su padre , lo que es la cosecha le genera  buenos ingresos ya que siempre les va muy bien así que esta cosecha se la venden a comerciantes que llegan a la comunidad a comprarla, el gracias al apoyo de su padre y de su esfuerzo hoy en día tiene sus propias cosas como un par de manzanas de tierra y 3 vacas así que dice él quiere ir poco a poco  haciéndose  de sus cosas para cuando tenga su familia ya pueda ofrecerles algo . En esta comunidad no tienen energía eléctrica es por eso  que quiere hacer este préstamo para comprar un sistema solar  y  instalarlo en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mario is currently living in the community of Oro Verde with his father, before he was living in another place. His father taught him to work and defend himself. 

Mario and his father work in growing staple crops as well as raising some cattle which he has with his father. The harvest generates good income as it always goes well; they sell the harvest to merchants who come to the community to buy it. Thanks to his father’s help and his efforts nowadays he has his own things such as a couple of acres of land and 3 cows. He says he wants to go little by little doing his things so that when he has a family he can offer them something. 

This community doesn’t have electric power and this is why he wants this loan, to purchase a solar power system and put it in his house.

loans.use: to purchase solar power system.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of firewood and soaps to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Alberto

texts.pt:
Senhora Rosa e casada e mãe de 1 filho maior que trabalha,vive na casa própria,e técnica administrativa e trabalha 8 horas diárias.
O montante do empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construcao  (cimento, chapas, barrotes, areia) para iniciar a construção de dependências para o arrendamento.
No futuro pretende fazer lincenciatura, terminar a construção de dependências e iniciar a construção do muro.Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora .
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has an adult son who's in the workforce. She lives in a house that she owns. She's an administrative assistant and works 8 hours a day.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, beams and sand) so that she can start building rooms for renting out.
In the future she intends to get a bachelor's degree, finish building the rooms and start building a surrounding wall. She'll repay the loan without becoming delinquent.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, beams and sand) so that she can start building rooms for renting out.

loans.name: Lucia Daniel

texts.pt:
A Sra Lucia de 30 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 3 filhos, 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e autra sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è negociante informal no seu estabelicimento comercial  a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (oleo alimentar, feijao manteiga, arroz, tomate, bebidas, bolachas, batata, refregerantes, caldos, cebola e mais diversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 30 years old and single. She has three children, two of whom attend elementary school and the other daughter is below school age. She has been an informal trader in her own store for over five years.
With the current loan she'll purchase products that are household staples (cooking oil, beans, butter, rice, tomatoes, beverages, crackers, potatoes, soft drinks, broths, onions and various other items) so that she can increase turnover in her business.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (cooking oil, beans, butter, rice, tomatoes, beverages, crackers, potatoes, soft drinks, broths, onions and various other items) so she can increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora  Martha tiene 38 años  casada y con dos  hijos de las edades de 19 y 16 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio por la zona 16 de Julio,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos al por mayor como abarrotes, aceite y verduras al por mayor para elaboración de sus comidas, la señora Martha es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Martha is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 16. She sells food in a sales stand located in her home in the 16 de Julio zone. The purpose of the loan is to buy wholesale supplies such as groceries, oil, and vegetables to prepare her food dishes. Señora Martha is a very hard-working person. She has been in this business for many years. She is very grateful to the institution for the support offered to her, since this is the only activity with which she can maintain her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food

loans.name: Kagusu Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Patrick, age 64, is a brick layer. In his business, he specializes in brick laying and sand extraction. To supplement his income, he engages in farming. His two business enterprises allow him to provide for his family. He lives with his wife and their four children in Fort Portal.

Patrick currently faces a difficulty of lack of firewood to use in the final process of producing bricks. Patrick is therefore requesting a loan in order to pay for labor to lay bricks. His eventual goal is to buy more land so that he can expand his farming enterprise.

He is a member of a group where members guarantee each other to get a loan instead of security.

loans.use: to pay for labor to lay bricks

loans.name: Antonio Leuane

texts.pt:
Sr  António  tem 34 anos de idade, pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frenquentando o ensino primário, vive na casa própria, é policia, trabalha 8 horas diárias .
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado no pagamento de propinas visto que é ainda estudante universitário.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e iniciar a construção do muro. Terminar a lincenciatura  e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é o seu maior desafio.
texts.en:
António is 34 years old. He has three children, two of whom study and attend elementary school. He lives in a house that he owns. He's a police officer and works 8 hours a day.
The money from the loan will be used to pay for school fees, since he's currently a college student.
In the future he intends to finish building his house and start building a surrounding wall. His biggest challenge is finishing college and repaying the loan without becoming delinquent.

loans.use: to pay for school fees, since he's currently a college student.

loans.name: Benigno Leandro

texts.es: Benigno es un joven de 24 años de edad, él vive con sus padres y es un joven trabajador y responsable ya que es muy colaborador en su hogar, él se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, comenta que le va bien en esta actividad ya que su padre es quien le enseña a cuidar sus vacas. El crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de una vaca. Lo que Benigno aspira es que día a día mejore su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos y compra un terreno donde poder tener su ganado.
texts.en: Benigno is a young man of 24. He lives with his parents, and he is a hard-working and responsible young man, since he contributes greatly to his household. He works in livestock-raising and agriculture. He comments that this work is going well for him, since his father is the one who taught him to care for cattle. He is going to use the loan to purchase a cow. What Benigno aspires to is to improve his business day by day to increase his income and buy a plot of land for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of mobile phone accessories to add to his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and generator and renovate his workplace .

loans.name: Al-Rahalah 2 Group

texts.en:
Al-Rahalah 2 is a three-member group. All of them are female, living in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 from AMB.
Dhekra is a 34 years old and has five children. She is the leader of the group. Her oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest one is four years old. Dhekra studied till the Elementary school, and she got married when she was very young. She has been working as a door-to-door seller for five years to help her husband with family expenses. She has accumulated some money from her business to purchase home appliances for the house, but it is not enough.  Therefore, she asked for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.
Dhekra looks forward to renovating her house and securing a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $2,400 helps Ahmed to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Silvia Nohemi

texts.es: Silvia de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, desde hace 9 años que Silvia se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Silvia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, agujas, etc. todo por mayor para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en: Silvia, 41, lives in her own home with her husband and four children. For 9 years Silvia has worked in tailoring and sewing, in which time she has gained much experience and many steady customers. She is a very responsible person who works with great care to give her best. Silvia is asking for a loan so that she can invest in her company by buying raw materials such as fabric, buttons, threads, needles, etc. at wholesale. Through this loan she will be able to better attend to her customers and not lose the opportunity to earn extra income in order to provide better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, threads, needles, etc. all for wholesale.

loans.name: Al- Irtika'a Group

texts.en:
Al-Irtika'a is a group consisting of four women living in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 200,000 YER from AMB.
 
Aisha, age 39, is the leader of this group. She lives with her husband and family in a very old house that is in need of essential repairs. She is a homemaker, and her husband is the only breadwinner for the family. Most of what he earns goes to the expenses of the family and there is nothing left over for the house repairs. Aisha has therefore applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB. This will allow her to purchase bricks and other construction supplies. 

In addition to repairs, Aisha hopes to renovate the house. Her goal is to complete the second floor of the house and move the family into it, which will allow her to rent the first floor to tenants. This will generate additional income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks and other construction supplies for house repairs and renovation

loans.name: Judite Maioco

texts.pt:
A Sra. Judite tem 44 anos de idade é casada e mãe de 4 filhos frenquentando o ensino superior, secundário e primário, vive na casa do serviço com a sua familia,é professora à 17 anos e trabalha 8 horas diárias.
O Montante financiado será aplicado para  comprar material de construcao  (cimento, areia, pedra, e blocos) para iniciar a construção do muro e terminar a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende  terminar a construção da sua casa, e terminar a lincenciatura e seu maior desfio é mudar de careira profissional no serviço.
texts.en:
Judite is 44 years old and married. She has four children who attend college, secondary and primary school. She lives with her family in company housing. She has been a teacher for 17 years and works 8 hours a day.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks and bricks) so she can start building a surrounding wall and finish building her house.
In the future she intends to finish building her house and get her bachelor's degree. Her biggest challenge is upgrading her professional status at work.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks and bricks) so she can start building a surrounding wall and finish building her house.

loans.name: Al-Mostakbal Group

texts.en:
Al-Mostakbal is a four- woman group, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They wanted to improve their living conditions, so they applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 
Amera, the leader of the group, is a 45 years old married woman, living with her spouse in their own house.  She is an uneducated woman and a housewife. Her husband's income is very low and barely covers family expenses, so she thought that she should find an additional income source.  She decided to sell some of her and her husband's properties and build a small apartment in their home to rent it. Most of the money they managed to get has finished, so she requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase windows for the apartment.  
Amera looks forward to finishing the building of the new apartment and renting it.

loans.use: to purchase windows for the apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is a Hidalgan dairy farmer from Hidalgo looking to improve manure management on his farm. He is investing in an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to provide the solution. His Sistema Biobolsa has an anaerobic reactor that will process the manure, resulting in a number of benefits. The first product generated by the reactor is renewable, methane-rich biogas. This fuel will help Abraham displace the propane and firewood he and his family currently use to cook and to heat bathwater, helping him save money and the environment. The reactor also produces a rich, potent soil amendment, allowing Abraham to improve his soils without having to spend on costly petroleum-based fertilizers. Abraham will also reduce his farm's environmental impact while concurrenly improving hygiene. This loan represents 20% of the total cost of Abraham's Sidtema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: La Señora María sigue con la misma actividad elaboración y venta de repostería como galletas y empanadas,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de harina, levadura y manteca por mayor,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de harina para incrementar su producción ya que está creciendo su demanda, se siente agradecida con kiva por otra oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria continues with the same business that funded her last loan, which is the making and selling of baked goods such as cookies and empanadas. Since her last loan, which she used for the purchase of flour, yeast and butter at wholesale went very well, she is now asking for a loan to purchase flour to increase her production as demand for her goods are increasing. She is very thankful to Kiva for another opportunity to improve her business and therefore also her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale to make baked goods.

loans.name: Hossien

texts.en:
Hossien, age 37, works as an employee in the public sector, where he receives a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He supports his wife and their two young sons. The family lives in Gaza City.

Hossien is presently unable to work because he needs to have surgery on his back. He does not have enough money for this surgery, but he cannot go back to work without having it done. For this reason, Hossien requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay hospital expenses for the back surgery. 

Thanks to this loan, Hossien will be able to recover from his disabling back condition, return to work, and support his family.

loans.use: to pay hospital expenses for back surgery

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi is a 44 year old married man from a small village near Jenin City. He is a father of three sons and two daughters. Fawzi is a low income worker. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Fawzi has a health issue in his back and he must do surgery but he does not have enough money. Fawzi took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses for surgery on his back. By taking this loan, Fawzi will be able to recover and go back to work.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for surgery on his back.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open an independent antique store.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda was born in 1972. She is a housewife who is a mother of five. At home, besides raising her kids, Raeda started first making fake flowers and plants and arranging them as a hobby. Then she decided to use it as a source of income to support her husband financially. She started making them in the way requested by her customers. It has been almost one year since she started, and now she would like to apply for a loan to buy more products such as pots and leaves to raise her productivity of plant decorations.

loans.use: to buy more pots and fake leaves for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1988. He is married and lives with his wife in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Mohammad is the only provider for the family. He started running his barber shop since 7 months. He got his experience from working in previous barber shops. Since he is not receiving a good number of customers because of the lack of marketing, he is requesting a youth loan to do some decorations for his barber shop with adding some shaving tools that he needs to do his work professionally.

loans.use: to buy shaving tools for his barber shop and do some decorations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy straw and fabric for making baskets, trays, and clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 32 year old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with two kids; a son and a daughter. Ahmad works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income which barely covers all the family needs. He would like to start another job in addition to his old one so he can provide a decent life for his family. 

Ahmad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods in the local market. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his income and increase the family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods in the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more chairs and new shaving tools to her husband's barbershop.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara (aparece con su hijo en la fotografía) es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.

Clara tiene 38 años y se ha dedicado a ejercer como maestra de preescolar, ella tiene una licenciatura en pedagogía y trabaja en un jardín de niños particular, anteriormente trabajo en otras escuelas. En sus tiempos libres y durante los fines de semana vende ropa por catalogo y bisutería con su esposo, normalmente lo hacen en un tianguis. Clara esta solicitando el préstamo para invertir en ropa, bisutería y poder incrementar sus ventas. Ella dice, que su trabajo como maestra le ayuda, ya que las otras maestras y las mamas de sus alumnos le compran mercancía también.  Comenzó a vender productos hace 5 años y este ingreso la ayude a pagar sus estudios y poder terminar su carrera universitaria. Su reto es es seguir adelante y tener su negocio en un lugar estable.
texts.en:
Clara (pictured with her son) is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story.

Clara is 38 years old and is a preschool teacher with a degree in teaching. She works at a private nursery school and has worked at other schools in the past. In her free time and on weekends she sells clothing through a catalog, and she also sells costume jewelry with her husband, normally at an outdoor market.

Clara is asking for the loan so she can buy clothing and costume jewelry so she can increase her sales. She says that her work as a teacher helps her because other teachers and her students' mothers also buy her merchandise. She started selling her products five years ago and the income helped pay for her studies and enabled her to complete her university degree. Her goal is to keep progressing and to have a more stable place for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Yessenia Raquel

texts.es: Yessenia tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 13 y 3 años de edad. Ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Ella desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales dado que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado y desea cambiarlo lo antes posible. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera que con este apoyo poder mejorar las condiciones de su familia y contar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters who are 13 and 3 years old. She is an employee at a company near where she lives.

She would like to improve her living conditions by replacing her roof as soon as possible because it is leaking. This is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan which she will use to buy sheet metal and wood. She hopes that this support will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and feel more safe and secure.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in new equipment and tools for her salon

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa, who was born in 1980, is a mother of two boys. Her husband is retired. Asmaa started a small home business in hairdressing a year ago. She also sells dresses. Asmaa has applied for this loan to purchase new equipment and tools to enhance the services she offers.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and tools for her business

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en:
Fathiya, who was born in 1965, is a divorced woman living in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. For the past seven years, Fathiya has been trying to support herself by operating a clothes-sewing business; she also buys clothing to sell.  

Fathiya's business is now well-known in the area, and she has recently received many requests from her customers. In order to respond to them, she needs to buy more fabric and sewing tools in addition to a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season. For these reasons, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabric, sewing tools and a new collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Monserrat

texts.es:
Monserrat es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Monserrat se describe como una mujer luchana, que siempre ha apoyado en todo a su esposo, es sincera y no le gusta fallar en sus compromisos. Su objetivo es sacar adelante a su hijo tanto en la escuela como en l ávida, también le  gusta ayudar a sus hermanos y a su mama. Ella dice, soy una mujer tranquila, no soy problemática.
Su negocio es un puesto de frutas y legumbres que va poniendo en diferentes mercados. Por ejemplo, los lunes en San Martin, los jueves en Palmatitla, etc. El puesto lo atienden entre su esposo y ella, por lo general abren a las 7:30 am y trabajan hasta las 6:30 pm. Esta pidiendo el crédito para comprar una camioneta para transportar su mercancía, es algo que requieren y que los ayudaría a reducir sus costos y ganar más. Uno de sus principales logros, es haber construido unos cuartos en la casa de sus suegros, su principal meta es comprar un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Monserrat is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story.

Monserrat is described as a fighter who has always supported her husband in everything. She does not like to be unable to keep her commitments. Her goal is to raise her son and to help him get ahead both in school and in life. She also likes to help her siblings and her mother. She says that she is a calm woman and does not cause problems.

Her business is a fruit and vegetable stand that she sets up in different markets. For example, on Mondays she goes to San Martin, on Thursdays, Palmatitla, etc. She and her husband tend the stand and the generally open at 7:30 a.m. and work until 6:30 p.m.  She is asking for the loan so she can buy a pickup truck to transport her merchandise.  It is something they require and it would help to lower their costs and earn more money. 

One of their big accomplishments is that they added on a few rooms to her in-law's house. Her main goal is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy a pickup truck to transport her fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: David Abilio

texts.es:
David vive en el distrito de independencia, tiene 20 años y trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas de manera ambulatoria desde hace 4 años, lo cual le ha permitido poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios, ya que actualmente estudia la  carrera de Ingeniería Civil en una universidad de su ciudad.

David está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar el pago de sus mensualidades y compra de libros de la universidad, de esta manera podrá asistir a clases sin problemas y poder seguir estudiando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser un gran profesional”.
texts.en:
David lives in the independence district. He is 20 years old and works in his small ambulatory business selling fruits. He has done this for the last four years, which has let him get ahead and, above all, pay the costs of his education. Currently, he is studying Civil Engineering in a university in his city. 

David is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support offered to him. This will help him to pay his university fees and to buy textbooks. In this way, he will be able to attend classes without problem and continue studying and working to be able to achieve his dream of "finishing his major and becoming a professional."

loans.use: to pay university fees and to buy textbooks.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emérita de 46 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa de un familiar, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir en sus cultivos por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. Emérita tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Emérita is 46-years old and lives with her husband and children in a relative's house.  She makes her living growing corn and beans.  She has been farming for a number of years, which has given her the experience she needs to get the best harvests.  She sells the products of her harvest in the areas surrounding her community.  Emérita already has a large clientele who prefer to purchase from her because of her quality, her good prices, and above all her good service.  Emérita needs to invest in her crop, which is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, compost, pest control etc.  Emérita has good credit references from the people who know her, and she is very responsible.  She affirms that she will be able to pay off her debt in the established time frame, and she also trusts that she will bring her household some financial security.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, compost, pest control etc.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina was born in 1967. She is married and a mother of six children. Because Dina is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to appear in the borrower photo. 

Dina's husband works as a driver and his income is not enough to support the family. Therefore, Dina decided to support her husband and contribute to the household by sewing bed sheets and pillows. She has been in this business for the past three years and has been able to earn a profit.

Currently, Dina is out of fabric and does not have the funds to purchase more. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fabric, which will allow her to fulfill her customer's requests.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her business

loans.name: Kattia Estefany

texts.es:
Kattia vive en la ciudad de Imperial, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo trabaja como empleada en un restaurante de su ciudad, en el área de repostería; a kattia le gusta mucho su empleo, no solo porque le permite tener un ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos, sino porque le encanta  preparar postres.
