Kattia está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, sobre todo porque ha habido muchas lluvias y su casa ha sufrido algunos percances, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Estudiar la carrera de chef en repostería”.
texts.en:
Kattia lives in the city of Imperial.  She's a young woman with a great desire to succeed, so she works very hard as a restaurant employee at a pastry shop in her city.  

Kattia is very appreciative of the Kiva lenders because thanks to their strong support she'll be able to make improvements to her house, which she needs to do primarily because they've had so much rain they've suffered some setbacks.  With the loan Kattia will be able to improve her quality of life and continue to fight to realize her biggest dream, "to study for a career as a pastry chef."

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram was born in 1985. She is a married lady living with her husband in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. 

Maram has been helping her husband with the household expenses by sewing clothes at home for seven years. Her project has been going well. But she is now receiving a large number of requests from her customers, while she is out of fabric and other tools. 

For this reason, she is now requested a youth loan to buy them, in addition to a new sewing machine to raise her productivity.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric, sewing tools and a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf was born in 1970. She is married, and a mother of four living in a sector in Jordan called Karak. 

Etaf started her business selling clothes a year ago; she is trying her best to support her husband in covering her children's needs. She has been selling a small quantity of clothes at the beginning, and then she started expanding her business gradually. 

Now she is requesting a loan to bring in a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season in order to attract more customers, and to respond to her customer's requests.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes for her business

loans.name: Edgar Israel

texts.es:
Edgar es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Edgar esta casado y tiene dos hijos, todos dependen de el. Vive en una casa con familiares desde hace 5 año. El se dedica a ser electricista, hace reparaciones a domicilio, se dedica a reparar todo tipo de aparatos eléctricos.  y tiene algunos clientes desde hace varios años. Su clientes le tienen confianza y lo recomiendan.
Edgar esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar materiales y herramientas que necesita para sus trabajo. Sus logros es que gracias a su trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, sus retos es tener un local donde atender a sus clientes, ya que actualmente sus herramientas y materiales están en su casa.
texts.en:
Edgar is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story.

Edgar is married and has two children. His family depends on him. He and his family have lived in their house for five years. Edgar makes a living as an electrician. He does home repairs on all kinds of electronic appliances and has various long-standing customers. Edgar's customers trust his work and recommend him to others. 

Edgar is requesting this loan in order to buy materials and tools that he needs for work. His success so far in his work has let him keep his family moving forward. Edgar's goal is to own a shop from which he could serve his clients since he currently houses his tools and materials in his home.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for work.

loans.name: Medhat

texts.en:
Medhat is a 20-year-old single man from Rafah. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

Medhat and his father work on the family farm. They plant fruits and vegetables to sell at the local market. The farm is a very good seasonal business.
Medhat would like to improve his business. He is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy a new rickshaw that will help him transport the crops to the market.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transport his crops to the market

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Eman is a 43-year-old married woman from Deir el Balah city. She is a mother of two sons. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Eman and her husband would like to improve their home and buy all the needed stuff. 

Eman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. 

By taking this loan, Eman will be able to provide her family with hot water using solar power.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Gina Susana

texts.es:
Gina vive en el distrito de independencia, tiene 31 años y es madre de un pequeño de 6 años al cual quiere mucho y por quien se esfuerza  trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas de manera ambulatoria desde hace 10 años, ella vende sandias, piña, entre otras frutas listas para ser consumidas por los cliente; lo cual le ha permitido poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar los gastos de su familia.

Gina está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como frutas de estación al pro mayor; de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Gina lives in the independence district. She is 31 years old and the mother of a 6-year-old boy, whom she loves very much and for whom she works very hard in her small business. Gina has been selling fruits from an ambulatory cart for 10 years. She sells watermelons, pineapples, and other fruits ready to be consumed by her customers. This work has allowed her to move forward and, above all, to pay her family's expenses. 

Gina is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to this support offered to her, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as seasonal fruits in bulk. In this way, Gina will continue working to realize her dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (seasonal fruits).

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 31-year-old housewife. Her husband has two jobs, one as a public sector employee, the other at a small accessories shop that he owns. 

Haya has been trying to support her husband in covering their children's needs for 10 years by running a small clothing sales business at home; she buys her goods at a wholesale price, and sells at a higher price to friends, neighbors, and relatives. 

She has now applied for this loan to purchase a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season, and respond to her customer's requests.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra was born in 1978. She is married, and a mother of two. Her husband is a freelancer, working alone. 

Yusra has been working at her mini market for a long time. She started her project 11 years ago, selling a small quantity of food products at her house. Then she opened her own mini market. She is trying to support her husband and children financially. 

Now her mini market is out of products, and she is requesting a loan to increase the merchandise in her mini market by buying a larger quantity of food products, juice, and candy to raise her sales and income, in addition to adding new products.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of food products

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is from the town of Corella, Bohol. She is married and is engaged in farming vegetables and making charcoal out of coconut shells. She works hard to meet the basic needs of her household. Pamela is asking for a loan to pay for the transport of her finished product to the market. With the loan, she will be able to deliver her products on time and she can expect a better profit from her business.

loans.use: to pay for transport of charcoal to market

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1974. He is divorced and has three children, and he is the one who is responsible for his children's needs. 

Mohammad started his own business selling coffee and hot drinks a year ago. His business is his only source of income. 

Now he needs to buy gas so he can make coffee, and other herbs and materials to make more drinks in order to raise his productivity and sales. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy gas so he can make coffee, and materials to make more drinks

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 25 years old from Panglao, Bohol. She is engaged in raising hogs for a living. Hog raising can be done without buying feed, for pigs can be fed with vegetables and fruits and leftover food. However, Juana knows the importance of producing healthy and fattened hogs which will attract more buyers at a good price.

Juana is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements. She hope that this will make her hogs marketable in four months.

In the future, she also hopes to have a piggery to better prepare for more piglets. Juana dreams of living an abundant life out of a successful hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Maria Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 39 years old and from Panglao, Bohol. She sells snacks and viand in her neighborhood. She usually cooks sauteed vegetables, fried fish, pancakes and rice cakes. 

She is asking for a loan to buy cooking oil, seasoning, flour, fish and vegetables. 

She dreams of making the most out of her business, so she can save for old age and live comfortably. 

The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, seasoning, flour, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Merlyn

texts.en:
Ma. Merlyn is a 63-year-old widow from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in raising hogs for many years now. 

In spite of her age, she works hard so that she can support herself. She also enjoy raising hogs. It has become like a pastime for her. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements to keep her hogs healthy.

Ma. Merlyn hopes to have savings from her income so she can live comfortably in her old age.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married woman from Loay, Bohol. To support her family, she cooks barbecue from afternoon to evening for an income.  

She is asking for a loan to buy soy sauce, catsup, cooking oil, spices and charcoal. 

With these ingredients available, Geraldine can attend to her business and aim to have a good profit that she can use for their daily living. 

In the future, she hopes to add more menu items so she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, catsup, cooking oil, spices and charcoal

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 50-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has been in the pottery business for quite some time now. Her business is doing well, but she needs additional capital to produce more. 

She is requesting for a loan to buy clay and pay for delivery and transport of her goods. 

Josephine hopes to continue to expand so she can increase her profits and be more productive in the coming days.

In the future, she hopes to create more and save for other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clay and pay for delivery and transport of goods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from the town of Loay, Bohol. She is married and has been engaged in a sari-sari store (convenience shop) for quite some time. Victoria is also into making and selling Nipa shingles that are used for roofing in most Filipino homes. She is asking for a loan to buy more Nipa to sell as well as merchandise for her sari-sari such as canned goods, chips, toiletries and seasoning.

In the future, Victoria hopes to make a success of her business, continue to improve, and live in abundance with her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa and merchandise such as canned goods, chips, toiletries and seasoning

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea and her family have a diverse backyard farm and are looking to improve its economic viability. They have always tried to maximize the benefits of the waste generated on their farm and are investing in their 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. They want to achieve energy independence at least when it comes to cooking and heating bathwater. 

With their Biobolsa and the biogas stove included in the kit, they will turn their abundant manure into their own renewable energy source, allowing them to displace or replace firewood and propane, saving money and the environment. The system, in addition to generating biogas, will also produce a rich, potent soil amendment allowing the family to reduce their need for agrochemical fertilizer to improve soil quality. 

This loan represents 26% of the total cost of Andrea's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Al- Yasamin 2 Group

texts.en:
Al- Yasamin2 is a group that consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Maryam is 39 years old and a mother of four children. Her oldest child is 11 years old and the youngest one is 4 years old. Maryam is the leader of the group. She studied until secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. 

Maryam has started up her business after her husband expatriated to Saudi Arabia for three years, and she became the sole breadwinner for the family. She is a door-to-door saleswoman. Recently, she has been selling perfumes, incense, and accessories. 

The money that she earns from this business is not enough, and most of what she earns goes to her family expenses. Maryam wants to buy incense making ingredients to make more incense. She has asked for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. 

Maryam looks forward to expanding her business through purchasing a lot of accessories, makeup, and ready-made clothes. She also hopes to provide her children with a safe future.

loans.use: to purchase incense making ingredients

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 31 years old and a married woman from Loay, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari store for a living. Her business consists of selling food and household products like rice, sugar, seasoning, canned goods, chips and other snack foods. The business is the source of her daily income.
 
Janet needs to make further investments in her store, however, she lacks the funds to do so. 

As of this time, Janet is requesting a loan to buy additional items or merchandise to sell like rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas and other snack foods. 

With the loan, Janet will be able to augment her stock to attract more customers, thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales.

Janet hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items or merchandise to sell, like rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas and other snack foods

loans.name: Sookor Al – Badya Group

texts.en:
Sookor Al–Badya is a group which consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB.

Horyah is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. The oldest child is 8 years old, and the other one is 5 years old. She is the leader of the group. 

Horyah studied until elementary school. She couldn't finish the study because of a difficult condition in her family, even after she got married. The income of her husband is not enough to make many improvements to their house, so she decided to help her husband in this side; therefore, she applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to buy home appliances for the house. 

Horyah looks forward to opening a savings account for her children. She wants to realize her dream by improving the living standards of her family, and then buying her own house.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances

loans.name: Geovana Aracely

texts.es: Geovana es una mujer de 24 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales el mayor asiste a la escuela, ella se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 4 años, comenta que también se dedica a tejer sacos de lana y su esposo se dedica  a la agricultura y también le apoya en el cuidado de sus vacas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para obtener ingresos de la leche que vende, Geovana es una señora muy activa ya que realiza todas las actividades que le es posible para poder obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos y de su hogar, la aspiración de Geovana es comprar una casa para vivir dignamente con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Geovana is a 24-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and their two children ages 5 and 3. The oldest is in school. Geovana makes a living raising livestock, she has been doing so for four years. She comments that she also works sewing wool jackets and helping her husband farm and raise their cattle. 

Geovana will invest this loan to buy a cow so that she can profit from selling its milk. Geovana is a very active woman who does anything possible to earn money to help her family pays the household expenses and raise her children. It is her aspiration to buy a house so that she can life in a dignified way with her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 19 years old and lives with his family in a small house. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education. 

He has a shoe shop and has been involved in the retail business for two years. He still needs a lot of improvements for his shop, so he is requesting this youth loan from Ryada to purchase shelves and a glass door. This will help him to improve his business and take a forward step with this business.

Mahmoud is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase shelves and a glass door

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She and her husband are engaged in fishing for a living. This has been their livelihood since they married. Victoria is asking for a loan of 9000 PHP to buy fishnet so she can replace her old one. She expects this will increase their fishing activity.

Victoria knows that a loan will pave the way for her to improve their living condition and will allow her to buy healthy meals and pay household bills like electricity and water. In the future, she hopes to have another fishing boat and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fishnet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coffee and row materials for his hot drinks stall

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luz is 62 years of age, widowed and blessed with two children. After her husband passed away Luz didn’t stop dreaming to get ahead in life someday. Luz would like to take out another loan amounting to PHP 13,000. This loan will help her buy additional stocks of hair pins, toothbrushes, thread, needles and towels to be sold within the public market.

Luz hopes that her “sitseria” vending of different kinds of dry goods will continue to grow. In this way, she could generate greater income and pay back her obligation in full.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of threads, hair pin, needles, towels, toys and toothbrush to sell

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Phượng is 64 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province with no dependents. Phượng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her child to find a good job, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

In 2011, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en:
Sroeun is 52 years old, married and a loving mother of grown-up children. She earns a living with her own farm, growing rice for personal use and for sales in Kampong Cham province. For over 30 years in managing this, she has earned a better income and was able to support her family’s needs and gradually improve the farm from her generated revenue. Her husband and children have given her great support in her work.

Sroeun needs financial support in order to improve water and sanitation for her household. She realizes that all this plays an important role in healthy living conditions. The loan amount will be used to dig a well of concrete rings to ensure enough water supplies for daily consumption. She is hoping that she won’t face water shortage in the future, and that she doesn't need to spend so much time collecting water from far-distant areas, so that she can pay more attention to her business and earn more income for her family. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to dig a well of concrete rings to ensure enough water supplies for daily consumption.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 63-year-old widow from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. For many years now, she has relied on her hog-raising business for her income. This business has been thriving, which has helped in raising her family. Norma is asking for a loan to buy sacks of feed and supplements for her hogs. In this way, she will not have to buy feed on a per-kilo basis, which is more expensive.

She plans to continue investing in hog raising and making her business even bigger for her savings and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and supplements

loans.name: Nerriza

texts.en: Nerriza is 47 years old and sells fish for a living in her community of Panglao. She has been in the fish selling business for seven years. Nerriza has six children. The oldest is 29, and the youngest is 6 years old. Nerriza works hard for her family. She is asking for a loan so she can sell more fresh fish while also meeting the needs of her family. In the future, she hopes to have another business so she can give her children a better future through education.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Nagham** Group

texts.en:
Nagham** is a group that consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

  Abeer is a leader of the group. She is a 21-year-old single woman who lives with her family in a humble house. Abeer finished secondary school but she couldn't complete her higher education because of the economic condition of her family. Abeer wants to be an active person in her family and works very hard to improve the condition of her family. She doesn't just help her mother in the upkeep of the home but also wants to help her father meet family expenses. She decided to purchase a washing machine for the house but she doesn't have enough money to do that. Therefore, Abeer applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB.
    
  Abeer looks forward to purchasing all home appliances for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Hashem Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Hashem Al-Hodeidah is a group that consists of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.
Noorah is a 42-year-old married woman who has seven children living with her in a small apartment. She is the leader of the group. Despite being an uneducated woman, she has her own business. Noorah started up her business selling many kinds of vegetables five years ago. Noorah is making modest profits, but she couldn't purchase different kinds vegetables. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. 
Noorah looks forward to expanding her business by opening a small vegetable shop to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Judith Vilma

texts.es:
Judith vive en el distrito de independencia, es una mujer muy trabajadora, para poder salir adelante trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 4 años, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante y puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios, ya que actualmente cura la carrera de Contabilidad, ella está en el Séptimo ciclo.

Judith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para sus estudios y podrá pagar las mensualidades de su universidad, de tal manera podrá seguir estudiando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y tener su propio estudio contable”.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the independence district. She is a hardworking woman. In order to move forward, she has worked in a small business for four years where she sells clothing. Her earnings from this work help her to get ahead and pay her education expenses. Currently, she is studying Accounting and is in her 7th semester. 

Judith is very grateful for the support offered to her from Kiva lenders. This will help her to buy materials for school and to pay her university fees. In this way, she will continue studying and working hard to be able to realize her dream of becoming a professional and having her own accounting firm.

loans.use: to pay university fees and to buy materials.

loans.name: Teliketi

texts.en: Teliketi  is a 20 year old married woman with 1 child. She and her husband have a taxi which is already in operation. Teliketi needs a loan to purchase spare tyres, brake and steering fluid and parking lights. She also needs the money to pay for her taxi registration. These things are needed so that her taxi will maintain its serviceable condition. She will use her profits not only to reinvest back into her taxi, but also to buy things that are essential in her family's daily needs. Teliketi has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy spare tyres, parking lights and brake and sterring fluid, pay for her taxi registration..

loans.name: Tuấn

texts.en:
Tuấn has a service business shipping goods.

Tuấn is 46 years old and is married with two children.
Tuấn supports no dependents with his business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuấn first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Tuấn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Tuấn faces in life is not having a sanitary latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, and equipment for a toilet.

With his business profit, Tuấn hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks, and equipment for a toilet.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fortaleza está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas prometen poner su mejor esfuerzo para poder trabajar y salir adelante. 
Lilian es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una persona muy sacrificada que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día hasta muy tarde. Se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, que con mucho sacrificio sale a vender. Lilian se define a sí misma como una persona muy luchadora que con esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza village bank is in its first loan cycle with the women's committee program, and all of the members promise to put their best effort into working and getting ahead in life.
Lilian is one of the group members. She is a very hardworking person who starts work every day very early in the morning until late. She sells natural remedies.
Lilian defines herself as a diligent person who pushes hard to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying natural remedies to sell and so be able to keep doing her work.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Hải

texts.en:
Hải is 53 years old and married with one child. Hải's child is grown up, so she supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoá district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hải works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Hải hopes for her child to find a good job, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

The main hardship that Hải faces in her life is not having a latrine. Her family share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Hải's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 22 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her one dependent. Oanh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for two years. With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

The main hardship that Oanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Oanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Vân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.

Vân is 33 years old and is married with two children.
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Vân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Vân faces in her life is not having a sanitary latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a latrine and bathroom.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick o build latrine and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Thúy Anh

texts.en:
Thúy Anh is 29 years old and married with one child. She supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoá province. She has a retail business selling plastic goods. She has been involved in this business for five years. With her business profit, Thúy Anh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

The main hardship that Thuúy Anh faces in her life is not having a latrine. Her family share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rosas De Pucuro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE PUCURO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Magdalena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pesca, venta de queso y venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Magdalena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca y venta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás conjuntamente su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes de pesca) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le guata la capacitación y el crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra un socio porque tuvo que ir a su negocio con urgencia; ademas se identifica una persona de chompa verde que acompaña al grupo, ella es la hija de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The “ROSAS DE PUCURO” communal bank will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Magdalena serves as president.  The members’ businesses include fishing, cheese sales, and fruit sales.

This loan will help the members’ small businesses, including Magdalena’s.  She says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of an advisor who visited her in her home.  She has a fishing and fish sales business and says that she and her family learned to do this several years ago.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fishing nets in the El Alto city shops and subsequently use them in her business.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her family; she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and loans that the institution offers.

One of the members is not shown in the image because she had urgent business matters to tend to.  The girl in the green sweater is one of the member’s daughters.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en: Seneuefa is a 65 year old married mother of 6 children.She has a small garden where she grows pineapples,cucumber and tomatoes  that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.Seneuefa  needs a loan to buy gardening tools such as rakes, knives, digging tools, shovels, wheelbarrow, fertilisers, insecticides, fencing wire, nails for her vegetable garden, and cigar rolls for her tobacco business.She has been a member of SBPD since 2010.Seneuefa will use the profits from her sales to support her family and also to reinvest it into her business.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools such as rakes, knives, digging tools, shovels, wheelbarrow, fertilisers, insecticides, fencing wire, nails, cigar rolls for her tobacco business.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
San Jorge está en el ciclo número 2 del programa de comités, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ysidora quien tiene una despensa, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación económica, ella tiene una pequeña despensa  en la cual trabaja todos los días para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
La Sra. Ysidora solicita de este préstamo para la compra de leches, aceite, fideos, arroz, entre otros productos de uso familiar que ella comercializa en su despensa.
texts.en:
San Jorge is in its second cycle of the committee program, where each member puts forth her best effort to get ahead and help her loved ones.

Ysidora has a grocery store and she is improving her financial situation through her efforts, continuous hard work, and behavior as a successful woman.  She works her grocery store every day so she can help her family through her income.

Ysidora is asking for this loan to buy dairy, cooking oil, rice, and other family use products to sell in her store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Enerson

texts.en:
Enerson is a 35-year-old married man with children living in the Sto. Rosario Province of Isabela. 

He has been a farmer for ten years. He is facing the challenge of weather changes. However, he has a vision of having well-established nursery beds featuring many different types of plants so as to widen his market and serve different interests. 

He needs a loan to improve his farming business and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to improve his farming business and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Perly

texts.en:
Perly previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, and to maintain her tricycle. Her earnings were a big help in paying for her family's personal, household, and business expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain her tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to have a child. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and to maintain her tricycle.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the materials and supplies needed for her farm. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a jeepney for additional income.

Gertrudes would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 15,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more planting materials and fertilizer for her farm. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gertrudes dreams of continuous expansion of her business and hopes that her family is always in good condition. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more planting materials and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y activa, durante gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a ser ama de casa, dedicada a cuidar de su esposo y sus dos hijos pero, desde hace 7 años, con el ánimo de generar ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, ella tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio, un almacén de variedades que ubicó en un espacio de su vivienda, en el que trabaja sola todos los días de 8 am a 7 pm, ofreciendo artículos de decoración, productos de papelería, accesorios, entre otros; así ha logrado obtener recursos que le permiten sustentar algunas necesidades del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina exhibidora y surtido al por mayor (accesorios, productos de decoración y papelería), esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen de su negocio, pues podrá mostrar los productos de forma organizada y tendrá más variedad para satisfacer los gustos diversos de sus clientes, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en las ventas.
Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder acreditar bien su negocio, ampliarlo para poder prestar nuevos servicios como café internet y fotocopiadora, así garantizará una rentabilidad favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 38 years old and is a hardworking, active woman who has been a housewife for most of her life, caring for her husband and two children.  Seven years ago she decided to start her own business, a general store in her home, in order to generate some income and help her husband.  She tends to it from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm every day, selling decorations, paper goods, accessories, and other things.  This way she has been able to obtain the resources she needs to provide some of her family’s needs.

She is asking for this loan to buy a display case and inventory in quantity (accessories, decorations, and paper goods).  This will allow her to improve her store’s image and be able to show her products in an organized manner and have a greater variety of products to satisfy her various customer desires.  This will increase her sales and income. 

Luz says that her greatest desire is to accredit her business well and expand it so that she can provide new services such as an internet café and copy services and guarantee profitability so she can provide her family with a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: 6 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roció es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cotillones, elaboración de tarimas, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de pollos, librería, venta de golosinas, servicio de conducción

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roció es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de telas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital que tenía y con la recomendación de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas del extranjero y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra ua de las socias porque se encontraba en consulta médica
texts.en:
The “6 DE AGOSTO” will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors, where Rocio servers as Secretary.  The members’ businesses include party favors sales, platform making, food sales, sweater knitting, chicken sales, a bookstore, snack sales, and transportation services.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Roció’s.  She has been with Pro Mujer for three years, having joined on a friend’s invitation.  She has a fabric sales business and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation.

She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy fabric in quantity from foreign shops and the sell it in her store.  This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family.  She is married and has five children.  When asked what she likes abut Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. 

One of the members is not shown in the image because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Phai

texts.en:
Phai, 51, is accompanied by her partner who is a rice farmer. They have six children. She and her husband help each other work on their farm in Kampong Thom province. She primarily grows and sells rice and cassava in the local markets. Phai has been doing farming with her partner for over 24 years and earns addional income by selling firewood.

This will be her first loan. She will use the loan to buy a solar panel home system to install on top of the roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, she can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which she uses to support household appliances such as light, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel home system to install on the roof of her house.

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
Crisales is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed supplies and spare parts necessary for her business. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. The income from her business is helping to pay for her family's everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Crisales dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work. At the meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

Footnote: Interestingly, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and make their microfinance loan repayments.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were important for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nenita hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials, such as wire and baskets, and supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer, needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Soledad hopes that her business will be well known and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Sinforiana

texts.es:
La Sra. Sinforiana está casada con el Sr Martín  con un hijo pequeño, por quien esta pareja está luchando. Ella tiene un negocio de ventas de producto de mercerías, librería, y su marido es Policía.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo brinda un buen trato a sus clientes. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares para la venta ya que se está iniciando el año escolar, y es en esta época en la que más ventas tiene. Sueña con agrandar el negocio y dar fuente de trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Sinforiana is married to Martin and they have a young child for whom this couple is working very hard. She has a business selling trimmings and office supplies. Her husband is a police officer.

She is a very responsible woman and very honest about her commitments. She says that through her work she provides good service to her customers. She is asking for this loan to buy school supplies for sale because the school year is about to begin and this is when sales volumes are the highest. 

She dreams of growing her business and being a source of employment for others.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She also has an electronic loading station and accepts printing jobs for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Dolores hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Concesa

texts.en:
Concesa previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells rice and has a tricycle for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Concesa dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes that her son will finish his studies.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Nueva Organizacion Group

texts.es:
En un barrio de extrema vulnerabilidad, vive Luis quien desde muy chico, se dedica a las faenas de pesca y al jornal en las plantaciones de palma africana. Luis vive con su madre, esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 6 años. En este barrio no cuentan con servicios de agua potable ni alcantarillado. 
Luis es el Lider del grupo “Nueva Generacion” quienes tienen en común la misma actividad, ya que es ventajoso para ellos por lo que se encuentran cerca al mar.
Luis al igual que los integrantes de su grupo, esperan con este crédito, mejorar sus redes, embarcaciones, y comprar hicopores (caja que mantiene frio al pescado) para poder lleverlo a comercializar al mercado a mas de comprar tambien arroz, azucar aceites, fdeos, leche, frejol y otros productos para tienda de alimentos.

Información Adicional
El grupo “Nueva Organización” esta conformado por 7 integrantes quienes se dedican a la pezca, tienda de alimentos, y cultivo de pala de aceite. Ellos trabajan en su barrio con el fin de que los moradores gocen de tranquilidad ya que se encuentran cerca a uno de los barrios de mayor peligro en San Lorenzo; ellos gestionan ante el cuerpo de bomberos para que les lleven agua a las casas. Con este capital esperan mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar de mejor forma a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Luis has lived in a very vulnerable neighborhood since he was very young.  He is a fisherman and also plants African palms.  Luis lives with his mother, wife, and two children, ages 4 and 6.  There is no running water or sewage in the neighborhood.

Luis leads the “Nueva Generacion” group, and its members are all involved in the same business.  They have the advantage of being located near the ocean.

Luis, like the other group members wants to improve his fishing nets, boat, and buy Styrofoam ice chests so he can take the fish to the market.  He will also buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, milk, beans, and other things for his grocery store.


Additional Information

The “Nueva Organización” is made up of seven members who fish, have grocery stores, and cultivate oil palms.  They work in their neighborhood so that residents enjoy quiet; since they are located hear one of the most dangerous neighborhoods in San Lorenzo.  They work with the fire department so that they can bring water to their homes.  The all hope to improve their income and better support their families with a better income.

loans.use: to buy fishing suppies.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is a resident from the village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is married with eight children who are various ages. Khoeurn, together with her husband, works in the agricultural sector growing rice crops in their village as the major source of their income. Khoeurn has been engaged in the rice farming business for nearly 5 years.

Khoeurn is now requesting a loan amounting to USD 1,000 to buy excavated dirt to refill the pond in front of her house. This way she can build more on the space surrounding her house and grow some trees to provide fruits and shade. In the future, Khoeurn would like to save enough money to expand her farming business and increase her farm productivity in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy excavated dirt to refill the pond in front of her house.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren, aged 48, is a widowed mother. She has two children, both of whom are married. She lives with her daughter, son-in-law and grandchildren in Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. Ren is engaged in agriculture, earning enough income to sustain her living farming rice on her own farm. She has two cows for maintenance of the rice field. She has been doing this for almost 25 years.

Ren wants to use this loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Ren is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.
